Software Security Engineer Software Security Engineer    Switzerland, Buchs  Reference No: 14121What's the role? Be part of the Global Product IT team and shape the future software offerings at Hilti! We are looking for a Software Security Engineer to strongly contribute to our digital transformation journey. In this position, you will work closely with our security experts, our software unit and other Hilti business units to evaluate and implement security solutions which increase technical landscape protection and compliance. Through your contribution you will enable Hilti to offer innovative, safe, and secure software products and enhance data protection. You will be part of Hilti’s Global IT team, which provides the opportunity to work globally on different projects in parallel. Who is Hilti? We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. Hilti is a multicultural workplace with 127 different nationalities committed to global teamwork. Global IT within Hilti is a truly global team with main hubs in Buchs (Switzerland), Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia) and Plano/Tulsa (USA). All locations have highly competent teams who work very closely together. Hilti`s Global IT team is known for their focus on sustainable value creation by translating latest IT innovations into value creating solutions & services. What does the role involve? As a Software Security Engineer, you translate security needs into technical application design. You plan, estimate, and implement security solutions in an agile environment. You also need to take responsibility to coach and develop team members about security best practices and guidelines in their role. By teaming up with our product/solution owners, you evaluate and develop adequate security solutions and enhance the quality assurance processes/tools to safeguard our applications throughout their life cycle. You are responsible for ensuring our technical designs and specifications adhere to our security standards by initiating design reviews and regular audits to provide the right feedback.   Innovative – In the Software Services the Product IT Team within Global IT, we work with newest technologies to provide state-of-the-art solutions ranging from a global ID management to software selling capabilities within DevOps setup and empowered by advanced Toolchain. What do we offer? We encourage you to grow, not only in this role, but also beyond. Together with our diverse and international team, shape the future of how we globally interact with our customers. You will be based in our IT department in mountainous Buchs, Switzerland, which is conveniently in walking distance to the train station and in proximity to our Headquarters in Schaan, Liechtenstein. You will work closely with your colleagues in our Headquarters, in our Digital Hub in Paris, France as well as in our second largest IT location in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. In Buchs, we offer you subsidized coupons for the local restaurants as one of many perks. Additionally, Hilti e-bikes are readily available for you to commute environmentally-friendly to our Headquarter. We want you to work your best and offer flexible working hours, possibilities for remote working, and-day care for your children. Why should you apply? We have an excellent mix of people, challenging, and developing you every single day! Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background is. Together with you, we will define the best area to start your career with Hilti. What you need is:  You bring a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management or in similar fields – PhD is a bonus You have 3+ years professional experience as a Software Security Engineer and fun in software development Experience in implementing Web Application Firewall (WAF) Familiarity with continuous integration and toolchain (CI/CD) AWS and cloud platform as a service (PaaS) security In-depth knowledge of various web-related technologies (such as Web applications, services, architectures etc.)    Does that sound like you? Apply today and start your Hilti journey.If you have any questions, please feel free to contact Haytham Alzeini, the line manager of this role on LinkedIn. www.linkedin.com/in/haytham-alzeini   Display original ad

Cloud Platform Solution Engineer  Cloud Platform Solution Engineer   Preferred Qualifications   Cloud Platform Architect  At Oracle, we are continuously striving to me the most innovative and customer focused company in the world. Oracle have been helping customers since more than 30 years to deliver business value from Information Technologies and Business Applications. As a Cloud Platform Architect within the fast growing Oracle Cloud Platform, you will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Oracle IAAS and PAAS within our Top Account in ALPS Cluster (CH AT)  Your Role:    Support our clients,across all industry sectors, in exploiting Oracle's leading-edgetechnology portfolio – in the Cloud and on Premises   Support the sales process leading engagement at all levels within both Oracle and the customer organizations.   Partner and guide the sales team to design Sales strategies and solutions for customers, drive Oracle adoption and revenue.   Design and participate in technology pilot projects or proof of concept (POC) activities   Define values propositions, positioning and differentiation to competitor’s products   Lead request for information (RFI) and request for proposal (RFP)   Drive sales opportunities to successful completion   Be an Oracle evangelist. Educate customers of all sizes on the value proposition of Oracle Cloud Platform   Establishcredibility & build deep relationships with senior technical andbusiness individuals within customers to enable them to be cloudadvocates.   Participate in deep architectural / Functionaldiscussions to build confidence and ensure customer success whenbuilding new and migrating existing applications, software and serviceson the Oracle Cloud Platform   Conduct deep-dive “hands-on” education/training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers   Author or contribute to customer-facing publications such as whitepapers, tutorials, etc.   Present sessions at Community and industry conferences.   Work alongside partners and other third party organizations as required   Define and drive pre-sales initiatives in target accounts and territories   Own each engagement, and help ensure a timely and successful delivery of value.   Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the Oracle community.   Understand Oracle market segments, customer base, and industry verticals.   The ideal candidate will possess customer-facing skills that will allow them to represent Oracle well within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel within the company, as well as a technical/functional background that enables them to easily interact and give guidance with software developers and architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think structured about business, product, and technical challenges. You must be interested in advancing your knowledge, be self-motivated, proactive, and we will provide you with continuing education possibilities around technical and personal development skills. Oracle provides a ramp-up program that includes self-paced learning, instructor-led training, hands-on projects, job shadowing opportunities, and a peer-reviewed opportunity to demonstrate your knowledge.  QUALIFICATIONS:    Strong experience on Cloud Platform : Infrastructure and Platform as a Service   Design of Data Center-level computing architectures, Cloud, or Hybrid solutions preferred   Data Center to Cloud Transformation Experience   Software Architecture, Containers, Cloud Native and Devops   Data Management Platform : Database, Datawarehouse, DataLake, Big Data,   Understanding of Business Applications deployments   Experience in identity management and security architectures   Technical design authority role for large projects   Experience with Oracle Technologies in these domains is an advantage   Technical degree required; Computer Science or Math background highly desired   Excellent communication skills with an ability to right level conversations   Excellent Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers   Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly   Ability to travel   Fluency in English is essential. German is a strong advantage, French a plus.   To apply please e-mail your CV to Alexandra Matei I Oracle Talent Advisory Organization I alexandra.matei@oracle.com I 40 735 610 266. Oracle Recruiting: "Continuously selected by our clients as the exclusive vendor of preeminent talent".  Aspart of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required tocomplete a pre-employment screening process, prior to an offer beingmade. This will involve identity and employment verification, salaryverification, professional references, education verification andprofessional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).   Detailed Description and Job Requirements  Provides direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to client business. Facilitation of customer product/application understanding through presentations demonstrations and benchmarks; provision of support throughout the sell. As a Principal Sales Consultant you will be responsible as the expert for formulating and leading presales technical / functional support activity to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction. Acts as a technical resource and mentor for less experienced Sales Consultants. Focuses on large or complex sales opportunities that need creative and complex solutions. Develops productivity tools and training for other Sales Consultants. Develops and delivers outstanding Oracle presentations and demonstrations. Leads any and all aspects of the technical sales process. Advises internal and external clients on overall architect solutions. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 3 years vendor (sales and marketing) experience. 7 years business experience with relevant computer applications or database/tools. Ability to implement the most advanced product features. Thorough knowledge of system and application design. In depth knowledge of competitors. Demonstrated project management skills. Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, closing techniques. Ability to persuade others through presentations, demonstrations, and written communication. Ability to travel as needed. A/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.  As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to successfully complete a pre-employment screening process. This will involve identity and employment verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).   Job: Pre Sales  Location: CH-CH,Switzerland-Baden-Daettwil  Job Type: Regular Employee Hire  Organization: Oracle Display original ad

Job title: Solutions Engineer - SDN / SD-WAN, MPLS, IP, NFV, WAN Optimization
Content:
Solutions Engineer - SDN / SD-WAN, MPLS, IP, NFV, WAN Optimization 
    The Solutions Consulting team is responsible for supporting new business as well as existing clients across the DACH sales region.  To provide Presales Support to Sales Team and the Customer:  Knowing and being able to present confidently the technical benefits of Interoute, our network, our data centres and our products. Knowing about any advantages we have over competitors in the technical space Being able to positively relate customer requirements into our offering and qualifying out opportunities with requirements that Interoute can not meet Being able to answer questions from customers about how our proposed design solves their issues Understanding the kind of technical issues that customers have around buying whatever product we are trying to sell them, being able to anticipate and answer their questions. Experience of holding high (CXO) level presentations or demonstrations To be responsible for a technical design that fits the customer requirement and expectations. To be able to talk a customer through the design proposed, highlighting the advantages and limitations imposed by that design and the likely performance that could be achieved.    To be responsible for understanding where a customer solution is standard or non-standard. This includes:  For any solution, what is standard and what is not standard  For non-standard, to be able to explain to the customer why standard is better wherever there is a standard product that solves the customer requirement. Engage Solutions/Products/Specialists explaining clearly why we must deviate from standard, and then following their lead    To ensure orders are appropriately designed, priced, approved, and delivered. This includes:  Global Tail Quotes - putting in quotes for correct bandwidths, taking account of major technical requirements such as when to use MPLS and when to use point to point circuits for example. Identifying and avoiding suppliers because of limitations (either functionality, performance, SLA, or resilience)  Writing and checking Data Capture Forms/Migration Plans to attach to orders with enough information for operations to deliver effectively Ensuring that costs that have been input to the pricing tool(s) are accurate and take all elements of the design into account. Advise and lead Sales from a technical perspective, particularly in terms of services to larger corporate prospects/customers. Working with other appropriate areas of the Interoute organisation in providing direct feedback from the solution which will help to shape the Interoute value proposition (i.e. content, capability, technology and volume). Maintain awareness of the IT and telecommunications markets. Update internal systems and documents to ensure that delivery teams can continue with smooth delivery. Be an initial point of contact to resolve delivery related technical queries both for external and internal customers. Finalise and approve solutions for customers allocated. Understand the company’s inventory system and network specific configuration.      Knowledge / Experience Required:    Knowledge multiple technical domains (WAN, Security, Hosting, Voice, Telepresence). Ideally a similar background in a pre/post sales consultancy experience in an IT service provider / System Integrator, 5 years +. Demonstrate understanding of priorities when working under pressure. Understanding of ERP and CRM systems Understanding of ISP/System Integrators delivery processes   Display original ad

ICT System Engineer - Zurich Ihr Profil   We are currently looking for an ICT System Engineer who will be based at our HQ in Zurich and will take part of the operation, management and compliance of our global IT infrastructure and other data center services. In this role, the person will report to the Group Leader Data Center and will be part of the Global IT technology team. The person will be responsible for the following tasks:   Design, operate and maintain the global IT infrastructure of Vifor Pharma in collaboration with the internal team and third parties with a strong focus on AD, PKI and SSO Ensure that the components and systems are standardized, available, stable, secure and ensure compliance with GxP regulations and according to SLAs Manage upgrades, maintenance windows, coordinate different resources during projects and manage escalation processes Assess, evaluate and maintain services in-house and outsourced Analyze and understand business requirements, work with stakeholders to specify, design and select systems that deliver value to the organization Identify and communicate risks, advise, propose and implement appropriate actions Ensure the continuous improvement, automation, rationalization and management of existing IT platform services, investigate systems and models that might benefit the company Estimate cost and prepare business cases for solutions Support the components and systems at the 2nd and 3rd level following ITIL processes Collaborate with other IT and business peers on a global level Coordinate the interfaces between the requesters (internal and/or externals), the technology group, IT and/or the business partners Be part of IT «on call» activities and organize or support maintenance windows activities Understand and support the global IT strategy   The ideal candidate is an Information Technology professional with the following essentials skills and experience:    Minimum 10 years of experience as a system engineer  Expert knowledge in Active Directory services Excellent knowledge in PKI  Excellent knowledge in SSO services such as Okta Experience with transitioning from internal/on-prem service to SaaS, PaaS, IaaS Experience with cloud infrastructure (Microsoft Azure) and automation Strong team player who has previously worked with international and remote teams    The following skills would be advantageous:   Experience with ITIL processes Project management experience  Knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server solutions and surroundings Knowledge on load balancers/contentswitching (Citrix, F5) Knowledge of virtualization (VMware, Nutanix AHV) and hyper-converged technologies solution (Nutanix) Good knowledge of Microsoft System Center Operations Manager Hands-on experience on network operations, including Cisco platforms (ISE, Prime) is a strong advantage Certifications according to the role are an advantage Experienced with business requirements gatherings Fluent level in English (in oral and written communication), an advanced level in French or German would be advantageous  Previous experience in the pharmaceutical industry and understanding of GxP and other regulations   For this role, we are looking for a proactive candidate who demonstrates entrepreneurial approach and can drive the necessary activities to bring our infrastructure and services to the next level. Being in that role will allow to underline the necessary «can do» attitude, team player spirit and act as a role model for others in line with Vifor Pharma values.    
 Über uns Die Vifor Pharma Gruppe – die frühere Galenica Gruppe – ist ein globales Spezialitäten-Pharmaunternehmen, das eigene Pharmaprodukte erforscht, entwickelt, herstellt und vertreibt und ein bevorzugter Partner für innovative patientenorientierte Lösungen ist. Das Unternehmen hat sich zum Ziel gesetzt, ein globaler Marktführer in den Bereichen Eisenmangel, Nephrologie und kardiorenale Therapien zu sein und weltweit Patienten mit schweren und chronischen Erkrankungen zu einem besseren Leben in Gesundheit zu verhelfen. Die Vifor Pharma Gruppe verfügt über Produktionsstätten in der Schweiz und in Portugal sowie über ein dynamisches Netzwerk von Vertriebsgesellschaften und Partnern zur weltweiten Marktabdeckung. Das Unternehmen treibt die Expansion seiner weltweiten Präsenz laufend voran, bleibt dabei aber in seinem schweizerischen Heimmarkt fest verwurzelt. Die Vifor Pharma Gruppe besteht aus Vifor Pharma, Vifor Fresenius Medical Care Renal Pharma, ihrem gemeinsamen Unternehmen mit Fresenius Medical Care, Relypsa und OM Pharma. Für mehr Informationen gehen Sie bitte auf: http://www.viforpharma.com/de/ueber-vifor-pharma/wer-wir-sind    Inhalt ein-/ausblenden Display original ad

Job title: Front-End Engineer - Oyster Lab by Alpiq
Content: Alpiq Holding Ltd is a Swiss energy company operating throughout Europe. Its activities include the generation and supply of electricity, energy trading and energy management. Alpiq Digital AG is a subsidiary of Alpiq Holding Ltd. and develops digital solutions and new service models in the energy industry.Front-End Engineer - Oyster Lab by Alpiq  Oyster Lab is the cleantech incubator and company builder of Alpiq, one of the leading energy companies in Europe. We are an international team of engineers, designers, data scientists, researchers and energy experts based in theheart of Zürich, Switzerland. Together, we solve consumer problems and hope to make the world a greener place. We are now looking for a Front-End Engineer who shares our entrepreneurial spirit, and loves to build high-impact products and services for customers that are yet to be discovered. Breathing excellent software engineering, you will contribute to turning Oyster Lab into one of the fastest and most innovative company builders in the energy and e-commerce sector.  Your function   Build new web prototypes and applications to validate our hypotheses. Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability. Constantly evaluate our work and processes and challenge us. Recommend new libraries, frameworks, processes and other tools, and implement the best ones. Be accountable for the applications you create - from design and development to testing and maintenance.   Your profile   A degree in computer science and/or at least three years of programming experience. Demonstrated experience using modern JavaScript, HTML and CSS. Deep knowledge of modern front-end frameworks (e.g. Vue.js, React, Angular or similar), build tools and test tools. Experience in agile software development methodologies. Effective communication skills and an interest in being part of highly autonomous and cross-functional teams. Familiarity with RESTful web services and cloud platforms such as Docker and AWS a plus. Experience in mobile app development (Android, iOS, cross-platform) is a plus. English language fluency.   Your opportunity Oyster Lab uses qualitative research methods to solve real needs of customers, and build products that combine great design and outstanding user experience. With our deep understanding of the energy sector and digital economies, we build business models that are lean, connected and scalable. Join our international team of people who are strategic, transparent, supportive and encouraging. We maintain a start-up spirit with low hierarchies, yet enjoy the amenities of a grown-up enterprise. You will learn more than you ever thought possible about a variety of topics related to the nuts and bolts of agile practices, human-centered design and product innovation. We offer competitive salary, flexible working hours, discounts from external partners, relocation assistance for internationals, amazing team events and game nights (e.g. table soccer, Mario Kart, board game nights), and much more. English is our default language, and our Swiss colleagues will happily provide you with snackable Swiss-German lessons. Our office space lies within easy walking distance of central Zürich, Europe's wealthiest, most sustainable and second most liveable city in the world.

Performance Testing Engineer 80% bis 100%    What you achieveGood performance of an application is key to a good user experience. We are a passionate team working according to the agile mindset. As a member of our team, you contribute to improving the performance of several applications within the Swisscom IT landscape. Our mission is to support large solutions with performance engineering and enabling them to create their own benchmarking as well as verifying the customer experience. Your job is to define and execute testing approaches. Additionally, you leverage your developing skills by collaborating with database administrators, solution architects, and operations. Our team is constantly evolving. We are always open to new ideas and new technologies to improve the user experience.  Why you succeed  Degree (ETH/Uni/UAS) in computer science or related fields Experience with performance engineering Know-how of performance tools like LoadRunner, NeoLoad, JMeter, Gatling, or Karate. Knowledge of automation tools like Selenium Experience with monitoring and CI/CD tools (Jenkins) Familiar with cloud technologies Fluency in written and spoken English, German a plus       Curious to know more?As Performance Testing Engineer ... you start as soon as possible ... can partly work from the home office ... no regular travel activity is planned   We intend to fill this position without involvement of external recruiting or placement companies. Salaries at Swisscom are fair and market-driven with bonuses for good performance. Our salary system is transparent.    Generous employee benefits    Generous employee benefits Through its pension fund comPlan, Swisscom offers you extensive pension plans with individual savings options. We guarantee generous continued salary payments in the event of illness or accident.    Working world    Working world Swisscom actively promotes innovation and continuous improvement and you share in shaping these processes. We work in interdisciplinary teams. Co-working, prototyping and agile working methods are rooted in our culture.    Flexible working    Flexible working Our flexible, part-time or job sharing working models let you achieve a healthy work-life balance. And because travel broadens our horizons, you can either apply for unpaid leave or purchase up to two weeks of additional holiday per year.    Work and family    Work and family Helping you optimally combine your work and family life is very important to us. Swisscom provides for 18 weeks of maternity leave and 3 weeks of paternity leave. Senior Java Software Engineer 100 %     Wir gestalten schon heute die Zukunft der Finanzmärkte. Deshalb investieren wir in kluge Köpfe, in ihre Ideen, ihr Wissen und ihre Entwicklung. Dafür kombinieren wir unsere besten Seiten. Wenn du wissen möchtest, warum Stabilität uns so beweglich, Erfahrung uns so offen für Neues und Empathie uns so grosszügig macht, bewirb dich als        Senior Java Software Engineer Zürich|100 %|Referenz 1776 Bist du ein talentierter und top motivierter Software Engineer mit Erfahrung und Ausdauer? Willst du Teil eines agilen und ambitionierten Software Entwicklungsteams sein? Dann bist du bei uns richtig. Deine Tätigkeit wird vielfältig sein und nicht nur die eigentliche Softwareentwicklung umfassen. Dank intensiver täglicher Zusammenarbeit mit Kollegen/innen aus unserer Business Unit Financial Information wirst du dich schnell in der Welt der Finanzinstrumente zurechtfinden. Es warten grosse technische Herausforderungen auf dich und du hast die Möglichkeit, die Weiterentwicklung von Prozessen und Tools in Richtung DevOps massgeblich mitzuprägen.        Das sind deine Aufgaben  Design und Entwicklung von Java/Spring-Applikationen  Erneuerung, Weiterentwicklung und Unterhalt von Applikationen im Reference Data Input Stream   Zusammenarbeit in einem top motivierten Team mit hohen Fähigkeiten und Ambitionen  Erstellung und Pflege aller erforderlichen technischen Unterlagen  Unterstützung bei der Umsetzung von DevOps Themen, wie zum Beispiel: CI/CD-Pipeline, Testautomatisierung, Verbesserung des agilen Prozesses  Pikettbereitschaft     Das bringst du mit  Aktuelle Kenntnisse in JSE, Spring und Datenbanken   DevOps-Kompetenzen erwünscht (Jenkins, Docker, OpenShift)  Initiative und ergebnisorientierte Einstellung mit gutem Gespür für Qualität  Teamplayer, der Ideen einbringt und seine Arbeitsergebnisse präsentiert  Kenntnisse in Eclipse RCP sind von Vorteil  Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (B2 Level)        Das bieten wir dir          Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Wir vertrauen unseren Mitarbeitenden, daher kannst du deine Home Office- und Anwesenheitszeiten im Team flexibel vereinbaren.             Persönliche Entwicklungsprogramme In regelmässigen Abständen kannst du an Trainings, Inhouse-Schulungen, Seminaren der SIX Academy, Mentoring oder Coachings teilnehmen.             Spannende Aufgaben in offenen und agilen Teams          Bei Fragen steht dir Myrtha Patané-Reist unter der Nummer +41 58 399 38 56 zur Verfügung. Für diese Vakanz werden ausschliesslich Direktbewerbungen berücksichtigt.    Diversität ist uns wichtig, daher freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen unabhängig vom persönlichen Hintergrund.      Bewirb dich jetzt!    Du möchtest mehr wissen?    Wir erzählen dir persönlich, wie wir unsere besten Seiten kombinieren und was das für deine Zukunft bei SIX bedeutet. Cloud Platform Solution Engineer  Cloud Platform Solution Engineer   Preferred Qualifications   Cloud Platform Architect  At Oracle, we are continuously striving to me the most innovative and customer focused company in the world. Oracle have been helping customers since more than 30 years to deliver business value from Information Technologies and Business Applications. As a Cloud Platform Architect within the fast growing Oracle Cloud Platform, you will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Oracle IAAS and PAAS within our Top Account in ALPS Cluster (CH AT)  Your Role:    Support our clients, across all industry sectors, in exploiting Oracle's leading-edge technology portfolio – in the Cloud and on Premises   Support the sales process leading engagement at all levels within both Oracle and the customer organizations.   Partner and guide the sales team to design Sales strategies and solutions for customers, drive Oracle adoption and revenue.   Design and participate in technology pilot projects or proof of concept (POC) activities   Define values propositions, positioning and differentiation to competitor’s products   Lead request for information (RFI) and request for proposal (RFP)   Drive sales opportunities to successful completion   Be an Oracle evangelist. Educate customers of all sizes on the value proposition of Oracle Cloud Platform   Establish credibility & build deep relationships with senior technical and business individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates.   Participate in deep architectural / Functional discussions to build confidence and ensure customer success when building new and migrating existing applications, software and services on the Oracle Cloud Platform   Conduct deep-dive “hands-on” education/training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers   Author or contribute to customer-facing publications such as whitepapers, tutorials, etc.   Present sessions at Community and industry conferences.   Work alongside partners and other third party organizations as required   Define and drive pre-sales initiatives in target accounts and territories   Own each engagement, and help ensure a timely and successful delivery of value.   Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the Oracle community.   Understand Oracle market segments, customer base, and industry verticals.   The ideal candidate will possess customer-facing skills that will allow them to represent Oracle well within a customer's environment and drive discussions with senior personnel within the company, as well as a technical/functional background that enables them to easily interact and give guidance with software developers and architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think structured about business, product, and technical challenges. You must be interested in advancing your knowledge, be self-motivated, proactive, and we will provide you with continuing education possibilities around technical and personal development skills. Oracle provides a ramp-up program that includes self-paced learning, instructor-led training, hands-on projects, job shadowing opportunities, and a peer-reviewed opportunity to demonstrate your knowledge.  QUALIFICATIONS:    Strong experience on Cloud Platform : Infrastructure and Platform as a Service   Design of Data Center-level computing architectures, Cloud, or Hybrid solutions preferred   Data Center to Cloud Transformation Experience   Software Architecture, Containers, Cloud Native and Devops   Data Management Platform : Database, Datawarehouse, DataLake, Big Data,   Understanding of Business Applications deployments   Experience in identity management and security architectures   Technical design authority role for large projects   Experience with Oracle Technologies in these domains is an advantage   Technical degree required; Computer Science or Math background highly desired   Excellent communication skills with an ability to right level conversations   Excellent Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers   Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly   Ability to travel   Fluency in English is essential. German is a strong advantage, French a plus.   To apply please e-mail your CV to Alexandra Matei I Oracle Talent Advisory Organization I alexandra.matei@oracle.com I 40 735 610 266. Oracle Recruiting: "Continuously selected by our clients as the exclusive vendor of preeminent talent".  As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to complete a pre-employment screening process, prior to an offer being made. This will involve identity and employment verification, salary verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).   Detailed Description and Job Requirements  Provides direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to client business. Facilitation of customer product/application understanding through presentations demonstrations and benchmarks; provision of support throughout the sell. As a Principal Sales Consultant you will be responsible as the expert for formulating and leading presales technical / functional support activity to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction. Acts as a technical resource and mentor for less experienced Sales Consultants. Focuses on large or complex sales opportunities that need creative and complex solutions. Develops productivity tools and training for other Sales Consultants. Develops and delivers outstanding Oracle presentations and demonstrations. Leads any and all aspects of the technical sales process. Advises internal and external clients on overall architect solutions. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 3 years vendor (sales and marketing) experience. 7 years business experience with relevant computer applications or database/tools. Ability to implement the most advanced product features. Thorough knowledge of system and application design. In depth knowledge of competitors. Demonstrated project management skills. Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, closing techniques. Ability to persuade others through presentations, demonstrations, and written communication. Ability to travel as needed. A/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.  As part of Oracle's employment process candidates will be required to successfully complete a pre-employment screening process. This will involve identity and employment verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).   Job: Pre Sales  Location: CH-CH,Switzerland-Baden-Daettwil  Job Type: Regular Employee Hire  Organization: Oracle Display original ad

Performance Engineer (Experienced, Lead or Senior)  ZurichFull-time    ALTERSIS Performanceis a leading EMEA IT consulting firm specialized in IT Performance Managementand continuously expanding geographically. You will work in a team of specialized experts that has been providing Performance Engineering (PE)and Application Performance Management (APM)services to customers in EMEA for more than 15 years and has built PE & APM expertise and methodologies according to this experience. With all our consultants being IT Performance specialists, Sword Performance Solutions has realized over 2000 IT Performance projects with over 200 customers in multiple countries and industries. New hires will join an insightful introduction program including training in our own, proven Performance Engineering and APM methodologies as well as certifications in the leading APM and Performance Testing technologies (e.g. AppDynamics, Dynatrace, NeoLoad, etc.). While then working at large, international clients we promote and ensure the knowledge sharing of our experts by regularly gathering our consultants and engineers in Switzerland. Furthermore, we offer distinguished career development plans for both engineering (technical) and consulting paths for all our team members.  YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Work with our clients, including several large international corporations, defining programs, projects and roadmaps in the areas of Performance Management Governance, Unified Monitoring, Performance Engineering, Load & Performance Testing and further APM disciplines. Support customer projects and ensure the performance of business critical web applications via governance, engineering and industrialization over the whole application management life cycle – design, test and implementation. Lead customer APM integration projects with on- and off-shore integration teams. Support customers in the evaluation and implementation of application performance management solutions. Collaborate in the definition of commercial value propositions for new and existing customers. Support the internal development of methodologies, products and services.   YOUR PROFILE  (We are hiring for both Engineering and Consulting roles and depending on experience at different levels (Experienced, Lead, Senior).  You have a diploma in Computer Science, Engineering Sciences or comparable. You bring at least 3-5 years of work experience in the area of software development using technologies such as .NET, Java/JEE, XML technologies and data-base integration in addition you have good knowledge of different web-technologies such as html, ajax, css, etc. Additionally you have experience in requirement definition management as also solution acceptance testing, preferably in the area of load and performance testing. Good knowledge of processes, tools and methodologies related to state of the art software engineering best practices such as RUP and Agile. In addition to your technical skills you are capable of presenting to different management layers in English (and preferably German), French is a plus. To be considered for Lead or Senior positions you should bring a few years’ experience in the management of teams either directly or as project manager and have gathered the related experience in budget-, planning- and risk- management. You are flexible to travel and are ready to work on projects taking place in Switzerland and abroad (Germany, France, etc.).   Please note that we are only considering applications from Swiss and EU-27/EFTA nationals or Swiss work permit holders.       Go to all jobs     Display original ad

Software engineer - wireless   What You'll Do  Looking forward to getting an exciting start to your career? You will bring your unique talents to the Cisco CSG group thatbuilds intelligent networking products and platforms for many different applications. Core Software Group (CSG) has the charter for all Platform Independent and Platform Dependent software development across Switching (for data center, campus core and campus access), wireless, network services, routing, optical software and Enterprise routing and cable access.   In your role as a Software Engineer, you will be involved in the solution of new challenging problems. You willdevelop wireless products and industry-leading software platforms that capitalize on the trend toward all devices, machines, and vehicles becoming connected and integrated with traditional enterprise networks. Build high performance, highly scalable, multi-cloud environment, complex and distributed systems - end to end. Participate in the full software development lifecycle for a large system – at scale.The main responsibilities are:    Design and develop new features for Cisco Wireless LAN controllers: writing specifications, coding, unit testing and integration of the code across multiple platforms Test on simulated and real hardware in typical customer scenarios as well as stress and scale scenarios; Contribute to the automation of unit, integration, feature and system-level testing; Support and maintain the quality of the software: help customers to debug issues and fix defects Plan, design, operate and improve continuous integration and automated testing systems; write, deliver and maintain tests for the toolset.       Who You'll Work With  Be part of building next-generation scalable wireless LAN controller.   As an integral member of this team, you will work with a diverse group of engineers at all career levels. You will have the opportunity to architect, design, and develop some of the key features that are continuously evolving towards enabling the support of newer and exciting customer business paradigms. You will be interacting and working closely with some of the finest talents in the industry – where you will find that work is both fun and challenging.    Who You Are  Excellent quality is what drives you. To ensure this, you have a good understanding of real-time OS architectures, embedded software, and basic knowledge of L2, L3, protocols. You possess the necessary skills to work in a highly collaborative, inclusive, and agile atmosphere in partnership with cross-functional teams.    Education and Experience   University degree in computer science, electrical engineering or equivalent, potentially combined with 1-2 years of related experience.    Desired Skills     Ability to write good software in C and Python; Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills; Proven problem-solving skills. Adaptable, proactive and willing to take ownership; Experience with real-time O/S and with Unix/Linux development tools; Good understanding of wireless, networking architecture and networking protocols; Basic experience with scripting and unit, integration test tools and dashboards a big plus; Good communication skills; Team player able to work with globally distributed teams with the ability to communicate to all levels of users; Cisco Networking certificates, such as CCNA, CCNP, CWNA etc. are a plus.     Why Cisco  We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to craft the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. We are thought leaders with vision, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. We Are Cisco.  Display original ad

Job title: Senior Full Stack Web Application Engineer
Content: Senior Full Stack Web Application Engineer     Join our team of web application developers and face the challenge of making IT security visible, understandable, and beautiful. As a Web Application Engineer, you will extend and improve the Mission Control Portal and thus help our customers to better manage and understand their global network security setups.   Together with service engineers, UI designers, and product owners you discuss, shape, specify, and implement solutions that emphasize the value of strong IT security services, ease the operation of thousands of devices deployed across the planet, and provide intelligent insights into security-relevant data and processes. As part of the Mission Control team, you share operational duties with your colleagues.   We expect you to bring considerable experience in one or both of the following areas:   Frontend web application development:    Modern Javascript/ES6 transpiling and bundling (Babel, Webpack)   ReactJS   React state handling (Redux, Unstated)   Modern post processing (PostCSS, CSS Modules)   Mocha/Jest unit and snapshot testing   Frontend end-to-end testing (Selenium, Cypress)   Code style best practices (eslint)    Backend Java/Spring web application development:    Modern Java (Streams, Lambdas, Optionals)   Build and deployment procedures (Maven, Tomcat)   Spring stack (Spring boot, Spring MVC)   Familiarity with SQL and relational databases   Unit testing and testing principles   Code style best practices (SonarLint)    We encourage all our Web Application Engineers to take part in architectural and conceptual discussions, and to keep a mindset to continuously improve the way we do things. As a Senior Full Stack Web Application Engineer, we expect you to take an active part in those discussions.    Furthermore, we expect basic knowledge and a high motivation to participate a coached training program in these areas:      Knowledge of Linux operating systems     Understanding networking in general and the major internet protocols     Knowledge of network security concepts and practices     You will join one of our small development teams that works with agile methods. The team will rely on you to focus on its goals and efforts as a team player while being able to work independently. At Open Systems we are passionate about what we do. We work in an environment in which innovative solutions, rapid development times, creativity and open communication are practiced and continuously fostered. The pursuit of technical advancement is at the center of our attention. You will be based at our office in Zurich (CH) and will get the opportunity to work out of our office in Redwood City (US) for a few months.   We look forward to receiving your complete online application (letter of motivation, CV, diplomas/reference letters/transcript of records. Compress your application into two attachments). For further questions and inquiries about applications, please feel free to contact Helena Grimm at +41 58 100 10 10.      Für diese Stelle bewerben  Display original ad

Senior Software Engineer (Frontend / JS) At Starmind, we believe that the combined knowledge and cognitive capabilities of humans far exceed any existing technology's computing power; thus, we developed AI to empower and enhance rather than replace the human mind. Our platform helps expedite people's advancement by exploring undocumented human intelligence and enabling real-time access to skills, knowledge, and solutions within corporations, communities, and, since we like to think of the bigger picture: the world. We are backed by some of the best VC investors in Europe, becoming one of the fastest growing AI companies in Europe; and are rapidly expanding our team with the crème de la crème from Airbnb, Twitter, Salesforce, Zuora and many more.   Do you have what it takes to help us shape the future of AI? Watch this video to find out how Starmind works!  The Mission  Our engineering team is looking for passionate collaborative engineers to design, implement and expand the SaaS platform for our self learning AI technology. The teams work across the stack shipping end user-focused products and APIs (https://docs.starmind.com/api/v1) following reactive programming principles. We’re constantly innovating our growing platform using state of the art open source technologies. We are looking for a Software Engineer (Frontend / JS) who loves his / her job and wants to live his / her passion with us.  What You Will Do   We are a product company: The Starmind application is our core and you will work on it. Our Saas platform is being improved and extended continuously You develop the frontend and support if necessary - for your sake - the backend in our cross functional teams You plan and develop the frontend of our distributed services, re-engineer existing code and make an effort for the quality of our software You contribute with own ideas and innovations to the development process   Who You Are   You are a JavaScript guru and know everything about it as well as its advantages and disadvantages You show experience of several years (3+) in creating single page applications in JavaScript (ES5 & ES6) with one of the most popular frameworks including the tools that come with it You manage to successfully plan and implement the frontend of a web application in terms of data flow and state management You feel comfortable in Node.js and you know how to use build tools like Webpack and Babel and find your way through the JavaScript package universe (NPM, Yarn) HTML and CSS you master in sleep. You are familiar with meta languages and preprocessors like SASS, JSX or Pug (Jade) REST, HTTP, CORS, XSS, GraphQL and OAuth are no foreign words for you You have an eye for design, a keen sense for usability and are ideally already familiar with Material Design You are a team player and have previously worked in a SCRUM team or you are at least familiar with agile development practice In the first place you are a passionate web developer: You think and dream in JavaScript and you are always interested in the latest technologies You enjoy to work in a young team and you want to be more than just a small cog in the system You have a healthy balance between “get things done” and technical debt and you’re able to communicate this proactively You understand that quality is not assured solely by the QA engineer, but by the team   The Bounty   A dynamic, young company where input is welcomed and acted upon High level of personal responsibility and independence A challenging and exciting vision within an innovative and multi-cultural environment We strongly believe in team chemistry and team work. We prioritize having a great time while building up a great company If this sounds like you, let’s solve the riddle and apply (written in English or German) - We are very excited to meet you.     Display original ad

Embedded Software Engineer       Join the Power Revolution WinGD (Winterthur Gas & Diesel Ltd.) plays a vital role in powering the marine industry and shaping our environment. As a leading developer of two-stroke, low-speed gas and diesel engines, used to power merchant shipping, our people are driving solutions on a global scale. Our target is to set the industry standard for reliability, efficiency and environmental sustainability in marine propulsion. WinGD-designed engines are manufactured under license worldwide. Headquartered in Winterthur, Switzerland, since its inception in 1893, WinGD has preserved and continued the legacy of the Sulzer Diesel Engine business for excellence in design. Our success in this ever evolving, competitive environment is based on the drive, innovation and passion of our diverse employee population, over 350 people worldwide, representing over 25 different nationalities. Together we work towards providing the solutions that will continue to revolutionize our industry. WinGD is looking for a   Embedded Software Engineer   Responsibilities     Base (platform) SW specification, design, validation, verification, and troubleshooting Requirements analysis, creation of speciﬁcations, documentation Design, develop, code, debug and test application software Define SW components and architecture according requirements Develop, perform and document test methods for embedded control systems focusing on software Analyze and enhance system resources Coordinate joint-development activities with partners and suppliers Support and assure software quality Provide post production support Give technical support in discussions with stakeholders and customers     Requirements       BSc or MSc within automation, controls or related disciplines, focus on embedded control systems (with some years’ experience) Deep knowledge with some years’ experience in automation & controls and embedded software engineering At least 5 years’ experience in developing embedded real-time applications Experience in elicit requirement speciation, programming, design specification, etc. Excellent knowledge of coding techniques, interfaces and hardware subsystems Practical programming in C/C++ / C# /.net/ MATLAB/Simulink and SQL Knowledge of different communication protocols and interfaces Familiar with software configuration management tools Adequate knowledge of reading schematics and data sheets for components Strong communication, documentation and writing skills Attentive to details and self-motivated Knowledge in project management Critical thinker and problem-solving skills Team player, yet able to work independently     Our offer     An opportunity to shape the sustainability and environmental impact of the shipping industry. WinGD is on the leading edge of the technology which is shaping the future of the shipping industry A dynamic working environment, blending a long history of technology expertise with industry leading innovation across a global network Award winning, extraordinary products. Our engines are really big and really awesome Multi-cultural and interdisciplinary teams offering diverse perspectives and collaborative thinking Dynamic and interactive working conditions. WinGD offers a non-hierarchical, agile structure where input and ideas are welcome In-house technology training and professional development opportunities     Further information  For additional information about this position and WinGD please contact the Line Manager Mr. Alexander Doncic Wettstein (+41 52 264 85 93)

DevOps Consultant   DevOps Engineer & Consultant    
              DevOps Engineer & Consultant   Do you think working in the banking sector can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. At Knowledge Lab, we develop pioneering solutions that enable financial institutions to make the most valuable business decisions. With us, you will have the opportunity to apply and expand your skills in ways you never thought possible - and you will have fun doing it. Join a successful team of great people with ambition, passion and ideas, all using and developing their talents for good - at work and in life.     The Position   As a DevOps Engineer and Consultant, you will reimagine how to build and deploy software onsite on our customers’ premises as well as on our in-house development platform. You build solutions and infrastructures that enable our customers to have more efficient use of data and let them make data driven decisions. Your goal is to accelerate the end-to-end engineering lifecycle by building tools and platforms that make it easier to create, deploy, and iterate on secure and highly available software platforms. You will closely collaborate with consultant colleagues and our in-house team of data engineers, data scientists, software engineers and UX experts when preparing showcases and prototypes. In addition, you will actively share your knowledge within the team.         Responsibilities    Client-facing expert for DevOps engineering challenges   Build and maintain highly available systems for service deployment and management   Design and evolve software managing and configuration for modern microservice data-pipelining infrastructures   Architect and manage secure, scalable infrastructure with appropriate tooling to support our external and internal use cases   Develop tools such as CI/CD pipelines, container schedulers, and custom applications   Debug complex issues and performance problems throughout the technology stack    What you offer   Minimum qualifications    BS or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related engineering discipline   Strong analytical skills with a mindset to make things “as simple as possible, but not simpler”   Extensive experience with microservices infrastructures and tools (Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift, Azure DevOps) at scale   Proficiency in leveraging CI/CD tools to automate deployment and testing (e.g. Jenkins, Bamboo)   Experience working with a cloud provider (AWS/Azure/GCE) or in-house data centers   Knowledge of infrastructure automation tools (e.g. Ansible, Puppet, Chef)   Experience with scripting languages including Python, Perl, Unix/Linux Shell or PowerShell   Experience with relational databases and good command of SQL   Strong interest in banking and financial services industry   Open, curious, team-oriented personality with persistency and tenacity   High sense of ownership and quality   Excellent communication skills, both towards customers and peers   Ability to think ahead, work independently and set priorities   Very strong command of English, good command of German (verbal and written)   Willingness to travel (mostly within Switzerland, occasionally EU/UK)    Preferred qualifications    Professional experience in Banking or financial services industry   Experience with core banking platforms (e.g. Avaloq or similar)   Experience with Big Data platforms (e.g. Spark, Hadoop), data pipelines and ETL   Relevant programming experience (Java, PL/SQL or other)   Why should you apply?  At Knowledge Lab, we offer:    An inclusive culture that values interdisciplinarity, freedom and responsibility   The possibility to shape a young company   Excellent growth and personal development opportunities   Interesting projects and challenging tasks   About Knowledge Lab  Knowledge Lab AG is a consulting, software engineering and data science company for financial institutions. Founded in 2016 and based in Zurich, Knowledge Lab serves customers within Switzerland and Europe. An interdisciplinary team of 20 employees works with its clients to develop solutions at the forefront of banking transformation. Knowledge Lab constantly researches new approaches and ideas in its own lab.         For further information please contact:   Peter Häusermann   Knowledge Lab AG   info@k-lab.ch   +41 (44) 461 09 36   Display original ad

Data Analyst (Real Estate) (80%-100%)Wüest Partner est le plus grand cabinet de conseil immobilier de Suisse, actif au niveau internationalavec des bureaux à Genève, Zurich, Berne, Lugano, Francfort, Berlin, Hambourg et Munich. Notre société concentre ses activités dans le domaine de l’immobilier et du bâtiment ainsi que dansle développement urbain. Elle s’appuie sur une équipe pluridisciplinaire pour conseiller les proprié-taires institutionnels ou privés, les banques, les assurances, les entreprises de la branche immobilièreet du bâtiment ainsi que les pouvoirs publics.Avec notre gamme étendue de prestations comprenant conseils, applications informatiques et don-nées, nous élaborons des solutions adaptées à notre clientèle que nous accompagnons en Suissecomme à l’étranger. Depuis 1985, Wüest Partner est synonyme de qualité, d’innovation et nos con-naissances ouvrent la voie au développement pérenne de l’économie immobilière. Afin de renforcer encore notre bureau de Genève en pleine expansion, nous cherchons un(e) Data Analyst (Real Estate) (80% - 100%) Vos activités :Votre travaillerez de manière indépendante, mais en étroite collaboration avec notre équipe de re-cherche économique sur les thèmes suivants :— Recherches et travaux empiriques comprenant la récolte de données ;— Analyses quantitatives et qualitatives sur la base de nos modèles d’estimation ;— Rédaction d’analyses de marché et de rapports ;— Présentations et discussions des résultats avec nos clients et partenaires. Afin de mener à bien cette mission, vous pourrez vous appuyer sur des bases de données solides et utiliserdes outils informatiques et des applications spécifiques performants. Votre profil :— Formation universitaire en économie ou discipline équivalente (au moins quatre semestres d’études)— Une première expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de l’immobilier et/ou une spécialisationen statistique ou économie appliquée (IEI, MAS EPFL en expertise dans l’immobilier, SVIT, CUREMou équivalent). Un ingénieur avec une affinité pour les questions économiques et de bons back-grounds IT, tech et data ou bien un statisticien avec des connaissances dans l’immobilier pourraientcorrespondre au profil recherché— Intérêt pour l’économie immobilière et les questions conceptuelles relatives aux marchés immobi-liers et de la construction— Bonnes compétences d’analyse, de synthèse, de rédaction et de présentation/communication per-mettant de lier les chiffres et les données à l’intuition économique— Facilité à travailler de manière autonome, flexibilité et engagement— Esprit créatif et innovant, empathie, motivation et compétences sociales— Très bonne maîtrise des outils informatiques (notamment Excel, Word et Powerpoint)— Une bonne connaissance des logiciels statistiques et des techniques de programmation (SPSS,Stata, R) serait un plus— Une excellente maîtrise du français ; de très bonnes connaissances de l’allemand et de l’anglaissont un atout Nous vous proposons des conditions de travail intéressantes et des horaires de travail flexibles enplein cœur de Genève ainsi que la possibilité de se développer aux niveaux personnel et professionnel(formation continue interne et externe) au sein d’une équipe jeune et dynamique. Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre dossier de candidature complet jusqu’au 15 novembre 2019par e-mail à emploi@wuestpartner.com. Date d’entrée : 1er janvier 2020. Pour tout complément d’infor-mation, Dragana Djurdjevic, Director, se tient à votre disposition au 022 319 30 05. Wüest Partner SA, Rue du Stand 60-62, 1204 Genève Wüest Partner ist ein international tätiges Beratungsunternehmen in den Bereichen Immobilien undBaumarkt sowie Raum- und Standortentwicklung mit Büros in Zürich, Genf, Bern, Frankfurt und Berlin. Wir beraten institutionelle Eigentümer, Banken und Versicherungen, Bau- und Immobilienfirmen, dieöffentliche Hand sowie Private. Mit umfassenden Dienstleistungen, innovativen Produkten und exklu-siven Daten entwickelt Wüest Partner kundennahe Lösungen und wirkt bei deren Umsetzung mit. Seit1985 steht das unabhängige Unternehmen für höchste Kompetenz und Qualität. Zur Erweiterung unseres Teams in Genf suchen wir eine(n) Data Analyst(in) (Real Estate) (80% - 100%) Ihr Aufgabengebiet:Sie arbeiten selbstständig, aber in enger Zusammenarbeit mit unserem Team “Market & EconomicResearch“ in den folgenden Themenbereichen:— Forschung und empirische Arbeit einschliesslich Datenerhebung;— Quantitative und qualitative Analysen auf Basis unserer Schätzungsmodelle;— Erstellung von Marktanalysen und Berichten;— Präsentationen und Diskussionen der Ergebnisse mit unseren Kunden und Partnern. Um diese spannenden und anspruchsvollen Aufgaben erfolgreich bearbeiten zu können, stützen Sie sichauf unsere umfangreichen Datenbanken zum Bau- und Immobilienmarkt und verwenden spezifische, leis-tungsfähige IT-Werkzeuge. Ihre Qualifikationen:— Hochschulabschluss in Volkswirtschaftslehre oder gleichwertiger Disziplin (mindestens 4 Semester)— Erste praktische Erfahrungen im Immobilienbereich mit Schwerpunkt in Statistik oder angewandtenWirtschaftswissenschaften (IEI, MAS ETH und EPFL, SVIT, CUREM oder ähnliches). Ein Ingenieur mitInteresse an wirtschaftlichen Themen sowie gutem IT-, Technik- und Datenhintergrund oder ein Sta-tistiker mit Immobilienkenntnissen könnte dem gewünschten Profil entsprechen— Ein ausgeprägtes Flair für immobilienwirtschaftliche Themen und konzeptionelle Fragen im Zusam-menhang mit Immobilien- und Baumärkten— Gute analytische, synthetische, schriftliche und Präsentations-/Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, umZahlen und Daten mit dem wirtschaftlichen Umfeld zu verbinden— Eine effiziente und selbstständige Arbeitsweise sowie Flexibilität und Engagement— Kreativer und innovativer Geist mit Empathie, Motivation und sozialer Kompetenz— Sehr gute IT-Anwender-Kenntnisse (insbesondere Excel, Word und Powerpoint)— Gute Kenntnisse von statistischer Software und Programmiertechniken (SPSS, Stata, R) sind von Vor-teil— Ausgezeichnete Französischkenntnisse; sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Wir bieten hochwertige Arbeitsbedingungen, ein dynamisches und junges Team, Raum für die persön-liche und fachliche Entwicklung und Weiterbildung sowie einen erstklassigen, modernen Arbeitsplatzim Zentrum von Genf. Field Engineer (m/f)Field Engineer (m/f)-TCEC-CHVI02006306  Description  At Bombardier Transportation, our trains and rail solutions move millions of people safely and reliably around the world, every single day. Join us, and you’ll be part of a global team, sharing knowledge, experience and ideas across countries and cultures, and boosting our reputation as a global leader in rail technology. Your work will have a truly human impact, connecting communities, cities and businesses, and helping people to get where they need to be. It’s all about progress. For our Product Introduction (PI) organization in Switzerland we are looking for a dedicated and flexible Field Engineer. In order to ensure the efficient introduction into service of new, complex trains, it is necessary to perform curative maintenance activities during the guarantee phase. The role of the function is to support reliability growth by performing in depth investigations on train subsystems and developing remote diagnostic alerts. (Bombardier Fleet monitor). Tasks: During warranty phase: • Develop and acquire system knowledge by participating to technical reviews, testing and troubleshooting activities; • Develop diagnostics and repair cases for the train digital troubleshooting guide; • Diagnose and detail new faults within the system and adapt diagnostic tools; • Conduct Field Investigations on complex issues and report to Eng and supplier, proposal of new solutions; • Develop IT Tools for preventive maintenance (data analysis, condition-based maintenance); • Document, collect and store information relating to material defects, in order to search for solutions to the technical problems encountered and develop continuous improvement proposals in cooperation with the Engineering team; • Develop and share acquired knowledge with the rest of the team (training). #LI-ENG  Qualifications  • Higher Education in Electronic or Electrical Engineering or Mechanics/Robotics; • 3-5 years relevant professional experience in the area of command/control systems for railway vehicles, or similar complex industrial systems; • Experience in remote diagnostics and condition-based maintenance • Mobility and flexibility for assignments in Switzerland 20%; • Programming skills are an asset: Excel (VBA), SQL, C ++ … etc; • Fluent German and English are required for this position. French is an advantage. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. About Bombardier Transportation Bombardier Transportation is a global mobility solution provider leading the way with the rail industry’s broadest portfolio. It covers the full spectrum of solutions, ranging from trains to sub-systems and signalling to complete turnkey transport systems, e-mobility technology and data-driven maintenance services. Combining technology and performance with empathy, Bombardier Transportation continuously breaks new ground in sustainable mobility by providing integrated solutions that create substantial benefits for operators, passengers and the environment. Headquartered in Berlin, Germany, Bombardier Transportation employs around 39,850 people and its products and services operate in over 60 countries. Bombardier is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.  Job: Technical/Customer Support Primary Location: CH-ZU-Zurich Organization: Transportation Schedule: Full-time Employee Status: Regular  Job Posting: 28.10.2019, 2:09:23 AM Unposting DateOngoing  Job Segment:Genetics, Field Engineer, Engineer, Electrical, Database, Science, Engineering, Technology Display original ad

Network Engineer, 80% -100% (w/m)   Job-ID: 107386_DE_2Network Engineer, 80% -100% (w/m)     Gesellschaft:  T-Systems Schweiz AG    Standorte:  Zollikofen, Schweiz     Karrierelevel:  Professional    Vertragsart:  Vollzeit - unbefristet    Bewerbungsschluss:  29.12.2019     Erforderliche Sprachkenntnisse:  Deutsch, Englisch     Weitere Kurzinfos  Jetzt bewerben  Merken TeilenPDF drucken     
        Ihre Aufgabe      Als Network Engineer unterstützt du unser 25-köpfiges Team beim Entwickeln, Testen, Betreiben und Automatisieren von Netzwerkservices für unsere Kunden diverser Branchen.Dazu gehören im Wesentlichen folgende Aufgaben und Verantwortungsbereiche:  Konzeption, Implementierung und Betrieb der Netzwerk-Systeme in den Bereichen Data Center LAN, Office LAN, WLAN sowie Internet- und WAN-Erschliessung Betrieb von netzwerknahen Diensten wie Monitoring, DNS/DHCP in EffcientIP, Administration von Cisco ACS Troubleshooting von Netzwerk- oder netzwerknahen Problemen im 2nd Level und enge Zusammenarbeit mit Herstellern Erstellung und Erweiterung der Netzwerkdokumentation Design, Planung und Aufbau von Dualprovider Internet (inkl. IPv6 und BGP Routing) Unterstützung bei grossen Erneuerungen, Migrationen und Umbauarbeiten der Aktiv-/ Passiv- Netzwerk-Komponenten Mitarbeit bei der Automatisierung von Konfigurations- und Prozessmanagement für LAN Infrastrukturen Fachtechnische Unterstützung im Offering-Prozess Zusammenarbeit im internationalen Umfeld (Projekte, Operations, Kunden)    Mehr Informationen         Ihr Profil       Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Netzwerk Knowhow im Bereich Datacenter LAN Umfeld - Cisco Nexus Spine and Leaf Design Fundierte Kenntnisse im Netzwerkbereich (LAN, WLAN, ISA, WSA), speziell für Cloud Service Provider (Overlaynetzwerke, SDN, DCI etc.), von Vorteil Erfahrung in Cisco Equipment (Router, Switches, WLAN) sowie aktuelle Produktezertifizierungen erwünscht Gute Kenntnisse der Betriebssysteme Unix/Linux sowie übergreifende Kenntnisse im Bereich Server, Datenbanksysteme und Virtualisierungsplattformen bieten einen zusätzlichen Mehrwert für uns Flair für Architektur- und Designtätigkeiten und ebenso deren praktische Umsetzung Freude an der Arbeit in einem kollegialen Team innerhalb eines agilen Umfelds Bereitschaft, sich in neue Themen einzuarbeiten und sich darin zu professionalisieren Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse    Mehr Informationen             Benefits                                  Über uns      ICT ist unsere Profession und unsere Leidenschaft. Wir arbeiten an den Innovationen von morgen und treiben mit unseren Lösungen den digitalen Fortschritt voran. Erfolg basiert bei uns auf dem Austausch von Ideen in einer offenen Unternehmenskultur. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass Veränderungen neue Chancen für Entwicklung und Innovation bringen.
