Senior Front-End Web Developer     Senior Front-End Web Developer EngineeringSchlieren, Zurich, SwitzerlandFull timeSFE-EN-1    OverviewApplication  Description  Most wanted: Seasoned front-end Web engineer with a flair for great software architecture and modern user experiences.  Onedot was founded in 2014 to make unstructured and messy product data easy consumable by applying self-developed artificial intelligence. We are a rapidly growing Swiss SaaS startup offering commerce and industry the first intelligent platform to source, onboard and distribute product data. Public companies with global presence and rich history as well as some of the fastest growing e-commerce startups are part of our expanding international customer base. At Onedot, you will embed yourself into a demanding but exceptionally inspiring environment with lots of room for personal growth. We are looking for colleagues who want to have a meaningful impact and shape our trendsetting product and company. High-quality work is rewarded with a steep learning curve, lots of autonomy, responsibility and swift decision-making. Become part of a multi-cultural and multi-faceted team led by the founders. Talented, curious and committed human beings from all over the globe are looking forward to your ideas and taking you on board. You will take ownership and drive the development of the Onedot platform, in particular the Web application. Working on beautiful and intuitive user interfaces is your thing. You have a flair for excellent user experience and are able to capture complex use-cases and translate them into features which are built to last. Good attention to detail and constantly improving your knowledge about industry trends, new technologies, and best practices in front-end development is your strength. You have the necessary experience to build novel products and love to share your technology knowhow with your team. A modern technology stack and a lean development process that does not get in your way helps you to focus on what your are good at: building great Web applications with the potential to transform entire industries. Onedot designs and engineers proprietary machine learning algorithms, probabilistic/statistical methods and advanced text understanding because existing approaches do not go far enough. Our technology achieves human-like performance and has already been trained with over 100 million different products. Onedot is a startup backed by well-known international venture capital firms and world class entrepreneurs. Your responsibilities:  Design, implement and test new user-facing functionality for our SPA Connect to backend services interfacing with the core engine Build reusable code and open-source libraries for future use Optimize components for maximum performance across browsers and devices Draft, test and implement intuitive interaction patterns for sophisticated data transformations Work with product management and core engine team  Minimum qualifications:  Strong proficiency in JavaScript/ES6 or Typescript, including DOM manipulation and the Javascript object model Practical expertise with popular React workflows such as Flux or Redux Experience with data structure libraries such as Immutable.js Familiarity with RESTful APIs and modern authorisation mechanisms such as JSON Web Token Know-how of modern front-end build pipelines and tools such as Webpack Motivation and passion for intuitive and beautiful user interfaces Ability to write expressive, high-quality, reusable code  Preferred qualifications:  Minimum of 4 years of relevant project and product expertise Experience and flair for visual design, UX and interface design for complex interaction patterns Full-stack engineering experience of reactive software architectures Knowledge of Scala and functional programming paradigms  As part of our dedication to the diversity of our teams, Onedot is committed to equal employment opportunity without regard for race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. This is a permanent full-time position based in our office in Zurich/Schlieren, Switzerland. Sounds interesting? Apply today and we will get in touch with you shortly!   Requirements  Minimum of 4 years of relevant project and product expertise    Benefits  Performance-oriented compensation with the option to become shareholder, because we reward high-impact work Generous education & training budget to continuously broaden your skills Flexible work hours, because impact, not face-time counts Occasional work from home, so that you can focus and get things done Strong culture promoting open feedback and personal development, to learn from each other and push forward as one team Standing desks, powerful hardware and two additional monitors for maximum productivity Cool office space close to the city center, because we like it cosy and comfortable Free snacks, drinks, coffee and other perks to keep you going Regular team events to foster new ideas and better get to know each other     Apply for this job      Display original ad

Job title: Praktikum- / Semester- / Diploma- Student for Maintenance Enhancement Project
Content: Praktikum- / Semester- / Diploma- Student for Maintenance Enhancement Project   Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.  Are you keen to learn about all the latest trends in the field of maintenance – from green-to-green and first time right to 80:20 SDT:UDT, and predictive maintenance? Do you want to support one of the biggest volume high power semiconductor factories in Switzerland in its efforts to take maintenance to the next level? Would you like to familiarize yourself with state-of-the-art production tools and help to make them even more reliable? Do you relish the prospect of working in a cleanroom environment with only 10 particles per 1 m3?We are offering you to join our Maintenance Improvement Project and assume responsibility for the area of maintenance statistics and organization. You will follow scheduled and unscheduled maintenance interventions relating to various types of semiconductor manufacturing tools, analyze maintenance performance, and put forward suggestions for improvement. Your responsibilities  Collect and analyze data for maintenance interventions, including aspects such as duration, manpower, and success rate Work in close collaboration with maintenance teams, maintenance professionals, process engineers, and operators Follow up maintenance-related topics, such as maintenance preparation, spare parts, check lists, interfaces, and manuals Submit suggestions for improvement to maintenance activities  Your background  University, University of Applied Sciences, or ETH student (Natural Sciences, Mechanical Engineering, Business Studies with a focus on Manufacturing, or similar) Keen interest in all aspects of maintenance: tools, spare parts, warehouse, people interaction, automatic reporting, process, volume production, end products Attention to detail and highly conscientious approach to data acquisition Ideally, assignment covering 6 to 12 months (full time) Strong command of German and English, both spoken and written   Display original ad

JUNIOR .NET APPLICATION DEVELOPER (f/m/d)    About Atos  Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with over 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of over € 11 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index. The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information technology space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education as well as multicultural and pluralistic approaches to research that contribute to scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the group enables its customers, employees and collaborators, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably and confidently in the information technology space. Werden Sie ein Digital Leader! Atos ist ein weltweiter Marktführer in Digitaler Transformation. Unsere Mission: Menschen, Technologie und Business zu vereinen, um den Fortschritt unserer Kunden zu beschleunigen.   Für unseren Unternehmensbereich "Big Data & Cyber Security" suchen wir Talente! Unterstützen Sie unser Software Practice Team zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt am Standort Zürich als    Junior .NET Software Engineer (w/m/d)      Ihre Aufgaben: - Erstellen von kundenspezifischen und komplexen Software Lösungen und Erweiterungen (inhouse)- Anwenden von modernen Entwicklungsmethoden in einem Team mit umfangreichem Expertenwissen - Mitarbeit in spannenden Software-Projekten im C# .NET Umfeld sowie Webentwicklung mit Angular- Enge Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Product Ownern, Software Architekten und Software Engineers- Aufbau und Pflege der Vertrauensbeziehungen mit unseren Kunden in mittel- bis langfristigen Projekten- Einsätze beim Kunden vor Ort für Workshops & Releases Ihr Profil: - Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium (FH, Uni, ETH, HF) mit Fachrichtung Informatik- Erste Erfahrungen (1 bis 3 Jahre) in der Software-Entwicklung- Interesse an professionellen Softwareentwicklungsmethoden und -prozessen- Motivierte, initiative und teamfähige Persönlichkeit mit einer schnellen Auffassungsgabe, Lernfreunde und Spass an der Arbeit- Ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung und hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein- Da die Projekte im sensitiven Umfeld angesiedelt sind, erfüllen Sie die Bedingungen zum Bestehen der Schweizer Personensicherheitsprüfung (PSP), wie z.B. Schweizer Staatsbürgerschaft oder Schweizer Wohnsitz während der vergangenen 5 Jahre (ohne Unterbruch) - Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (min. C1 Niveau) und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift  Ihre Bewerbung    Nutzen Sie die Chance und bewerben Sie sich auf diese spannende und vielseitige Funktion über unsere Karriereseite. Bitte beachtern Sie, dass wir nur vollständige Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Anschreiben, Lebenslauf) im Auswahlprozess berücksichtigen können. Wir freuen uns auf Sie!   Wir haben uns zum Ziel gesetzt, Diversität in unserem Unternehmen zu fördern. Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Herkunft, Alter, Behinderung oder sexueller Orientierung.   Display original ad

Job title: Lead Solution & Application Architect iptiQ EMEA L&H
Content: Lead Solution & Application Architect iptiQ EMEA L&H            Location: Zurich, ZH, CH             Lead Solution & Application Architect iptiQ EMEA L&H    About iptiQ  Become a part of a growing and dynamic entrepreneurial team within the established Swiss Re Group. iptiQ is a start-up unit, established to provide innovative protection solutions directly to consumers. Our team delivers the coordination, infrastructure and competences that are key to driving forward this new business; working closely with our partners and clients. Our mission is to reduce the protection gap by simplifying life insurance and making it more accessible to people. Our motto is "now life is easier for everyone". For us this means making life insurance easier to sell, to buy and to trust.     About the Role  You will be the Lead Solution & Application Architect for the technology platform within the iptiQ EMEA Technology & Operations department. This is a rare opportunity to join a new business unit within an established company; combining the dynamic spirit of a start-up with the backing of Swiss Re's strong organisation.    As the Solution & Application Architect, you will work closely in multi-functional teams to shape the technology platform that fulfil our business and product vision and ultimately bring value to our customers and partners by disrupting the traditional insurance proposition. This will require solving complex problems within a distributed infrastructure by designing simple, scalable, reliable and configurable solutions. It also requires liaising with various stakeholders within and beyond iptiQ EMEA L&H to align the architecture and to ensure that it is fit for purpose.   Your responsibilities include:  Design new capabilities and/or components within our platform to maximize configurability, speed and efficiency and to scale business processes Create artefacts including solution designs, logical designs, sequence diagrams, API interface definitions, data schemas, etc. in close collaboration with software engineers Analyse and extend source code, focusing on simplicity, performance, maintainability and scalability Align architecture within and beyond iptiQ EMEA L&H to take advantage of synergies and to minimize total cost of ownership Shape a lean governance to align architecture and facilitate related meetings Develop vision for iptiQ's architecture and give guidance to software engineers and other stakeholders We are looking forward to working with you as the Lead Solution & Application Architect. You will report directly to the Head of Digital Innovation of iptiQ EMEA.     About the Team  iptiQ is a unit within the newly built Swiss Re Life Capital; established to deliver white-label life insurance solutions to be sold through partners, directly to consumers. iptiQ is young, motivated and technology driven team, organised to provide creative solutions for life insurance distributors across Europe that engage with consumers in non-traditional ways. Through our strong operational infrastructure, creative thinking, insurance know-how and ecommerce competences we want to drive the digitalization of the life insurance business in Europe.    About you  Qualifications:  Proven experience as a solution and application architect, i.e. 3+ years hands-on experience in solution and application architecture Proven software development capabilities, i.e. 5+ years hands-on experience as a developer Experienced in writing architecture-related artefacts like solution designs, sequence diagrams, API interface definitions, data schemas, etc. Experience in best practices around IT security and in treatment sensitive customer data according to GDPR (EU General Data Protection Regulation) Experience in workflow management, identity management, document management, etc. Experience with high-traffic micro services architectures and best practices around designing, scaling and monitoring concurrent systems You carefully evaluate design trade-offs and strive for simple, elegant, algorithmically efficient solutions You understand performance metrics, how to collect and use them to continuously improve performance, scalability and efficiency Experience in the design of API interfaces and of data-models Experience in CI/CD, test-driven-development (TDD) and automated testing    About you:  Great team player: you collaborate effectively with team members, express technical leadership supporting your views and ideas while keeping open to different opinions, being fearless and always supplying to the overall growth of the team Continuous learner who stays up-to-date with the latest trends and carefully vet with proper pragmatism and long-term vision the adoption of new technologies Master’s degree in computer science, engineering or equivalent working experience Ability to speak and write English fluently     We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.               Display original ad

Alpiq Holding Ltd. is a Swiss energy company operating throughout Europe. Its activities include the generation and supply of electricity, energy trading, energy management, energy services as well as energy technology. Alpiq Ltd. is a subsidiary of Alpiq Holding Ltd. with headquarters in Olten.Working Student in Customer Care  Oyster Lab is the cleantech company builder of Alpiq, one of the leading energy companies in Europe. We are an international team of engineers, designers, data scientists, researchers and energy experts based in the heart of Zurich, Switzerland. Together, we solve consumer problems and hope to make the world a greener place. We are now looking for a working student to support us as a customer care agent for one of our startup companies. You will contribute in turning Oyster Lab into one of the fastest and most innovative company builders in the energy and e-commerce sector.  Your mission   Provide friendly first-level support via phone, e-mail or chat during regular business hours. Process orders and complex inquiries from customers in Germany and Switzerland. Answer questions related to electric mobility (vehicles, charging, wallbox set-up etc.). Escalate technical issues to our experts and electricians. Manage and update customer accounts and contracts. Manage customer data through our CRM system.   Your profile   Currently enrolled as a university student. Friendly character and excellent communication skills. Ability to work independently, and to learn and apply new knowledge. Passion for electric mobility and everything related to it. Passion for working in a startup environment where constant change is the norm. High German and Swiss German language fluency. English language fluency is a plus. Intermediate French language skills are a plus. Driver's license for Switzerland is a plus, so that you can experience the product you're supporting.   Our offer Oyster Lab uses qualitative research methods to solve real needs of customers, and build products that combine great design and outstanding user experience. We develop digital platforms enabled by complex data and deep technologies such as Internet of things, artificial intelligence or distributed networks. With our deep understanding of the energy sector and digital economies, we build business models that are lean, connected and scalable. Join our international team of people who are strategic, transparent, supportive and encouraging. We maintain a start-up spirit with low hierarchies, yet enjoy the amenities of a grown-up enterprise. We offer a competitive salary, flexible working hours, amazing team events and game nights (e.g. table soccer, Mario Kart, Cards Against Humanity), and much more. English is our default language, and our Swiss colleagues will happily provide you with snackable Swiss-German lessons. Our office space lies within easy walking distance of central Zurich, Europe's wealthiest city and second most liveable cities in the world.

 Our offer  We call ourselves the Innovation Makers. Why? It’s not just because it is one of our corporate values, it’s about our cutting-edge approaches. We strive to innovate & transform the most creative ideas into concrete projects to exceed client expectations. At Altran we value excellence, care, responsibility, dynamism and innovation. Cognitive Rehabilitation Expert     Company Description   MindMaze is the world’s leading Neurotechnology start-up built on more than a decade of pioneering research at the intersection of virtual reality and neuroscience. Our breakthrough platform combines virtual & augmented reality, neuroscience and artificial intelligence to build intuitive human machine interfaces. Our first products help patients suffering from severe disabilities following a neurological incident. Join our eclectic mix of scientists, physicists, engineers and clinicians, and grow with MindMaze.     Job Description   The MindMaze Neuroscience team is searching for a full-time neuroscientist/neuropsychologist (MD/PhD) specializing in cognitive rehabilitation. As part of a multidisciplinary team, you will lead the development of digital therapies for rehabilitating cognitive function in neurological and aging conditions. Together with a multidisciplinary team of clinical field therapists, engineers, developers, marketing product experts, you will define the content of MindMaze cognitive digital therapies, and work on their implementation. You will also design and/or supervise experiments/clinical trials and analyze results to gather evidence for their efficacy. You will communicate these results internally, and/or externally in conferences, event and via academic publications.  Your mission   Designing and supervising the implementation of cognitive assessments and rehabilitation protocols and activities. Interacting with neurorehabilitation centres in Switzerland, Europe, US and Asia to run clinical trails and participate research projects.   Your responsibility:   Review and monitor available literature on rehabilitation efficacy. Design new rehabilitation approaches for stroke and other neurological conditions.  Design and supervise clinical studies. Analyse data. Attend and present data at most relevant conferences in neurorehabilitation and technology Write scientific papers.  To support you, MindMaze will:  Provide an international collaborative work environment Provide mentoring Allow flexible employment terms and conditions      Qualifications    Skills that we look out for are among   PhD or MD PhD in cognitive neuroscience, neuropsychology, behavioural neurology, cognitive neurorehabilitation 2+ years of postdoctoral experience with strong evidence of research output quality 3+ years of proven clinical experience Extensive experience with studying, assessing and rehabilitating cognitively impaired patients Strong understanding of modern theories explaining different cognitive functions (e.g. memory, attention, planning) Strong understanding of the scientific method and reasoning from first-principles Comfortable with using high-level programming languages (e.g., Python/Matlab) and software for statistical data analysis and visualization   Icing on the cake   Knowledge of state-of-the-art assessments of motor deficits, pain & fatigue following brain damage Experience in non-invasive measurement and stimulation techniques (fMRI, EEG, EMG, TMS, tDCS) Experience in techniques of analysis of brain lesions (e.g.,VLSM) and/or neuroimaging      Additional Information   To be successful, you can illustrate the fact that you have the following abilities:  Excellent communication skills in English and possible in French Team player: works well with others and strive for a common goal Planning and organising: effectively use resources to get things done. Can orchestrate multiple activities to accomplish a goal. Spends time on what is important Strong interpersonal skills: relates well to all kinds of people, builds constructive and effective relationships    Videos To Watch          I'm interestedDisplay original ad

Enterprise Architect - Cloud At Roche, we believe every employee makes a difference. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives. We believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are courageous in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. We are looking for new innovative Enterprise Architect (EA) and leader to work in our Global Enterprise Architecture Team to develop and maintain Cloud Computing and Management strategies. This includes engaging with a wide range of partners to guide them in making the right investments in technology and innovation. In this role you will provide technology strategy and architecture leadership and direction to the Roche Group worldwide. You will have direct impact on the future direction of Roche Cloud and Compute Infrastructure environment, addressing emerging business needs with innovative application of state-of-the-art capabilities. You will lead the positive cultural change for cloud adoption, develop and coordinate cloud architecture, and develop a cloud strategy and adaptation process.    Your main responsibilities will be:   Deliver clear value-based technology strategies and roadmaps to support our IT Business Partners to dedicatedly respond to digital transformation and disruption Provide insights and input for better decision-making to help build the capabilities required by our IT Partners and consumers of our services Lead and encourage the technology transformation from roadmap to realization by conducting assessments, innovation and prioritizing standards Assess technologies and trends in a methodical way to ensure insights based recommendations that fit the Roche environment. Analyze current technology environment to identify deficiencies and recommending solutions, as well as staying abreast of emerging security technologies and trends and apply them where appropriate Facilitate engagement and foster collaboration with architecture partners to ensure consistency in direction and decision-making     Furthermore, you will:   Create compelling presentations to articulate the technical strategies, architecture and roadmaps to various levels in the organization Work with Roche Science Infrastructure group to define the strategies and principles that guide technology decisions for the enterprise for scientific computing and analysis Support Contract and vendor negotiation for external cloud services (hosting and sourcing), including negotiation, relationship management, tracking, troubleshooting and reporting Consult on technical architecture implementation activities with all partners and Solution Owners to ensure alignment. Handle and work with Engineering on the evaluation and selection of Cloud related technologies and products. Identify the organizational, operational sustainability and financial impacts of defined strategies; analyze gaps to create a risk profile for the proposed strategy.     We believe to be successful in this position you'll need:   A Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience and certified in multiple Cloud areas (desired). Ideally, you have strong business knowledge in the Pharma/Biotech industry and associated processes and you bring the following qualifications: 10 to 15 years of experience in Compute and Cloud infrastructure with medium to large global enterprises with global geographical topologies Deep expertise in scalable and hybrid compute infrastructure design and delivery (including compute, storage, network), hybrid-cloud infrastructures, Cloud Security, Cloud Management Platforms, Data Protection, automation and orchestration frameworks, service-oriented architecture, network development and monitoring, containers Practical experience in cloud adoption, cloud application design, and cloud management and monitoring across public, private and hybrid cloud deployments. Use business knowledge and financial skills to create the business case for cloud deployments, including return on investment and efficiency measures Experienced communication and consulting skills; able to build strong relationships with customers, partners, and infrastructure teams.     What else should be in your toolbox?   Solid experience with Application architecture, integration tools and services, open source languages and tools, open standards Good understanding of security and compliance as related to Cloud, especially data protection and governance Accomplished in framing an enterprise IT architecture, confirmed to deliver robust, secure, scalable, highly available, and dynamic solutions to drive global business objectives Ability to review proposed solution architectures, identify risks and provide remediation recommendations in line with established standards and overall Cloud strategies Effectively engage partners at all levels and promote candid communication in the creation of strategies and roadmaps; able to influence and negotiate with business and IT Partners.    We are searching for someone who is active and influencing in your area of expertise; who is able to act fast and make quick decisions while taking risks. You enjoy challenges, think in opportunities and solutions, not only in threats. You are constantly looking for innovative ways to do things and opportunities for improvement and are able to live in ambiguity while reacting positively in constantly changing business environments. You understand the critical importance of diversity and take advantage to build stronger strategies. Be a great collaborator. Excellent English communication skills and understanding of what information is required by whom, when and how is mandatory.   We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you have questions, please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq. Display original ad

Grosszügige Sozialleistungen    Grosszügige Sozialleistungen Swisscom bietet dir über die Pensionskasse comPlan eine gut ausgebaute Altersvorsorge mit individuell wählbaren Sparvarianten. Bei Krankheit oder Unfall gewähren wir dir eine grosszügige Lohnfortzahlung.    Arbeitswelt    Arbeitswelt Bei Swisscom wird Innovation und kontinuierliche Verbesserung aktiv gefördert und von dir mitgestaltet. Wir arbeiten in interdisziplinären Teams. Co-working, Prototyping und agile Arbeitsmethoden sind fester Bestandteil unserer Kultur.    Flexibel arbeiten    Flexibel arbeiten Mit der Möglichkeit zu Gleitzeit, Teilzeit oder Jobsharing unterstützen wir dich dabei, Arbeit und Privatleben gut unter einen Hut zu bringen. Und weil Reisen den Horizont erweitert, kannst du entweder unbezahlten Urlaub beantragen oder pro Jahr bis zu zwei Wochen zusätzliche Ferien kaufen.    Familie und Beruf    Familie und Beruf Uns ist wichtig, dass du Beruf und Familie optimal miteinander vereinbaren kannst. Wir gewähren 18 Wochen Mutterschaftsurlaub und 3 Wochen Vaterschaftsurlaub. Mit dem Programm «Childcare» unterstützen wir dich bei Fragen zur Betreuung deiner Kinder und ermöglichen dir mit «Work & Care», kranke Angehörige zu pflegen.    Fringe Benefits    Fringe Benefits Wir offerieren dir einen monatlichen grosszügigen Rabatt auf bestimmte Swisscom Produkte. Zudem profitierst du von vergünstigten Tickets und Abonnements des öffentlichen Verkehrs. Ein weiterer Vorteil: In unseren Personalrestaurants kannst du dich gesund und für wenig Geld verpflegen. Job title: Technical Business Analyst for our Peer-Review Platform
Content: Technical Business Analyst for our Peer-Review Platform     Technical Business Analyst for our Peer-Review Platform Product Management - Data ProductsLausanne, Vaud, SwitzerlandFull timeProduct Management    OverviewApplication  Description Frontiers, a leading Open Access Publisher and Open Science Platform, is looking for a talented Business Analyst to join its Product Management team. As Technical Business Analyst, you will work closely with Product Managers, Data Scientists, and Engineers who are responsible for the data and AI driven products of the Frontiers peer-review platform. Due to the fast working environment of Frontiers and the complexities of our current and future solutions, we are seeking an enthusiastic team player with great initiative and a get-it-done attitude, that is able to perfectly bridge the gap between technical and business stakeholders. Therefore proven experience as a business analyst on an open-access peer review platform as well as a strong technical background are mandatory. You must be able to handle a fast-paced work environment while juggling several different tasks at the same time. You also must have an eye for detail and high standards, with highly developed critical thinking, interpretive and analytical skills, and the ability to communicate product vision across multiple cross-functional teams..     What you will do:   Gather, document and analyze current processes and workflows for our open-access peer review platform; Collaborate with development teams to provide detailed specifications, business input and user feedback. Work with stakeholders to understand and document business requirements; Translate product vision into detailed functional and technical specifications for an academic publishing platform (use cases, interfaces, workflows - BPMN, DMN using Camunda, APIs); Create training materials and user guidelines specifically dedicated to an academic population;; Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve products, discover issues, and deliver better value to the users.   Requirements:   Minimum 5 years of hands-on working experience as a Business Analyst on a peer-review review platform, with a focus on open access (mandatory); Extensive hands-on knowledge of academic publishing processes and open access peer review processes; Strong experience in writing functional and technical specifications, including diagrams, workflows and use cases; Previous experience in documenting workflows using BPMN specifically for workflow and decision automation platforms (Camunda); Good working-knowledge of database technologies and understand data modeling concepts: relational databases (MSSQL), document databases (MongoDB), search engine (ElasticSearch); Good understanding of web technologies, XML, JSON, REST APIs and message broker technologies (RabbitMQ); Good understanding of authentication and authorization OAuth 2.0 flows; Strong analytical skills and independent, entrepreneurial approach; Working language is English - solid communication skills in English, both written and verbal are an absolute must. CVs and motivation letter must be provided in English.   Benefits:   25 days' vacation per year and Christmas office closure; Participation into the company's annual bonus scheme; Access to the latest equipment and international working environment; Professional development opportunities; Plenty of social & fun benefits: Christmas party, summer barbecue, monthly happy hour; Fruits & snacks in the kitchen as well as much tea & coffee as you like; In-house well being activities including free weekly yoga; A huge variety of self-organized activities from ski trips and football to French club.       How to apply  Please submit your application in English. Applicants must be Swiss or EU citizen, or have a valid Swiss work permit.    Apply for this job      Display original ad

Medicinal Chemist    Medicinal Chemist  Switzerland Chemistry Full-time    Apply for this job      Your role is to automate the processing of biochemical databases and to develop modelling software for hit-to-lead compound optimization.          Requirements   PhDs in quantum chemistry, molecular biology or a related discipline. Three or more years of experiences in medicinal chemistry and hit-to-lead optimization for neurodegenerative diseases at a pharmaceutical company. Three or more years of experience in structure/ligand-based drug design, pharmacophore modeling, pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic data analysis and modeling, molecular docking, virtual screening, QSAR,or other computer-aided drug design techniques. Capable of working independently and overcoming challenges without supervision while being a team player.            Desired skills and experience   Three of more years of experience in product-level application of deep neural networks in drug discovery or medical diagnostics. One or more publications in Nature, Science, Nature Neuroscience, Nature Methods, Nature Protocols, NIPS or other high-impact journals or conferences. Professional knowledge and practice of Python, Bash, Perl, or other scripting languages. Experience with cloud computing environments (AWS, Azure, etc.). Comfortable with both a logic analyzer and a wrench. Exceptional ability and track record of developing original and unconventional ideas/theories/models/inventions based on rethinking/reinventing the first principles of single or multiple fields.       Desired personal qualities   First-principles-based thinking Extraordinary composure and integrity in face of dire condition Ruthless rationality and candor in the pursuit of knowledge Profound empathy and charitableness in the matter of people Resilience and fearlessness working outside your comfort zone Described by others as the most radical yet humblest researcher / engineer / thinker they know Intellectual breadth Sense of humor      Application without a cover letter will not be considered.    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.   Apply for this job   Display original ad

Salesforce Developer     Salesforce Developer Product Management - Data ProductsLausanne, Vaud, SwitzerlandSoftware Development & Delivery    OverviewApplication  Description We are looking for experienced Salesforce Solution Engineers to help us drive our Salesforce integration and adoption to the next level.. You will play a key role in enabling our internal team of 400+ people to use Salesforce as their daily driver while transforming open-access publishing and shaping the future of science.. You will be joining a fast-growing company, you will have direct exposure to the business customer and full independence in enabling their use cases. You work in a small team along with other talented engineers, product managers and business analysts. Your team is in charge of implementing solutions in a Salesforce platform and integrating different products with Salesforce, as well as developing other transversal applications relevant for the core business of Frontiers.   What you do as a Solution Engineer  You deliver business value on a daily basis You design, develop, test, document and deploy high quality solutions on Sales Cloud and Marketing Cloud of the Force.com platform You assess new tools and apps, build prototypes and proof of concept, and offer recommendations to improve our SalesForce implementation. You work with the business customer to develop new solutions or enhance existing one using lightning components, process builder, flows, visualforce and Apex. You provide technical and functional expertise on SalesForce to the team. You initiate and participate in technical discussions where many tools, architectures and processes are on the table. You submit pull requests and discuss solutions with the team in order to share knowledge.    What we are looking for:  At least 2 years of experience working as a Salesforce developer (Salesforce certification a plus) Provable experience with Marketing Cloud and/or Sales Cloud Experience developing and maintaining custom apps on Force.com platform Service Cloud experience appreciated You are not afraid to fail fast and learn from mistakes Solid oral, written, presentation and interpersonal communication and relationship skills You have very good English skills.   Nice to have:   Salesforce Certifications Experience working with Web Services, REST APIs and .NET Experience with SOQL and SQL queries. You are good at improving the skills of your colleagues by helping and training them on Salesforce products.    What we’re offering  Competitive salary. 25 leave days. Great work-life balance. An office in an awesome location. Fresh fruit, snacks and coffee. Team building/sport activities and monthly social events. Lots of opportunities to work with exciting technologies and solve challenging problems.   How to apply  Please submit your application in English. Applicants must be Swiss or EU citizen, or have a valid Swiss work permit. Agencies must first contact jobs@frontiersin.org and confirm agreement to our T&C’s, failing which any exclusivity and/or candidate representation right will be considered to be waived.    Apply for this job      Display original ad

Product Marketing Manager As our Product Marketing Manager, you will own the positioning and go-to-market strategy of our products in ways that will strengthen our brand and build pipeline in Scandit’s most important industry verticals. The position in our Zurich based Product Marketing team is a key contributor to fueling Scandit’s growth and a strong liaison between Scandit’s global marketing & sales teams and its Switzerland-based product team.   What You Will Do   Create product positioning and messagingand customer facing collateral and presentations  Analyze industry vertical specific market opportunities, trends and competitive landscapes  Work with teams and tools across the organization todesign effective go-to-market and content strategiesthat build Scandit’s deal pipeline Manage creation of high value, written content on a wide variety of industry relevant topics (in collaboration with subject matter experts and by doing own research) Collaborate with Marketing to develop content for brand awareness and demand generation campaigns Working hands on and cross-functionally with engineering, product management, marketing and sales on new product launches Create industry vertical specific material and messaging for trade shows and events   Who You Are   At least 3 years of experience in aB2B product marketing, product managementor marketing at a technology-driven software organization, Healthcare or Transport & Logistics industry experience a plus.   Proven experience in B2B content creation and managementfor pipeline generation purposes  Strong project management and organization skills with deep analytical skillsand a high attention to detail Experienced working with complex challenges, comfortable with white space and autonomy and understands the value of a rapid test and learn approach Global mindset, effective working with marketers, product managers, engineers,as well as finance and operations teams to get the information needed to be successful  Skilled with words and creating written content Strong visual and aesthetic sense for creating beautiful content is a plus Excellent English communication skills, both oral and written. Additional languages a plus We are not looking for Digital Marketing or SEO specialist at this time  Eligible to work in Switzerland   Who We Are   Scandit enables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.  Scandit’s mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit’s technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery. Many of the world’s most innovative and successful companies are benefiting from Scandit’s enterprise-grade mobile data capture platform, including Sephora, Louis Vuitton, DHL, and Levi Strauss & Co.    Display original ad

Junior DevOps    Job Title Junior DevOps   Vacancy Reference Number 16310   Work Site Switzerland / | CHE - All Regions / Geneva   Contract Type Permanent [Full-Time]   Minimum number of years of experience required 0 year or "beginner accepted"     
 Our offer  We call ourselves the Innovation Makers. Why? It’s not just because it is one of our corporate values, it’s about our cutting-edge approaches. We strive to innovate & transform the most creative ideas into concrete projects to exceed client expectations. At Altran we value excellence, care, responsibility, dynamism and innovation. We’re not just offering you a job; we’re inviting you to be part of our community. We will provide you trainings on last technologies, also on DevOps & grounds to work for top notch companies & engineer the career you like. Each career experience is assorted by an attractive salary package. If you are a team player looking to satisfy your thirst of knowledge, you’ve found the place.  Your role   Promote code out of our Software Factory to production, with the goal of automating every part of the process without making any compromise on the quality of the delivered solution. Setup state-of-the-art analytics and monitoring capabilities, providing both prescriptive and predictive insights. Diagnose production issues, perform root cause analysis and work with all members of the cross-functional team to propose solutions. Provide specifications and code reproducers so that Software Engineers can write bug fixes. Provide continuous guidance to Software Engineers around operational challenges, such as reliability and manageability, making sure that software implementations are production-proof. Design and write code for infrastructure, Quality Assurance, configuration, or security components. Promote data-driven decision making and identify the metrics that matter   Your profile   You have 1 to 2 years of experience and hold a Bachelor or Master degree in computer science from EPFL/HES You like to develop on Java 8 & Front Angular 2 or JS (with React, Viewjs) usingOracle - Mango SQL You have strong interest to learn on DevOps methodology, including automation, infrastructure as code and XaaS Familiar with containers and orchestrators: using Docker and Kubernetes Understanding of Agile methodologies Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills Fluent in English and French Must live and Resident in Switzerland       Display original ad

Product Manager 80-100%   Join ABB and work in a team that is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies allow greater access to cleaner energy.  PMA has been developing, producing, and marketing premium-quality polyamide cable protection systems since 1975. Offering a range of high-end products designed in Switzerland, we have rapidly evolved into a market leader of global repute. Encompassing more than 6,500 products, our portfolio is revered within the international rail, shipbuilding, and mechanical engineering industries. At the same time, PMA products are highly valued by customers operating within the area of automation and building installations as well as in those fields in which the reliable protection of energy and data lines is essential. Your responsibilities  Manage new product/system/service launch and life cycle from phase-in to phase-out, including coordination of product road map and definition/execution of recovery plans where required Manage profitability and life cycle of specific product/system/service line or group by defining product/system/service pricing guidelines and market position Oversee inventory levels and sales volumes on a regular basis to ensure ability to fulfill customer orders, in addition to tracking and analyzing product/system/service performance and trends in respect of volume and profitability Coordinate analyses to evaluate market situation and contribute to development of compelling marketing plans Ensure effective provision of technical and commercial support for sales force with regard to critical or high-end negotiations Maintain close dialogue with R&D for the purpose of proposing and evaluating product feasibility projects and road maps for new products/systems/services and variants Collaborate with internal Marketing and Sales teams to define marketing plans, including marketing communication campaigns, training activities, and sales initiatives Ensure that the area of responsibility is properly organized, staffed, skilled, and directed  Your background  Qualified engineer with broad background in design and electromechanical engineering Proven track record in project and product management Excellent knowledge of market and business environment Demonstrable experience in leadership and people management/development Well-developed communication and excellent interpersonal skills Ability to think systematically as well as the capacity to influence at all levels Fluent command of English at a business level   Display original ad

SUPERVISOR PAYROLL (m/f)     SUPERVISOR PAYROLL (m/f)         Job Posting Title: SUPV II PAYROLL Segment: CORPORATE (10020197) Business Unit: GLOBAL HUMAN RESOURCES (10003001) Building: Steinach (542) Relocation: Yes - Domestic Travel: None Education Experience: Associate Degree (High School +2 years) Employment Experience: 3-5 years   Company Information  TE Connectivity Ltd., is a $14 billion global technology and manufacturing leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. For more than 75 years, our connectivity and sensor solutions, proven in the harshest environments, have enabled advancements in transportation, industrial applications, medical technology, energy, data communications, and the home. With 80,000 employees, including more than 8,000 engineers, working alongside customers in approximately 140 countries, TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at www.te.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, WeChat and Twitter.    Job Overview   Reporting to the Sr. HR Solutions Manager, this person will supervise the activities of a small team of Payroll employees. He/she will implement and contribute to policy/procedures and administer the preparation, documentation and disbursement of paychecks, taxes, and benefit payments. Delivers and improves Payroll processes and programs through continuous improvement and evaluation efforts, technology solutions and centralized shared services.     Responsibilities    Oversees the accurate and timely processing of payroll. Resolves individual and system-wide payroll issues. Ensures quality customer service to employees and departments. Reviews audits and ensures accuracy and data integrity. Evaluates payroll procedures and systems, recommends improvements. Ensures financial compliance with TE policies and procedures and applicable legal rules and regulations. Supports the integration of mergers and acquisition for payroll. Keeps abreast of all Payroll regulatory related issues to ensure compliance. Ensures adherence to budgetary guidelines and continuous improvement of Payroll programs and practices. Provides effective and efficient Payroll services and support within established budgets, principles and regulations, laws and employment standards. Responsibility as Key User for the Time & Attendance system and its interfaces. Supervises, motivates, assesses performance and develops a small team of Payroll employees.      Qualifications & Skills    Education:   Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent); advanced degree preferred. Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) preferred. Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).   Qualifications:   Fluent in English and German (French, Italian is a Plus) Comfortable to work in a fast-paced, international matrix organization  Customer Service mindset; Drive for Results Autonomous; Self-confident and able a high level of multi- tasking   Experience:   Typically requires 3+ years of progressive Payroll experience as Payroll Clerk / Analyst. Prior supervisory experience may be required Knowledge of Payroll laws Experience in Payroll disciplines, including data management, metrics and measurement and operations Experience with tax systems and reporting preferred Experience with time and attendance systems preferred Prior experience in an international environment preferred                            Location: Steinach, SG, CH, 12345        Travel: None       Requisition ID: 44545       Alternative Locations:           Job Segment:Manager, Payroll, Developer, Law, Compliance, Management, Finance, Technology, Legal Display original ad

Junior ITSM Consultant  Junior ITSM Consultant       Start Time:   Location:            asap Zurich, Switzerland            LUTION is a young, dynamic and small company focused on delivering services in the area of IT Service Management. We are a MicroFocus (formerly HPE) and ServiceNow Business Partner. We search for a junior ITSM Consultant to extend our team.    What we offer.   very good job conditions flexible work time / part time possible (might depend on current projects & customer contracts) interesting challenges a professional and dynamic team possibilities for further education   The job profile.   As a junior consultant your initial function is providing operation support to existing customers. The team will train you on the job and provide you the skills to become a Senior ITSM consultant. You consult and convoy our customers in realisation of their IT Service Management strategy As a ITSM Consultant you enjoy the challenges of the project business. You like it to take over different roles - one day you act as a Process Expert, Release or Test Manager, the other day you become a Project Manager, Software Developer or Solution Architect You support the Sales and Pre-Sales process Travelling is your daily business. LUTION is aiming to limit travelling for our Consultants to its minimum   Which Skills are required?   You are open and enthusiastic when it comes to new methods and technologies You got some Software Development skills and you are familiar with most common technologies and methodologies You got some database and data modelling skills You are working always customer centric and service oriented You are a team player and got good communication skills You are fluent in German (both written and verbal) Preferrably you are fluent in English (both written and verbal). At least a imtermediate level is required. Some experience in using or even operating/implementing ITSM solutions is a clear benefit but not required. At least you gained already some experience as an engineer or support staff within an IT organization. Preferrably you are already ITIL V3 or ITIL 2011 Foundation certified    Interested? Send us your application papers either in English or German by clicking on "Application" below..      application   Display original ad

Solution Consultant FSM Coresystems FSM – now part of SAP – is a field service software company helping mid- and large enterprises  manage field services. Our solution brings together the right data at the right moment to delight customers and  drive business results - all delivered in the cloud to any mobile device with artificial intelligence in real-time. We’re  transforming field service with cutting edge technology to help companies create perfect service moments and  delight customers.  Our young and innovative company is looking for a  THE ROLE We are looking for an enthusiastic Solution Consultant to join our FSM Projects team at our headquarters inWindisch (Switzerland). As a Solution Consultant you deliver solutions to our customers in close collaboration withrequirement engineers and product owners. You understand the business requirements of large and complexindustrial businesses and are responsible for the correct configuration of the Field Service Management (FSM)solution. We are looking forward to your personal “core moments”!  CURIOUS ABOUT THE DAY-TO-DAY?   Responsible to find the best solutions to meet customer’s requirements and actively deliver customerspecific solution configuration Partner with requirement engineers, product owners and key stakeholders to ensure fit for purpose end-to-end functionality Describe solutions in use cases, customization or configuration and keep the documentation always up-to-date Review solutions and documentations with the project manager and product owners Update the project manager regularly about the work status and report work progress in Jira   CURIOUS IF YOU´RE FIT?   Consulting experience from different FSM projects Comprehensive knowledge of FSM solutions in large and complex industrial businesses and solidbackground of field service processes Ability to translate customer requirements into solutions within the FSM platform Good exposure to business IT solutions and integration concepts Strong understanding of data structures and SQL languages Excellent communication (English and German), presentation and documentation skills to leadworkshops, meetings and trainings Open-minded and flexible team player who enjoys working in a dynamic environment   JOIN US, BECAUSE   We are an enthusiastic, cool company and we like to have fun – during working hours and outside them We really engage ourselves in developing our products and take pride in delivering results Stretching yourself to achieve challenging goals is satisfying to us In our open culture, we welcome other opinions and enjoy discussing solutions The flexible and dynamic working environment gives us a lot of freedom and enables us to perform at ahigh level Our skills and know-how are up-to-date thanks to the yearly training courses we attend. We also offer theopportunity to travel to our other locations for know-how sharing We support mobile communication and mobility costs – unpaid leave is an extra cool benefit   Have we piqued your interest? We look forward to receiving your application via email: recruiting-fsm@coresystems.net   CONTACT Bianca KöpfHR Business PartnerDisplay original ad

Market Research Internship Temporary Verity is the global leader in autonomous indoor drone systems and a leading provider of drone failsafe technology. Founded in 2014, Verity's drones have completed more than 150,000 autonomous flights safely above people, in more than 100 facilities in 20 countries worldwide. Its systems also enable the deployment of dynamic sensors and other payloads anywhere in commercial and industrial facilities. Verity’s drones have been used by some of the world’s biggest names in entertainment, including Cirque du Soleil and Madison Square Garden, and in global tours of major artists including Drake and Metallica. We are entrepreneurs, engineers, artists, professionals, mathematicians, and designers; all working as one. Do you want to join a fast-moving young company where your contributions will make a difference? Then join us! Internships may begin at any time during the year. Interns are expected to join the team for a minimum of six months.  Responsibilities Working within a small team and reporting to the Head of Marketing directly you’ll be required to:• Research and compile data from secondary sources• Conduct primary research in the form of surveys• Perform competitive analyses for all product lines• Assist with report creation, including analysis, data entry and creating presentable and easy-to-understand tables in Excel• Develop a deep understanding of the way potential clients operate in each of the market segments and map the decision-making flow• Run basic quantitative analyses and be comfortable working with numbers• Assist on other projects within the marketing team when required• Specific project-related responsibilities depending on skills and requests  Qualifications • Background in business administration/economics• Experience in using Microsoft Office; strong Excel skills required• Excellent written and spoken English language skills required• Excellent team player and self-driven• Motivated, willing to learn – interest• Tenacious and willing to go the extra mile to find information  Benefits • Work in an interdisciplinary, international team of highly skilled people• Have a significant impact in a rapidly growing young company• Fair remuneration, support provided for relocation• Work independently on your own projects Display original ad

Business Analyst Client Reporting 100%    Was du bewegstFür unsere internen und externen Kunden bist du die Ansprechperson für Themen zu Business Intelligence. Dein ausgeprägtes End-to-End-Verständnis für IT Service Management und Sourcing-Prozesse beweist du auch, wenn du Anforderungen an das Data Warehouse Team formulierst. Senior Back-End Developer (PHP7), 80-100% Job Description You will be part of a small and motivated team, actively contributing to the development of our various web applications. Most of your time will be spent working on our online surveying platforms, which total more than one million visitors per month – a number that is growing at a rapid pace. Our newest product, www.surveyhero.com, will receive the most of your attention. You will be deeply involved in the design process for new exciting product requirements and take over responsibility for considerable parts of our existing PHP7 code base. Based on new requirements, you will independently analyze and elaborate possible software designs and implement them on your own, while closely working with other Back-End and Front-End Developers. Ideally, you will also optimize our databases, improve our continuous integration processes, set up and maintain our AWS resources, extend our API and third-party integrations, give technical support to other team members, and much more. Skills & Requirements It is easy to underestimate the technical challenges of running an online survey platform on a large scale: Users will share their surveys with as many people as possible, often resulting in unannounced, dramatic traffic spikes. Our platform must be highly available and scalable, as well as maintaining fast loading times, because survey participants won't "just come back later" if it is down; We save and process large amounts of data that needs to be made available to our users in real-time. This data is often sensitive, so security is also a very important aspect of our work; We send millions of user generated emails (survey invitations) and need to ensure that they are delivered, all while preventing abuse from spam and phishing attempts. We offer a vast number of features, resulting in a large and complex code base. Maintainable and extendable code, automated tests and a well-organized software architecture is key to the continuation of our success. This is what we are looking for:  University degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering, or equivalent qualifications 5+ years of experience as a Back-End Developer in PHP Rock-solid engineer mastering object-oriented programming and common design patterns Great experience with SQL and working with large data sets Comfortable with Linux, having no problem to set up and maintain web application servers and other back-end resources Good knowledge of the full stack of modern web applications including HTML5 and JavaScript You are fluent in English  One or more of these are a big plus:  Proficient in at least one more programming language other than PHP or JavaScript Able to describe your software design and applied design patterns using UML Practice test-driven development by default Know-how in managing continuous integration processes Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Already used tools such as Git (GitHub), Gulp, TeamCity or Jenkins, TypeScript, IntelliJ/PHPStorm Experience in working in an agile team You speak (Swiss) German  About us We are a Zurich based Internet company that develops and runs professional web applications. Unlike regular digital agencies, we do not take on any external client work but only develop and maintain our own products in-house. This allows us to fully focus on creating and evolving great web applications that are currently being used by hundreds of thousands of people every day around the world. In addition to the opportunity to be part of a very successful team and help shape our increasingly rapid growth you will benefit from the following:  A wide range of interesting tasks with the responsibility and freedom for you to work independently Enough time to keep yourself up to date regarding technology and web trends so that you can incorporate this knowledge into your daily work Flexible full-time or part-time work with flexible working hours Great job security and a competitive salary Relaxed working atmosphere in a beautiful and modern office in the very heart of Zurich, Seefeld  Application If you feel you are the right person for this vacancy, then please do not hesitate to send us your complete application in either German or English. Please include and describe some of your most amazing work that showcases that you have the experience and knowledge we are looking for. You can send everything by email to Lionel Marbot at jobs@enuvo.ch.   Please note that a Swiss resident permit or a valid labor permit is required and that we only accept direct applications from potential candidates. We do not accept applications from recruiting agencies or head hunters.  By the way, we are also looking for a Senior Front-End Developer, 80-100%. Display original ad

Desktop Developer Risk Control Department 100% Desktop Developer Risk Control Department   Become a part of our young and dynamic teamLeonteq Securities was initially founded in 2007 as an issuer of investment products by 4 industry experts, and as of 2012 Leonteq is listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange. We have been growing significantly along with investing heavily into our platform which we have built from scratch to bring it to its market leading status it has today.    Desktop Developer Risk Control Department       About the role  As a Software Engineer you will have a unique and exciting opportunity to join a young and dynamic company, committed to delivering value added services in the investment product space. You will be part of the IT Development department, responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining key business tools for the Risk Control Department.     YOUR TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES  Work directly with the Risk Control Department and IT units to implement, maintain and support key software solutions using Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle SQL and Excel/VBA Improve and maintain existing Excel/VBA solutions that tightly integrate into our Datawarehouse and Pnl-Analyzer infrastructure. Provide support for these solutions and your own developments Proactively reach out to your clients and peer developers, sit next to them, and understand their needs and requirements without Business Analysts Build trust-based relationships with your colleagues and clients Produce quality code that will stay maintainable for many years  Our requirements   Proven track-record in creating Excel/VBA-based solutions based on complex database-schemas Proven track-record in creating stored procedures and schema design in Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle SQL Strong understanding of data-warehouse-design Good spoken and written English communication skills Good knowledge of risk control of financial products or a strong interest in learning about it Keen to explore the world of investment banking and derivative financial products    Nice to have   Professional experience with Essbase and MDX Professional experience with SSAS      ARE YOU INTERESTED In supporting the build-out of our young and innovative company within a fast growing & entrepreneurial team?If so, please click on “Apply” to submit your application. HR Generalist  ProtonMail was born at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) in 2013 when a group of scientists and engineers envisioned an email service that empowers users to own their private data and keeps them safe from mass surveillance. Since then, ProtonMail has grown to become the world’s largest secure email service, with over 20 million users and a profitable business model. We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team and help us build a suite of security tools that safeguard privacy online build a better Internet.     Role description:    We are looking for an HR Generalist to join our growing team. You will be based in the Geneva office, handle a number of technical and non-technical positions and create or implement a variety of HR initiatives.    What you will do:    Manage recruitment for multiple roles, focusing on Geneva and Zurich offices, attracting top talent from all around the world   Ensure smooth on-boarding for new employees and improve their day-to-day experience    Consult team leads and team members on a variety of people related topics    Participate in or lead various people related initiatives (training & development, employee well-being, feedback sessions) locally and globally   Promote a culture of collaboration, diversity and trust  Display original ad

Software Engineer, Fullstack 80-100%   Each and every day, around 15,000 employees in the Valora network work to brighten up their customers’ journey with a comprehensive convenience and food offering – nearby, quick, convenient and fresh. The more than 2,700 small-scale outlets of Valora are located at highly frequented sites in Switzerland, Germany, Austria, Luxembourg and the Netherlands. The company includes, among others, the formats k kiosk, Brezelkönig, BackWerk, Ditsch, Press & Books, avec, Caffè Spettacolo and the popular own brand ok.– as well as a continuously growing range of digital services. Valora is also one of the world’s leading producers of pretzels and benefits from a well-integrated value chain in the area of baked goods.  Zurich / Muttenz / Remote Software Engineer, Fullstack 80-100%Engineering for you is more about a clean codebase, paradigms and algorithms than languages, frameworks or platforms. You have chosen your favorite stack, but you are able to get stuff done in any environment you need to and with every change you leave the codebase better off than before. You will be one of the first members of our engineering team and will work on many different projects and touch many different systems: from our app backends (REST webservices) to our demand forecasting service and our cash register. Key tasks and responsibilities    Create new and work on existing systems across a wide range of projects (e.g. a clean and elegant API layer spanning across all of our legacy systems, backend APIs consumed by our web and mobile apps, production tooling for our machine learning models etc.) Improve and maintain our production environment, for example by adding monitoring and alerting (DevOps) Work closely together with our frontend engineering and data science teams    Key skills / requirements    Software development experience in a general purpose programming language BSc degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience Ability to quickly get up to speed in any programming language or system if needed Ability to tackle problems outside your comfort zone Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English   Desirable:   Experience in any of the following programming languages: Java, C/C++, C#, Python, JavaScript, Rust or Go Experience working with one or more from the following: web application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, service oriented architectures, REST APIs, developing large software systems Experience working in teams following an agile software development methodology Basic knowledge of German    What we offer    Build products for a customer base of more than 5 million people across 5 countries Access the resources of a big corporate but get the freedom of working in an uncomplicated environment Work from home when you need to Competitive salary 9 out of 12 points on “The Joel Test” (  https://www.joelonsoftware.com/2000/08/09/the-joel-test-12-steps-to-better-code/)   A contact you should connect with We look forward to receiving your complete application documents. Please apply online only. Direct applications are preferred.  Apply online now    Valora — brightens up your journey    Would you like to know more about us?
