SAP Sales Specialist, Google Cloud The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners. Our team of engineers, product managers, and sales and marketing professionals work with a vast array of partners and customers to advance the company's mission to organize the world's information to make it universally accessible and useful. As an SAP Sales Specialist, you will be a solutions sales executive, overlaying to our direct enterprise sales organization, and working closely with our largest customers to help them shape their cloud strategy and enable their digital transformation. You have deep knowledge of SAP offerings, the SAP team and customer base, and the sales strategies required to help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud and navigate acquisition processes. As a member of the Google Cloud team, you'll focus on customers with SAP workloads on Google Cloud Platform. You'll advocate for the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative, and mobile. Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life. Display original ad

Software Development Internship Temporary  Description.  THE NEXT OPPORTUNITY TO JOIN THE TEAM IN THIS POSITION IS APRIL 1 2020 Verity is the global leader in autonomous indoor drone systems and a leading provider of drone failsafe technology. Founded in 2014, Verity's drones have completed more than 150,000 autonomous flights safely above people, in more than 100 facilities in 20 countries worldwide. Its systems also enable the deployment of dynamic sensors and other payloads anywhere in commercial and industrial facilities. Verity’s drones have been used by some of the world’s biggest names in entertainment, including Cirque du Soleil and Madison Square Garden, and in global tours of major artists including Drake and Metallica. We are entrepreneurs, engineers, artists, professionals, mathematicians, and designers; all working as one. Do you want to join a fast-moving start-up where your contributions will make a difference? Then join us! Our software team works on a multitude of challenging and interesting tasks, such as implementing drivers for proprietary embedded platform, defining robust and efficient communication protocols, designing algorithms to retrieve, process, and analyze significant amount of data, and implementing graphical user interfaces for control stations. Internships may begin at any time during the year. Interns are expected to join the team for a minimum of six months.  Responsibilities.  • Design and development of software for the operation of complex mechatronic systems (including high-level algorithms, communication protocols, and user interfaces)• Participate in the full software life cycle, including design, implementation testing and deployment• Assure high quality and efficiency of your code with unit testing and code reviews  Qualifications.  • Background in computer engineering or computer science with a strong academic record and a demonstrated ability to convert theory into practice• Good C++ knowledge is a must• In-depth understanding of algorithms and data structures is desirable• Python knowledge is a plus• Creative approach to problem solving• Excellent team and communication skills• Good English skills, written and spoken  Benefits.  • Work in an interdisciplinary, international team of highly skilled people• Create ground-breaking technology for some of the world’s most prominent stage productions• Very broad and deep area of responsibility• Shape the culture and have a significant impact in a rapidly growing young company Display original ad

Quality System Manager      Quality System Manager We are looking for a quality systems manager for our location in Balzers (LI) or alternatively in Bingen am Rhein (D). You will bring to that role a deep understanding and experience in the field of QM systems, as well as lengthy, practice-oriented work experience while being a trustful team player.     Responsibilities In this position you will be responsible for the maintenance, update and continuous development of the global Oerlikon Balzers quality management system (QMS) and GATE (QMS Tool), as well as control and planning of the global system audit program and all relevant certifications.   Quality management system:  Change Request processing (processes and documents) and preparation and direction of the CR committee meetings Preparing data-background for the decisions making process of the QMS (GATE) Core Team System maintenance and update Support of process owners Global system support, also on-site, as well as training Interface to IT and external software consultant for GATE QMS Tool coordination of updates Ensure that the QMS meets the requirements of all relevant norms, as well as all internal and external customer requirements    Process owner for:  Control of documents Monitoring and controlling the assigned KPI (document control) Maintain and update Risk and opportunities with related Process-owners    Operational maintenance of the GATE system:  Administration of data / content / lists (...) Document maintenance / update Maintaining technical system availability Trouble shooting Ticket processing and hotline    Audit management and auditing:  Responsible for the global Oerlikon Balzers audit tool and associated certification matrix Planning of external system audits according to IATF 16949, ISO9001 and ISO14001 Actions tracking    We expect    University degree in the field of industrial engineering or similar   Very good understanding of QM systems and IT software on the subject, as well as SharePoint   Minimum 7 years professional experience in the industry as quality manager and / or QMS responsible   Good knowledge of standards (ISO 9001: 2015, IATF 16949: 2016)   Further standard knowledge beneficial (ISO 13485: 2016, ISO 14001, NADCAP, AS9100)   Good practical experience in the field of audit execution (system, process) and audit control   Solution-oriented and practice-oriented approach   Reliable, detail-oriented and proactive personality   Very good understanding of the process-oriented approach   Very good communication German/English spoken and written    About us  Oerlikon is a leading global technology Group, with a clear strategy to become a global powerhouse in surface solutions, advanced materials and materials processing. Backed by the key ability to intelligently engineer and process surface solutions and advanced materials, the Group is committed to invest in value-bringing technologies that provide customers with lighter, more durable, more efficient and environmentally sustainable products. A Swiss company with over 100 years of tradition, Oerlikon has a global footprint of over 13 500 employees at more than 180 locations in 37 countries and sales of CHF 2.3 billion in 2016. The company invested CHF 94 million in R&D in 2016 and has over 1 000 specialists developing innovative and customer-oriented products and services. The Surface Solutions Segment of the Oerlikon Group includes the two brands Oerlikon Balzers and Oerlikon Metco. The Segment operates more than 145 facilities with over 140 coating centres in 37 countries in Europe, the Americas, Asia and Australia, employing more than 6 000 people. Oerlikon Balzers is one of the world’s leading suppliers of surface technologies that significantly improve the performance and durability of precision components as well as tools for the metal and plastics processing industries. Oerlikon Balzers operates a dynamically growing network of more than 100 coating centres in 35 countries in Europe, the Americas and Asia. Join us and become a part of our future oriented, international team.     Display original ad

Job title: Machine learning - Vision algorithms Specialist/ Post Doc
Content:
Machine learning - Vision algorithms Specialist/ Post DocThe high-tech activities of CSEMrange at swiss and international levelsfrom applied research to the developmentof industrial products. The high degree of expertiseof our staff is our strength. CSEM is a private research, technology and innovation center specializing in microtechnology, microelectronics, system engineering and renewable energy systems. It offers its customers and industry partners custom-made innovative solutions. Our strength is the excellence of our people. The Vision Embedded Systems group within the 'Integrated and Wireless Systems' division, based in Neuchâtel is currently looking for a:   
The applied research and industrial activities conducted within the Vision Embedded Systems section of CSEM are devoted to capture, process and extract visual information from scenes. Our activity spreads from the development of complete system solution and innovative ASIC for pre-processing images to the algorithmic for elaborating the captured information.  Your mission  As an R&D Engineer you will participate in our efforts in research and development for low power vision systems at the algorithmic level. Typically, you will work on developing vision systems starting from the acquisition of the best data (1D signals, images, or videos) possible to the development and implementation of advanced machine learning techniques. You will also lead multidisciplinary industrial projects (link with other CSEM activity fields) and participate in their acquisition.  Your profile  You are in possession of a degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics or Computer Science with experience and passion in the following topics:  Strong know-how and expertise in machine learning and vision algorithms Signal & image processing Embedded vision systems C, C++, Matlab / Python languages Multidisciplinary industrial project management Fluency in English and possibly French Strong communication and interpersonal skills Experience in proposal writing and project building     We offer  CSEM offers a stimulating and multidisciplinary work environment with the opportunity to work with leading Swiss and international companies. You will have the opportunity to benefit from excellent social security conditions and to evolve within a multicultural company which clearly promotes an employee-driven culture. CSEM is an equal opportunities employer.   We look forward to receiving your complete application file. Preference will be given to professionals applying directly.   M111Display original ad

Product Marketing Leader Position Details Duration: Permanent contract  Starting date: Immediate or to be discussed  Job application deadline: -  Workplace: Home Office and DEPsys SA, 1070 Puidoux  Contact: DEPsys HR  Global Talent Acquisition Team +41 (0) 21 546 23 00  jobs@depsys.ch    Submit your resume  PDF     PDF      DEPsys is an innovative fast-growing Swiss high-tech company. We are driven by the passion for cleantech and energy management. The company currently employs 35 people and is headquartered in Puidoux (Switzerland) close to Lausanne. Our goal is to establish GridEye – our cutting-edge grid intelligence platform – as the key solution enabling power grid evolution and stability in the low and medium voltage electricity networks. To help us achieve this objective and support our growth, we are looking for the best talent. To drive our sales growth, we are looking for a  Product Marketing Leader SummaryTo support our global expansion, we are looking for an experienced product marketing leader who will have overall ownership of the marketing of the GridEye solution. This is an opportunity to evolve with the company and lead its positioning in major markets in the coming years.  Mission / Responsibilities Market segmentation and positioning Understanding of different segment needs and pains Adaptation of messaging to different market segments   GridEye marketing content and messaging Product value proposition (tech & business) Business case Competitive differentiation   Development of reusable collateral Customer and Partner presentations White papers Reference documentation Website and corporate content   External representation of GridEye Positioning at events, with associations, etc. Advocate for the merits of the solution   Evolution of the GridEye solution Help collect and make sense of customer requirements together with Sales and Customer Success teams Helps prioritize and manage the solution roadmap Drives pricing strategy     Desired qualifications 5-10 years in Product Marketing in B2B software, smart grid, high tech, IoT or professional services to the Energy sector Degree in Engineering, alternatively extensive experience in working with engineers and positioning engineering solutions Experience in positioning disruptive technology solutions to traditional buyers Good technical knowledge and understanding of network data management concepts and issues Proven understanding of smart grids and/or IoT is a real plus Excellent written and oral communication skills in English. German and French is a plus   We are looking for A personality focused on the future, high energy individual Excited about driving change in the energy sector Ambitious on behalf of customers; wanting to help them solve real problems Highly developed problem-solving skills Comfortable with ambiguity; strong at setting priorities Strong communicator both internally and externally Outstanding orchestration skills; desire to leverage all resources available and make teams win   We offer you The opportunity to grow personally and professionally in an exciting job within a successful scale-up positioned for the future The opportunity to directly shape the evolution of the energy sector A dynamic open-minded culture backed by established high preforming entrepreneurs Informal and multicultural environment with emphasis on self-management   [ Nov 1st, 2019 ]   Display original ad

Software Developer   Hours: 100%   Location: Zurich City   Duration: start date negotiable   swissQuant Group bietet eine breite Palette von Dienstleistungen, Beratung und quantitativen Tools für den Finanz- und Industriesektor für Kunden in und ausserhalb der Schweiz an. Zu unseren Kunden zählen auch mehrere Fortune 500-Unternehmen. Unsere Kernkompetenz liegt in der Umsetzung von Intelligenter Technologie in einen substantiellen Mehrwert für unsere Kunden. swissQuant Group ist ein privat geführtes Unternehmen, das im Jahr 2005 als Spin-off der ETH Zürich gegründet wurde.  Position To strengthen our Optimization practice, we are currently seeking a well-rounded Software Developer with excellent Java skills, practical experience in software development, and strong Mathematical thinking. You will be working on the Portfolio Optimization core components that is an essential part of the swissQuant group ecosystem. In order to assure a steady evolution, you will align with other stakeholders and push the future development of our software products. Moreover, you will be in close contact with Quant Engineers to implement new methodological approaches that seek to make our products more robust and powerful. You will be expected to work in the research, development, and delivery of quantitative decision-support tools and services, in the area of Optimization. This will include modelling, simulation, and analysis of financial market data, as well as employing various numerical methods to find optimal solutions to very complex problems. As our technology is generally delivered as software, it is important that you are familiar with the software development lifecycle. Assistance in the marketing of our offerings is also a part of the job description. You are therefore expected to possess strong communication skills in addition to excellent technical capabilities. You have the possibility to take over a lot of responsibility, freedom and autonomy after short time. You can work on a unique software which is used by banks and insurance companies worldwide and strives to be improved and enhanced. Requirements As an experienced Software Engineer, you are able to understand quantitative software applications from both a user and technology viewpoint, logically diagnose issues, and work with users and developers to resolve them. To be a successful candidate, you must fulfil some of the following requirements:   Higher university degree (PhD, MSc or equivalent) in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or Engineering   Practical experience with modeling, solving, and tuning complex problems   Deep knowledge of Algorithms and Data Structures   Proficiency in Java   Experience with Git and Maven   Practical experience with Optimization and Mathematical Modeling is a strong plus   Knowledge of Python is a plus   Basic knowledge of financial markets and quant finance is a plus   Ability to work well independently and in a team environment   Strong analytical thinking   Strong communication skills in English   Eligible to live and work in Switzerland  Software Developer (PDF, 74 kb) Display original ad

TEAMLEITER / PROJEKTLEITER (f/m/d)    About Atos  Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with over 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of over € 11 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index. The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information technology space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education as well as multicultural and pluralistic approaches to research that contribute to scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the group enables its customers, employees and collaborators, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably and confidently in the information technology space. We are hiring!Für unsere Division Big Data and Cyber Security suchen wir zur Verstärkung unseres Command & Control Teams in Zürich zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine/n Team- bzw. Projektleiter (f/md).   Ihre Aufgaben:  Fachliche Leitung und Personalverantwortung für ein agil arbeitendes Entwicklungsteam mit bis zu zehn Software-Entwicklern und System Engineers Leitung von Inhouse Entwicklungsprojekten für kundenspezifische und komplexe Software Lösungen mit nationaler Bedeutung für unsere Kunden und die Schweizer Bevölkerung Sie übernehmen Personalverantwortung, führen Einzelgespräche mit ihren Mitarbeitern und führen Status- und Entwicklungsgespräche Aufbau und Pflege der Vertrauensbeziehungen mit unseren Kunden in mittel- bis langfristigen Projekten Einsätze beim Kunden vor Ort für Workshops    Ihr Profil:  Sie verfügen über einen erfolgreichen Hochschulabschluss (FH, Uni, ETH, HF) in Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Aus- und Weiterbildung Mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung in fachlicher Leitung und / oder Personalverantwortung eines Entwicklerteams sowie Erfahrung als Projektleiter Ausbildung und Erfahrung als Software-Engineer ist vorteilhaft Gute Kenntnisse im Requirements Engineering und in der Software Architektur Kenntnisse bei der Realisierung von Applikationen WPF, Schnittstellen mit WFC oder Backendkomponenten vorteilhaft Erfahrungen mit Web-Technologien (Angular, HTML5, Javascript, CSS) von Vorteil Exzellentes Knowhow hinsichtlich professionellen Softwareentwicklungsprozessen Analytische und strukturierte Arbeitsweise mit ausgeprägter Kundenorientierung und hohem Qualitätsbewusstsein Motivierter und initiativer Teamplayer Da die Projekte im sensitiven Umfeld angesiedelt sind, erfüllen Sie die Bedingungen zum Bestehen der Personensicherheitsprüfung, wie z. B. Schweizer Staatsbürgerschaft oder Niederlassungsbewilligung C Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift         Ihre Bewerbung    Nutzen Sie die Chance und bewerben Sie sich auf diese spannende und vielseitige Funktion über unsere Karriereseite. Bitte beachtern Sie, dass wir nur vollständige Bewerbungsunterlagen (inkl. Anschreiben, Lebenslauf) im Auswahlprozess berücksichtigen können. Wir freuen uns auf Sie!   Wir haben uns zum Ziel gesetzt, Diversität in unserem Unternehmen zu fördern. Job title: Regional Sales Leader - Account acquisition, initial focus on Switzerland
Content: Regional Sales Leader - Account acquisition, initial focus on Switzerland Position Details Duration: Permanent contract  Starting date: Immediate or to be discussed  Workplace: Home office / 50 % national travel / DEPsys SA, 1070 Puidoux  Contact: DEPsys HR  Global Talent Acquisition Team +41 (0) 21 546 23 00  jobs@depsys.ch    Submit your resume  PDF     PDF      DEPsys is an innovative fast-growing Swiss high-tech company, we are driven by the passion for cleantech and energy management. The company employs today 35 people and its headquarter is located in Puidoux (Switzerland) next to Lausanne and Lake Geneva. Our goal is to establish GridEye – our cutting-edge technology platform – as the key solution enabling power grid evolution and stability in the low-voltage electricity networks. To help us in achieving this objective and support our growth, we are looking for the best talents. For our international sales activities and growth, we are looking today for a  Regional Sales Leader – Account acquisition, initial focus on Switzerland SummaryFor our European expansion with an initial focus on Switzerland, we are looking for a sales leader that will grow our business and teams in this geography. This is an opportunity to evolve with the company and lead its developments to more markets in the coming years.  Mission / Responsibilities Co-develop and implement our go-to-market strategy Manage and grow existing accounts Acquire and grow new accounts Manage the entire sales cycle with those accounts from initial contact, to proposal, to negotiations, to contracting, to delivery, to upsell, to support Develop a diverse, dynamic, and winning sales team Set and achieve clear sales targets Position and represent DEPsys externally to industry stakeholders and influencers Liaise with DEPsys teams regarding customer needs and market developments Work with internal resources on technical proposals Co-develop and champion sales processes such as forecasting, pipeline management, opportunity qualification, etc.   Desired qualifications 7+ years of software sales or sales-related experience in complex, technical, solution-oriented B2B business. Ideally Energy or Telecom sector Experience in creating new markets, positioning disruptive technology solutions to traditional buyers Proven understanding of smart grids and/or IoT is a real plus Good technical knowledge and understanding of network data management concepts and issues   We are looking for A self-motivated personality who is excited about building new business and teams Focused on the future Ambitious on behalf of customers; wanting to help them solve real problems Comfortable with ambiguity; strong at setting priorities Strong communicator both internally and externally Outstanding orchestration skills; desire to leverage all resources available and make teams win German first language or equivalent level, excellent command of English, French is a plus   We offer you The opportunity to grow personally and professionally in an exciting job within a successful scale-up positioned for the future The opportunity to shape the evolution of the energy sector A dynamic open-minded culture backed by established high performing entrepreneurs Continuous support from a highly technically capable team of sales engineers Informal and multicultural environment with emphasis on self-management   [ Nov 2nd, 2019 ]   Display original ad

IT Administrator  Scanditis a high-growth tech startup from Switzerland with offices in Zurich, San Francisco, Boston, Warsaw, London and Tampere. Our technology for recognizing any barcode with any standard mobile phone is leading in the market today and is used on hundreds of millions of mobile devices. To see our software in action, check out our videos. We are currently seeking an IT Administrator to support the rapid growth of our business and support with internal IT infrastructure. This role is critical to everyone's productivity while our business is scaling up.  As an IT Administrator, you are responsible for Scandit’s internal IT infrastructure, which includes employee laptops, networks, video conferencing, telephony as well as the management of certain cloud services. In this role, you will have the opportunity to shape the IT in a successful tech startup, play an important part in our monthly onboarding process of international new joiners and support dispersed teams by providing reliable and state-of-the-art IT services. If you want to make an important contribution to Scandit’s success and work in a fun and international environment of talented engineers and young entrepreneurs, you are our person!    Take a look at what we do:     What You Will Do   Manage IT infrastructure (remote and physically from our Zurich office) Be the main point of contact for the IT needs of all team members (based in Zurich, Boston, London, Warsaw and Tampere) Manage cloud services (Google Suite) Manage wifi / network, video conferencing and VoIP infrastructure (remote and physically from our Zurich office) Enable new hires to achieve a perfect start with a structured IT onboarding and ahigh-touch onboarding experience Responding in a timely manner to service issues and requests(1st / 2nd level support) Help enforce and develop / improve information security program Process IT-related orders (HW / SW) and manage the IT inventory Help us grow and constantly improve our collaboration tools   Who You Are   Completed training / apprenticeship in IT (ITtechnician, system administrator or similar) At least 3-5 years relevant work experience in the field Degree from a college of higher education (Höhere Fachschule, HF) is a plus Good knowledge of IT operating systems, particularly macOS and Windows knowledge Good knowledge of networking (AD, DHCP, DNS, etc.)  Good sense of security (secure system setup, securing the network, educating employees on security best practices, etc.) Friendly and positive attitude with a strong desire to make users productive Ability to work independently and be able to face hectic situations with calm and confidence Well organized, pragmatic and with excellent problem solving skills Good English skills (written and spoken) Eligible to work in Switzerland   Who we are   Scanditenables enterprises and consumers to change the way they interact with everyday objects and augment the physical world with real-time data captured by scanning barcodes and recognizing text, objects, and other visual identifiers using smartphones, tablets, wearables, drones and robots.  Scandit’s mobile data capture platform is built on proprietary computer vision, augmented reality, and machine learning technologies. Companies in industries such as retail, transportation & logistics, manufacturing, and healthcare can use Scandit’s technology to create and power mobile apps for crucial enterprise workflows like mobile point of sale, mobile shopping, self-checkout, inventory management, and proof of delivery. Front & Wealth Advisory Consultant   Front & Wealth Advisory Consultant    
              Front & Wealth Advisory Consultant   Do you think working in the banking sector can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. At Knowledge Lab, we develop pioneering solutions that enable financial institutions to make the most valuable business decisions. With us, you will have the opportunity to apply and expand your skills in ways you never thought possible - and you will have fun doing it. Join a successful team of great people with ambition, passion and ideas, all using and developing their talents for good - at work and in life.     The Position   As a Front & Wealth Advisory Consultant at Knowledge Lab, you will be the trusted partner to our clients for providing state-of-the-art Onboarding and Front Office as well as Wealth Advisory solutions in the Financial Services Industry. With your substantial domain knowledge in wealth management and banking, your focus on compliance, front-to-back processes and strong technical credibility, you understand our clients’ business needs and actively shape the path towards sustainable solutions. You will closely collaborate with consultant colleagues and our in-house team of data scientists, software engineers and UX experts when preparing showcases and prototypes. In addition, you will actively share your knowledge within the team.          Responsibilities    Client-facing expert for Onboarding, Front Office and Wealth Advisory   Understand customer business needs and shape innovative solutions   Design business processes that formalize existing informal activities and integrate existing legacy systems (e.g. customer backend system, cloud infrastructure, etc.)   Act as an expert in the different stages of the project and lead requirements, design and build phases   Develop showcases and prototypes for sales cases   Mentor and educate team members and customers    What you offer   Minimum qualifications    Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science or equivalent background   Relevant experience in the area of Client Onboarding, Front Office or Wealth Advisory in the banking industry   At least 2 years’ experience in process modelling (e.g. BPMN engines) and business process management platforms (e.g. Appway or similar)   Good understanding of technology-stack of modern banking applications   Experience with relational databases and querying languages (e.g. SQL)   Experience with programming languages (preferrably Java)   Open, curious, team-oriented personality with persistency and tenacityl   High sense of ownership and quality   Excellent communication skills, both towards customers and peers   Ability to think ahead, work independently and set priorities   Very strong command of English, good command of German (verbal and written)   Willingness to travel (mostly within Switzerland, occasionally EU/UK)    Preferred qualifications    Experience with core banking platforms (e.g. Avaloq or similar)   Know-how of Appway or Flowable   Methodological competence in Agile and Design Thinking   Why should you apply?  At Knowledge Lab, we offer:    An inclusive culture that values interdisciplinarity, freedom and responsibility   The possibility to shape a young company   Excellent growth and personal development opportunities   Interesting projects and challenging tasks   About Knowledge Lab  Knowledge Lab AG is a consulting, software engineering and data science company for financial institutions. Founded in 2016 and based in Zurich, Knowledge Lab serves customers within Switzerland and Europe. An interdisciplinary team of 20 employees works with its clients to develop solutions at the forefront of banking transformation. Knowledge Lab constantly researches new approaches and ideas in its own lab.         For further information please contact:   Peter Häusermann   Knowledge Lab AG   info@k-lab.ch   +41 (44) 461 09 36   Display original ad

MAINTENANCE MECHANIC IV     MAINTENANCE MECHANIC IV         Job Posting Title: MAINTENANCE MECHANIC IV  Job Code: 30004078  Segment: TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS (50132248)  Business Unit: SENSORS SOLUTIONS (50375931)  Building: Jaquet Pratteln (S62)  Band/Level: 6  Hiring Manager: Philipp Erlacher  Recruiter: Christophe Wedrychowski  Relocation:No  Travel: None  Employee Referral Amount:  Education Experience: Associate Degree (High School +2 years)  Employment Experience: 3-5 years    Company Information  TE Connectivity Ltd., is a $13 billion global technology and manufacturing leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. For more than 75 years, our connectivity and sensor solutions, proven in the harshest environments, have enabled advancements in transportation, industrial applications, medical technology, energy, data communications, and the home. With 78,000 employees, including more than 7,000 engineers, working alongside customers in nearly 150 countries, TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at www.te.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, WeChat and Twitter.   The Aerospace, Defense and Marine (Aerospace, Defense and Marine or AD&M) business unit of TE is part of the Industrial Solutions segment (Industrial Solutions) and is a world leader in the design of components and electrical interconnection solutions that are used for applications in extreme and rigorous environments. These interconnection solutions make possible applications of avionics, jet and propulsion engine management, flight controls, grounding systems and on-board entertainment (EAB) for today's "connected aircraft". This capability is extended to military, marine, aviation, space, land and drone vehicles, as well as oil and gas exploration of open-ocean deposits. TE offers solutions for enhanced connectivity that work and resist in the most extreme environments on Earth, from the deepest oceans to the ends of space. In your relentless activities to save space and weight, improve data delivery and power, you will find that AD&M is ready to collaborate with your design team to help you present your product more quickly in the market with smarter and better interconnect solutions.    Job Overview   TE Connectivity's Maintenance Teams perform repairs and preventive maintenance to ensure longer lifespan of machines and facilities. Every team member is responsible for maintaining housekeeping and organization of the work area as well as following TE Connectivity's EH&S policies and procedures. Für unseren Geschäftsbereich Sensors (Mit unseren Sensorprodukten bedienen wir die Automobil- und Industrieindustrie), verantwortlich für die Unterstützung der Technischen Unterhaltsabteilung sind wir auf der Suche für unser Werk in Basel nach ein :   CNC Mechaniker im Betriebsunterhalt (w/m)     Responsibilities & Qualifications     Ihre Aufgaben:   Drehen und Fräsen am CNC Bearbeitungszentrum; Programmieren und optimieren der CNC Bearbeitung Ausführen Diagnostik und Störungssuche, Wartungen sowie Reparaturen; Schulung des Bedienpersonals vor Ort; Ursachenanalyse bei festgestellten Mängeln, Störungen; Mithilfe bei der Störungsbehebung an Produktionsanlagen Einrichten und Umstellen der Anlagen auf die benötigten Formate/Code-Nr. etc. gemäss den Vorgaben; Demontage der Produktionsanlagen für die Reinigung, mit anschliessender Montage Durchführung von Wartungs – und Reparaturarbeiten nach Absprach mit der Produktion; Unterstützung bei der Durchführung von Optimierungs- und Verbesserungsmassnahmen der zu betreuenden Anlagen und Maschinen Pflegen der technischen Dokumentation der Betriebsanlagen nach dem Stand der Technik und GMP-Richtlinien   Die Anforderungen:  Fundierte Ausbildung im Bereich CNC Bearbeitung; 2-3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im technischen Unterhalt, Strukturiertes und selbständiges Arbeiten; Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Englischkenntnisse; Sie sind flexibel, selbstständig und belastbar, Bereitschaft zum Pikett wünschenswert     Competencies   Adaptability/Flexibility Communication Computer Skills Creativity/Innovation Customer Focus Organizational Agility Problem Solving/Analysis Teamwork Technical Skills Technical Learning Values: Integrity, Accountability,Teamwork, Innovation                         Location: Pratteln, BL, CH, 4133        Travel: None       Requisition ID: 48328       Alternative Locations:           Job Segment:Maintenance Mechanic, Mechanic, Maintenance, Electrical, Manufacturing, Operations, Engineering Display original ad

Senior Model Development Actuary iptiQ            Location: Zurich, ZH, CH             Senior Model Development Actuary iptiQ    About iptiQ  Become a part of a growing and dynamic entrepreneurial team within the established Swiss Re Group. iptiQ is a start-up unit, established to provide innovative protection solutions directly to consumers. Our team delivers the coordination, infrastructure and competences that are key to driving forward this new business; working closely with our partners and clients. Our mission is to reduce the protection gap by simplifying life insurance and making it more accessible to people. Our motto is "now life is easier for everyone". For us this means making life insurance easier to sell, to buy and to trust.     About the Role  An exciting opportunity has arisen to develop and maintain the iptiQ EMEAs next generation data and pricing engine model. This is a rare opportunity to join a new business unit within an established company; combining the dynamic spirit of a startup with the backing of Swiss Re's strong organisation.  Your main responsibilities will be:  You design and deliver iptiQ's pricing engine and corresponding framework and processes  You perform the required actuarial analysis and build the models and provide analytical insights You are a core member of a team to develop and deliver iptiQ's digital insurance platform You work closely together with the software engineers to support the technical implementation of the data and pricing engine You develop and maintain strong relationships and interact on regular basis with internal partners across all functions  You will report directly to the Head of Digital Platform of iptiQ EMEA.     About the Team  iptiQ is a unit within the newly built Swiss Re Life Capital; established to deliver white-label life insurance solutions to be sold through partners, directly to consumers.We are a young, motivated and technology driven team, organised to provide creative solutions for life insurance distributors across Europe that engage with consumers in non-traditional ways.Through our strong operational infrastructure, creative thinking, insurance know-how and ecommerce competences we want to drive the digitalization of the life insurance business in Europe.    About You   You have a university degree in mathematics, statistics, actuarial science or related field with proven mathematical skills and analytical ability  You have relevant work experience of 5+ years in primary insurance and/or a consulting environment with focus on model development for primary life insurance products You are used to work in project environments. Experience in agile methodologies are a plus You have actuarial pricing skills and experience in applying the actuarial control cycle You are proficient in English You have strong verbal and written communication skills with analytical, critical thinking and independent decision-making abilities You are a strong team player who is passionate about the success of the business and comfortable in a dynamic and fast-moving environment Experience in working in agile product teams and knowledge of agile tools like Confluence and JIRA is a plus You are results-driven, have a "can-do" attitude and are a self-motivated personality and a fast learner     We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.     Keywords:   Reference Code: 86015           Display original ad

Product Marketing ManagerCompany Description ProtonMail was born at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) in 2013 when a group of scientists and engineers envisioned an email service that empowers users to own their private data and keeps them safe from mass surveillance. Since then, ProtonMail has grown to become the world’s largest secure email service, with over 15 million users and a profitable business model. We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team and help us build a suite of security tools that safeguard privacy online build a better Internet.    Role description As an experienced product marketing manager, you’ll plan and execute go-to-market strategies and campaigns for new products and features. You’ll improve conversion rates of landing pages and key conversion paths by running A/B split tests. You’ll analyze the possible causes of churn to identify and implement solutions to reduce it.  You’ll act as an advocate for our users, distilling their requests and requirements, and working with the product team to get them prioritized and implemented.  If you’re a results-driven marketer, feel comfortable taking initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, this is a great opportunity to play a pivotal role in a fast-growing company. You will have a concrete impact on the future of the business as a whole.   Responsibilities  Build the launch strategy and lead a cross-functional team to see it through to execution  Test and launch new products and features through in-market alpha/beta stages, and drive scaled adoption. Improve conversion rates across the board, from landing pages, to upgrade pages, to renewal pages, to any other touchpoint in our products. Analyze product usage and churn rates to drive product understanding, adoption, retention, loyalty, and win-back strategies. Act as the user’s advocate and the voice of the market, synthesizing customer feedback into actionable insights to inform future product development. Create and present weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports and analyses. Keep abreast of the newest trends, innovations, and technologies in the online advertising industry. Display original ad

Digital Marketing Manager     Digital Marketing Manager Sales & MarketingSchlieren, Zurich, SwitzerlandFull timeDMM-EN-1    OverviewApplication  Description   Most wanted: customer-oriented B2B marketing pioneer with great writing skills and excitement for fast growing companies   Onedot was founded in 2014 to make unstructured and messy product data easy consumable by applying self-developed artificial intelligence. We are a rapidly growing Swiss SaaS startup offering commerce and industry the first intelligent platform to source, onboard and distribute product data. Public companies with global presence and rich history as well as some of the fastest growing e-commerce startups are part of our expanding international customer base. At Onedot, you will embed yourself into a demanding but exceptionally inspiring environment with lots of room for personal growth. We are looking for colleagues who want to have a meaningful impact and shape our trendsetting product and company. High-quality work is rewarded with a steep learning curve, lots of autonomy, responsibility and swift decision-making. Become part of a multi-cultural and multi-faceted team led by the founders. Talented, curious and committed human beings from all over the globe are looking forward to your ideas and taking you on board. Take over a new position with high responsibility and great potential to further grow our company. You will define and implement our marketing strategy from A to Z. The challenge to position a highly technical, one-of-a-kind software product in a global market very much appeals to you. Your personal goal has always been to find the right words and visuals to help customers easier understand the benefits of a product. You are right at home with modern marketing tools and build up lead generation as a reliable source of growth and scaling of our company. Creating visually appealing illustrations and intuitive explanations of complex facts is something you are great at. You enjoy working with founders, sales team and product management to understand our product evolution from both a strategic and a tactical viewpoint. As a digital marketing manager at Onedot, your audience are both executives of fortune 500 companies and product/category managers who are responsible for high-quality product data and digitalisation initiatives. Onedot designs and engineers proprietary machine learning algorithms, probabilistic/statistical methods and advanced text understanding because existing approaches do not go far enough. Our technology achieves human-like performance and has already been trained with over 100 million different products. Onedot is a startup backed by well-known international venture capital firms and world class entrepreneurs. Your responsibilities:  Define, implement and execute our marketing strategy Lead all operational marketing and press communication activities Build up and drive inbound lead generation and marketing automation Write high-quality content for homepage, whitepapers, marketing assets etc. Create intuitive graphics and illustrations for marketing assets Develop and extend newly set up homepage, optimise for different devices and search engines Manage and feed all relevant marketing channels including social media Support sales in event organisation and partner management  Minimum qualifications:  Degree in Digital Marketing, Communication, Business or other relevant areas 3 years of experience in digital marketing or communication Native German skills, fluent English skills (oral and written communication) Relevant experience with Adobe Creative Suite and modern CMS applications Strong expertise in writing high-quality customer-oriented content Ability to understand technical products and explain them in intuitive ways Experience and flair for great visual design and promoting brands Data analysis skills to support strategic marketing decisions Great team player, effective communication skills and positive get things done mentality  Preferred qualifications:  Experience in a fast growing B2B software or platform business Good understanding of retail, e-commerce markets  Relevant experience in Google Analytics/Adwords for SEO/SEM   Practical experience with modern marketing automation and lead generation tools   Practical know-how in building and operating homepages with site generators such as Webflow  As part of our dedication to the diversity of our teams, Onedot is committed to equal employment opportunity without regard for race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. This is a permanent full-time position based in our office in Zurich/Schlieren, Switzerland. Sounds interesting? Apply today and we will get in touch with you shortly!   Requirements  Minimum of 3 years of relevant project and product expertise    Benefits  Performance-oriented compensation with the option to become shareholder, because we reward high-impact work Generous education & training budget to continuously broaden your skills Flexible work hours, because impact, not face-time counts Occasional work from home, so that you can focus and get things done Strong culture promoting open feedback and personal development, to learn from each other and push forward as one team Standing desks, powerful hardware and two additional monitors for maximum productivity Cool office space close to the city center, because we like it cosy and comfortable Free snacks, drinks, coffee and other perks to keep you going Regular team events to foster new ideas and better get to know each other     Apply for this job      Display original ad

System ArchitectSYSTEM ARCHITECT Job Reference Number: QSCH2019JB291Location: Switzerland, Zurich-GlattbruggDate: March 2019 Join the QualySense Journey QualySense, a young Swiss company, is reinventing the global soft commodity market by pioneering the proprietaryQSorter® technology, a sophisticated high-speed single-kernel robot, which measures the compositional andphysical quality of each grain and sorts it accordingly. The QSorter is the result of outstanding R&D in the field ofsensing, mechatronics, biochemistry, data processing and life science along with world-known partners such as theUnited States Department of Agriculture, EMPA, Agroscope, and ETH. The QSorter analyzes grains at very highspeed by means of Near Infrared spectroscopy and 2D/3D imaging. The company, founded in 2010, has beenawarded a number of prestigious prizes. We commit to bringing excellence in nutrition, health and safety to peopleall over the world and we are looking for talents that can help us achieving our mission.(Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uxhbALd3XIQ). We are currently seeking a System Architect tosupervise and expand our product platform software architecture so that current and future performance andscalability are achievable for our QSorter® products.In this position you will be responsible of defining the strategy for the further development of a stable and modularsoftware platform to support QualySense expanding analytical and sorting solutions. In this process you willsupervise and drive the configuration management workflow and interface design so to guarantee flexibility,modularity, quality and a faster Go-to-Market approach.We are seeking a strong communicator able to build bridges between the different technical areas and able tounderstand the big-picture and benefits that our product is providing to our various customer segments. TheSystem Architect we are looking for is someone that has passion for quality, an unparallel level of abstract thinking,focused on efficiency and performance, very well organized and structured and – last but not least - thrilled byworking in an environment characterized by a strong acceleration in business development.If you are seeking a new challenge, come join our team and make it stellar! Senior Consultant - Cloud Management & AutomationSenior Consultant - Cloud Management & Automation Zurich, SwitzerlandApply Now Job ID R1914074-2 Overview ofVMware  VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.   With 2018 revenues of $8.97 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, 75,000 partners, and 23,000 employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on architecting what’s next in IT? Learn more at vmware.com/careers.    Role  The global VMware Professional Services Organization (PSO) influences the success of each VMware implementation. The PSO team is dedicated to the success of the customer and their digital transformation journey. The PSO team ensures that VMware customers are successfully implementing their business plans from adoption all the way to a fully functioning solution.   The Senior Consultant is an advanced level technology specialist and subject matter expert, providing customer guidance by facilitating technical workshops, creation of low-level designs and implementation of use cases into high-quality solutions. In addition to customer facing delivery Senior Consultants also provide technical input to pre-sales and drive best practices in the form of white paper creation.   VMware PSO is committed to offering a collaborative and supportive working environment with a full enablement plan and the opportunity to develop in the latest Software-Defined Datacenter or Digital Workspace technologies and solutions. We promote an inclusive atmosphere where your voice will be heard, and where you will be part of a dynamic team working in partnership with each other.   We are looking for conscientious and responsible individuals who can build on our successful track record and come with us on the next stage of our journey.   WewillsponsoryourenablementandcertificationuptoandincludingVCDXcertification.   Workforthegloballeaderincloudinfrastructureandvirtualizationsolutions    Responsibilities   Gather use case requirements for, and create, test and release high quality solutions based on Realize Suite (private cloud), VMware Cloud on AWS (hybrid cloud) and PKS. Collaborate with cross-functional VMware project teams which could consist of VMware pre-sales architects, engineers, product management and support staff. Work as part of a wider project team or independently act as technical lead on consulting engagements Create low-level designs while functioning as an advisory resource for “Best Practices” and driving adoption of VMware solutions. Actively demonstrate commercial awareness and stay within the scope of the contracted work.  Take ownership and accountability for individual deliverables. Maintain current, high-level technical knowledge of the entire VMware product line and future product direction and expert level knowledge of the core VMware product line and your specialist area Assist in the development of our consulting service offerings as well as developing white papers and best practices Enjoy working with leading edge technology and being an intrinsic part of a fantastic team     Requirements   Demonstrated ability and experience in customer-facing positions as a Professional Services consultant. Strong documentation and technical writing skills Adaptable and progressive learner with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to a variety of audiences. Ability to work independently and work collaboratively in a team environment. An active listener with excellent and confident communications and interpersonal skills with an ability to read complex customer situations and adapt as needed.   At least three years of actively delivering IT automation / scripted infrastructure projects ideally based on VMware technologies.  Solid understanding of (REST-) APIs and their integration in heterogenous landscapes Expertise on deployment, management and administration of at least one VMware technology vSphere/vCenter, vRealize Automation, vRealize Operations Manager, vRealize Orchestrator or vRealize Log Insight.     Certification and Education   Bachelor’s degree as a minimum or demonstrate equivalent experience. VMware Certified Professional (VCP-DCV or VCP-CMA) certified or demonstrate equivalent experience. Industry certifications from vendors such as AWS, Dell, K8 and Microsoft are a plus.     Desirable skills and experience   Cross Operating System knowledge, getting at least administrator experience in both Linux and Windows world  .net, java or equivalent development language experience.  Knowledge of modern software development methodologies such as DevOps, Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Lean.      Why Choose VMware?   Make an impact on your career path; grow professionally and personally by accessing our in-house learning & development opportunities & education assistance program. Voice your creative solutions to new and existing problems and watch them become initiatives. Thrive in a unique work environment where the emphasis reflects our values of Execution, Passion, Integrity, Customers and Community. Earn a competitive compensation package with performance- based bonuses and increases, a generous benefits package that really takes care of your needs and unexpected perks that make working here fun! Job title: Customer Experience Cloud Sales Executive (f/m/d) SMEs
Content: Customer Experience Cloud Sales Executive (f/m/d) SMEs      Requisition ID: 229104 Work Area: Sales Expected Travel: 0 - 60% Career Status: Professional Employment Type: Regular Full Time    COMPANY DESCRIPTION SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures. SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.      PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES  The SAP C/4HANA Suite for Customer Experience and Commerce is designed to offer businesses an integrated approach to deliver real-time experiences to customers across all digital channels. Customers will be able to exchange information, such as customer data, between a range of systems to produce a 360-degree view of the customer. Along with SAP C/4HANA and SAP HANA in-memory computing, the following SAP product suites are included in the SAP Customer Experience LoB: SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP Sales Cloud, SAP Service Cloud, SAP Marketing Cloud as also SAP Customer Data Cloud.   Customer Experience & Commerce (CX) is a line of business organization (LoB) as part of a matrix sales structure. CX belongs to one of the top three strategic focuses of SAP globally and is a significant contributor to the growth in SAPs global cloud business. The CX solution portfolio is the most comprehensive in the market and enables companies of all sizes to manage their customers in today’s demanding customer centric environment. It is often used to transform the business into the digital world covering processes in Online Commerce, Social, Marketing, Sales and Service and goes beyond traditional CRM. You will be part of an energetic team and be working in a high pace environment. It is an exciting time to be part of CX as one of the most innovative teams within SAP. If you like to work in a demanding environment, this opportunity will be enriching!      Your role as CX Cloud Solution Sales Executive (f/m/d) SMEs    The primary purpose of the Solution Sales Executive is to achieve their overall revenue goal. To accomplish this goal, the Solution Sales Executive must create a complete territory business plan that generates at least 4x their quota in pipeline opportunity. She/he is responsible for identifying, qualify and win opportunities, develop and drive strategy.    EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS   Work with the Sales Manager and team to develop and execute programs to drive pipeline & close deals. Work to uncover and run sales cycles-based opportunities. Work with Virtual Account Teams on CX sales campaigns. Work to attain various sales objectives related to securing new business opportunities, identifying key contacts and using strong influence and leadership skills to create value, generate meetings and drive interest. Develop sales best practices securing repeatable and expansive opportunities. Maximize all sales and sales related pipeline potentials by interacting with local & regional CX sales, marketing, business development & pre-sales teams. Achieve / exceed quota targets. Establish strong relationships based on knowledge of customer requirements and commitment to value. Actively understand each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans, technology strategy, and competitive landscape. Develop and deliver a comprehensive business plan to address customers and prospects priorities and pain points. Utilize Value Engineering, benchmarking and ROI data to support the customer’s decision process.     Demand Generation, Pipeline and Opportunity Management   Pipeline planning  - Follow a disciplined approach to maintaining a rolling pipeline. Keep pipeline current and moving up the pipeline curve. Pipeline partnerships – Leverage support organizations including Marketing, Business Development, Presales, Consulting, Partners and channels to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory. Demonstrate early adoption of all new solutions and strategies. Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap. Support all SAP promotions and events in the territory.     WORK EXPERIENCE/ SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES   Proven track records in business application software sales for Cloud/SaaS solutions 5+ years of experience in sales of CRM, eCommerce, and other business software Proven track records of executing volume business and capability to work on multiple accounts at the same time Experience in different industries is an advantage: retail, consumer products, discrete manufacturing, telco, etc. Teamwork & Collaboration with local & virtual Sales Teams Strong communication and presentation skills in English and German (written and spoken) is a must – French is an asset. Minimum a bachelor's degree or equivalent (Business / Engineering or Technology)       Are you interested to know more about SAP CX?     Start your digital journey today: www.youtube.com/watch?v=-zKCtZkssYs  Checkout out our SAP CX solution portfolio: https://cx.sap.com/en/products    Are you looking for a compelling career or an exciting adventure? At SAP, you don’t have to choose. As the global leader for business software, SAP helps companies in more than 25 industries and has employees in 130+ countries—which means tons of opportunities for you to grow and expand your career. As the inventor and visionary that reimagines what’s possible in the digital economy, SAP is changing the game of business as we know it.      WHAT YOU GET FROM US  Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.     SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.  Additional Locations:    Job Segment:Sales Management, Cloud, ERP, Engineer, Sales, Technology, Engineering Display original ad

CopywriterCompany description ProtonMail was born at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) in 2013 when a group of scientists and engineers envisioned an email service that empowers users to own their private data and keeps them safe from mass surveillance. Since then, ProtonMail has grown to become the world’s largest secure email service, with over 15 million users and a profitable business model. We are looking for passionate people to join our growing team and help us build a suite of security tools that safeguard privacy online and build a better Internet.    Role description As a member of our Content Team, you’ll help create multimedia content that builds awareness and trust in our brand, inspires people to take steps toward securing their digital lives, and communicates our vision of an Internet where everyone controls their own data.   We prize writers who can quickly grasp difficult technical topics and turn abstract ideas into compelling, actionable copy. You will be an expert on the brand voice. On any given day, you may need to write news commentary for the blog, write a script for a how-to video, or write UI copy for a new product. And you’ll be expected to work constructively with colleagues across the company.   But the role is more proactive than reactive. You’ll need an eye for content ideas and a strong understanding of what makes our user community tick. Together with the other members of your team, you’ll develop the marketing content calendar, help implement the overall content strategy, and track your progress through key engagement metrics.   If you’re a results-driven marketer, feel comfortable taking initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, this is a great opportunity to play a pivotal role in a fast-growing company. You will have a concrete impact on the future of the business as a whole.   Responsibilities:   Researching and synthesizing complex information into easily digestible pieces of content.   Writing various types of articles on a wide range of topics related to internet privacy, cybersecurity, human rights, privacy laws, encryption, etc. for the company blog.   Generating and pitching new content ideas on topics germane to the Proton brand.   Providing feedback to other contributors and editing other writers’ content.   Optimizing content for search engines, to generate leads, and to increase conversion.   Contributing to long-form content projects, such as white papers and ebooks.   Writing short-form copy for different digital media, such as video, audio, printed materials, website, and social media.   Working with the marketing team on analytical projects to improve blog strategies and tactics.   Contributing to the growth of the overall number of visitors, converting visitors into leads, and expanding our blog’s overall reach through delivering quality content.  Display original ad

But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We can’t wait for you to discover this for yourself as a Senior Manager Inside Sales UDS EMEA in our team in Brentford or Amsterdam. Not even ground-breaking products sell themselves. That’s the job of our inside sales professionals. They take to market a product portfolio that includes PCs, electronics, accessories, mobility products, enterprise solutions, services and packaged software. Inside Sales Management is all about managing, inspiring and motivating professionals at all levels to deliver against targets. Beyond day-to-day people management, our team also shapes, executes and communicates specific sales strategies. Key Responsibilities   This person will develop the overarching sales and GTM strategy and lead its implementation efforts for UDS in strategic partnership across Dell Technologies strategically aligned businesses in Europe and META. Focus and build a consistent approach to meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota objectives for the business across each inside sales site. Run affective Demand Generation campaigns to grow pipeline for UDS in each region of the theater. Ensure and drive high levels of collaborations, within the business, with the BU’s, across divisions, theaters, functions and partners in the diverse ecosystem. Influence senior management’s opinions, inspire confidence and loyalty and demonstrate a proven track record of building, motivating and challenging an organization to sell world class products and services. Provide oversight for and manage opportunities in theater to increase deal size and accelerate the buying process. Focus on Attracting, Retaining and Developing Top Talent with in the business and as an industry. Identify, hire, mentor, coach, manage and motivate a diverse team of leaders, sales professionals, channel managers and system engineers. Accurately forecast respective business quarterly and each half. Develop Business cadence, Conduct weekly sales meetings and quarterly business reviews to ensure effective selling and efficient engagement of aligned resources. Delivers presentations to DELL EMC LT, Customers, Channel Partners and Sr. Leadership within heritage Dell. Thoroughly understands and articulates the UDS technical direction, capabilities and business solution to clients. Continuously improve knowledge of both solutions across its business partners, and competitors. Moderate understanding in Finance and Business Operations, ability to maintain budgets and understand general cost models. Ability to work with sales operations to set targets for individuals and team. Works collaboratively across all Dell Technologies businesses to build our UDS GTM. Maintains deep working relationships with all leaders in each country across Dell Technologies.     Essential Requirements   Demonstrable successful track record of sales in Inside Sales or Field Sales Proven track record of selling storage (preferably heritage EMC or Dell) into the Data Center (Storage or Backup) Experience working in our channel, enterprise or commercial data center sales divisions Will be required to travel 50% of the time ensuring balanced coverage between Dell teams, data center field sales, customers, and partners. Locations could include (UK, Germany, France, WER, Morocco, CEE, Italy, Spain). Ability to hire and develop talent into high performing inside sales reps with a future in field sales or leadership. Ability to work cross functionally with groups that influence our ability to grow and achieve i.e. marketing, product management/engineering, sales operations, presales, and the channel. Ability to work across multiple stakeholders (Dell and Dell EMC LT, country managers, channel leaders)     Deesirable Requirements   Formidable understanding of heritage Dell sales motion     Benefits We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities — all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment. This is a newly created position where you enjoy a high degree of room to manoeuvre.For this interesting and versatile position we are looking for a CIT Enterprise Architect 100% (f/m/d) In this role, your responsibilities would include:   Define opportunities to create business value and identify the required capabilities to realize them  Based on the divisional strategy, you identify future IT capabilities and assess their feasibility in terms of architecture, technology and services  Develop and maintain IT roadmap, architectural principles, standards, policies and solution governance  Drive smarter technology investments by driving changes in application, infrastructure, process and IT tools architecture  Define long-term target state for each layer and translate it into a roadmap  Requirements collection and translation into valuable concepts and specifications  Survey of the current architecture and development of target architectures, gap analyses and roadmaps     Ihr Profil  Following requirements are necessary for this role:   Master/ Bachelor degree in Informatics, Computer Science or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in IT tools architecture & designing IT solutions if possible gained in a global manufacturing company Strong knowledge of architecture frameworks, concepts and best practices with distinctive strategic planning capabilities You are a networker with excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate at different management levels. Mettler-Toledo GmbHFabio Ambrosone Acquisition ManagerHR Talent Acquisition SwitzerlandIm Langacher 448606 Greifensee www.mt.com      Über Mettler Toledo METTLER TOLEDO is a leading global supplier of precision instruments and services. Job title: Ingenieure (m/w) in Informatik oder Informationstechnologie als Wissenschaftliche Assistierende 50% - 100%
Company name: ZHAW Zürcher Hochschule für Angewandte Wissenschaften
Content: Ingenieure (m/w) in Informatik oder Informationstechnologie als Wissenschaftliche Assistierende 50% - 100%    Die ZHAW Zürcher Hochschule für Angewandte Wissenschaften ist mit über 13'000 Studierenden und rund 3'000 Mitarbeitenden eine der grössten Mehrsparten-Fachhochschulen der Schweiz. Die School of Engineering (SoE) setzt als eine der führenden Bildungs- und Forschungsinstitutionen in der Schweiz auf zukunftsrelevante Themen. 13 Institute und Zentren garantieren qualitativ hochstehende Ausbildung, Forschung und Entwicklung mit Fokus auf die Bereiche Energie, Mobilität, Information und Gesundheit. Das Institut für angewandte Informationstechnologie (InIT) in Winterthur verfügt über national wie international anerkannte Kompetenzen in den Bereichen Human-Information Interaction, Information Engineering, Information Security, Service Engineering und Software Systems. Wir erforschen und entwickeln in Zusammenarbeit mit Wirtschafts- und Hochschulpartnern innovative Informationstechnologie, Softwaresysteme und Services. Zudem betreiben wir für die Themen Cloud Computing, Service Prototyping, Data Science, Visual Computing, Mobile Usability, ICT-Accessibility und Security Analysis and Testing spezialisierte Labs. Zur Ergänzung unseres bestehenden Teams suchen wir mehrere (Vollzeit oder Teilzeit) Ingenieure (m/w) in Informatik oder Informationstechnologie als Wissenschaftliche Assistierende  Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehören:   Mitarbeit in den Bereichen Spezifikation, Forschung, Entwicklung, Dokumentation und Technologie-Transfer in praxisnahen Forschungsvorhaben in Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Wirtschafts- und Hochschulpartnern Entwicklung von Software und Services mit verschiedenen Technologien und Programmiersprachen für unterschiedliche Server- und Client-Plattformen Veröffentlichung der Ergebnisse in Form von wissenschaftlichen Beiträgen, Demonstratoren und Open Source Software Gelegentliche Unterstützung der Dozierenden im Unterricht (z.B. in Übungen und Praktika)    Sie verfügen über einen Fachhochschulabschluss in Informatik oder in einem verwandten Gebiet, allenfalls auch mit Masterabschluss. Sie haben Freude am selbstständigen wissenschaftlichen Arbeiten und verfügen über Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung und in mindestens einem der Kompetenzbereiche des InIT. Freude am Arbeiten in interdisziplinären Projektteams, Kreativität bei der Lösungsfindung für anspruchsvolle Problemstellungen, sowie das exakte und zuverlässige Arbeiten sind weitere Voraussetzungen für diese Positionen. Eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe sowie eine kommunikative, flexible und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise erleichtern Ihnen den Einstieg An unserem Institut erwartet Sie ein kompetentes, engagiertes und motiviertes Team und ein spannendes, innovatives Arbeitsumfeld. Die abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit bietet Ihnen viele Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten. Die Stelle ist vorläufig auf ein Jahr befristet, kann aber bei beidseitigem Interesse bis maximal drei Jahre verlängert werden. Es handelt sich bei dieser Stelle um eine Qualifizierungsstelle, welche sich vor allem für Studienabgänger eignet.  Benötigen Sie weitere Informationen?Für Auskünfte steht Ihnen der Institutsleiter, Prof. Dr. Marc Rennhard, unter marc.rennhard@zhaw.ch gerne zur Verfügung. Informationen zum Institut finden Sie auch unter www.zhaw.ch/init. Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen ausschliesslich via Online Plattform an Esther Huber, HR Consultant am Standort Winterthur.    Jetzt online bewerben   Mit xeebo bewerben   Zugang für Personalberatung      Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.zhaw.ch.
