Linux Kernel Software Developer (BE-CO-HT-2019-112-LD)     Company Description  At CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world's largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light. The process gives physicists clues about how particles interact, and provides insights into the fundamental laws of nature. Find out more on http://home.cern.    Job Description    Introduction  Do you love low-level, real-time software development? Are you an expert at building embedded Linux systems? Apply now to have your chance to work on the systems of the world’s largest and most powerful particle accelerator. Take part! In the Beams Department (BE), Controls Group (CO), Hardware and Timing Section (HT) you will work in a team of developers of Linux device drivers and other low-level software. The BE-CO Group is responsible for providing and supporting the controls infrastructure used to operate the CERN accelerators 24/7. The HT Section is in charge of providing hardware support and maintaining a standard set of modules that can be used to build control systems. This support includes the development or procurement of the hardware and the associated device drivers. The supported platforms include VMEbus and PCI/PCIe (industrial PCs, PXI/PXIe, uTCA), and the operating system currently in use is Linux.  Functions  You will:  Take responsibility in new software projects at the level of device drivers, libraries and C/C++ user space code. Take responsibility for the maintenance of existing device drivers including the re-programming of obsolete parts and the development of new components. Participate in the architecture and design of new systems based on PXI/PXIe and uTCA platforms. Participate in the design of software support for platforms based on System-on-Chip (SoC) components. Collaborate in a small team of developers, taking over tasks such as requirements gathering, planning, quality assurance, continuous integration, tooling, testing and communication with users in equipment groups. Participate in the operational support of the deployed Linux device drivers and low-level libraries. Document and present your work as appropriate.      Qualifications   Master's degree or equivalent relevant experience in the field of computer science or a related field.  Experience:   Required   Extensive experience in low-level software development (Unix, C/C++), in particular Linux device drivers. Extensive experience of embedded real-time systems programming. In-depth experience in the Linux kernel. Participation in distributed development of Free/Open Source software projects and knowledge of the different licensing options for such projects.   Nice to have   Experience with working on the PCI/PCIe and VMEbus platforms would be an advantage. Experience with programmable logic design using Hardware Description Languages and SoCs would be an advantage. Knowledge of the Python programming language for tooling, CI and testing would be an advantage.   Technical competencies:   Development of software for embedded and real-time systems with/without OS. Development of system software (drivers, system configuration and monitoring, etc.). Architecture and design of ICT systems. Control & data acquisition systems, distributed applications and services.   Behavioural competencies:   Achieving results: delivering high quality work on time and fulfilling expectations; allocating appropriate amount of time for completing tasks; driving work / projects along and seeing them through to their conclusion. Solving problems: identifying, defining and assessing problems, taking action to address them; recognizing what is essential; discriminating between important and peripheral information and being able to see the whole picture. Communicating effectively: successfully changing other people's opinions by persuasive arguments; expressing opinions, ideas and suggestions with conviction and in a logical/structured manner; keeping to the point. Working in teams: contributing to promoting a positive atmosphere in the team through an optimistic and constructive attitude; addressing issues; debating at the table and engaging in constructive confrontation of ideas.   Language skills:  Spoken and written English or French: ability to understand and speak the other language in professional contexts. Ability to draw-up technical specifications and/or scientific reports and to make oral presentations in at least one of the two languages.     Additional Information    Eligibility and closing date:   Diversity has been an integral part of CERN's mission since its foundation and is an established value of the Organization. Employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We welcome applications from all Member States and Associate Member States. This vacancy will be filled as soon as possible, and applications should normally reach us no later than 02.12.2019  Employment Conditions  Contract type: Limited duration contract (5 years). Subject to certain conditions, holders of limited-duration contracts may apply for an indefinite position. These functions require:  Work during nights, Sundays and official holidays, when required by the needs of the Organization. Stand-by duty, when required by the needs of the Organization. Work in radiation controlled areas, when required by the needs of the Organization.  Job grade: 6-7 Job reference: BE-CO-HT-2019-112-LD Benchmark Job Title: Computing Engineer  Please make sure you have all the documents needed to hand as you start your application, as once it is submitted, you will not be able to upload any documents or edit your application further   I'm interestedPrivacy Policy Display original ad

Marketing Specialist (80%-100%)                            DECTRIS is a successful and growing company that develops and manufactures X-ray and electron cameras to spark scientific breakthroughs around the world. While photographic cameras capture visible light, DECTRIS cameras count individual X-ray photons and electrons. Our 100+ employees are located in Switzerland and the United States.At DECTRIS, academic research meets agile industry practices. The company’s roots are deep in the scientific community and our scientists publish new research results every year. At the same time, our engineers, technicians, administrators, and commercial experts work hard to make sure our customers benefit from the latest technologies without delay.            Marketing Specialist (80%-100%)           Your Tasks  Managing all our conference exhibitions from A to Z, from marketing concept down to the practical arrangement details Planning and creating visual marketing content, such as brochures, flyers, ads, website banners Making sure our visual corporate identity is followed; supporting the evolution of our CI Advising product development with design issues Managing our website and online advertising campaigns together with the marketing team; tracking website and digital ad statistics and making recommendations based on the data Managing the DECTRIS trademarks Liaising with freelancers Skills and interest permitting, taking photos and creating videos Brainstorming new ideas to make DECTRIS known and trusted in new markets    Your Profile  Passionate about science and experience in working with scientists Suitable university degree or work experience in B2B marketing communications, including Email and online marketing, SEO / SEM, website analytics Creating brochures and other print material Working with Adobe Suite Organizing events, preferably scientific conference exhibitions   Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail Tech-savvy; quick to find and learn new marketing software or presentation hardware Team player Good English skills Native German or equivalent          We Offer  A friendly company culture with a passionate team: we are proud that we were able to hold the world record calculating the digits of pi for 3 years! A successful and growing high tech company in an international, scientific environment: more than half of the world's protein structures have been discovered with our detectors! A competitive salary and good benefits A modern office with A/C, gym, underground parking for cars and bicycles, company cars and e-bikes to borrow, in-house catering, free snacks and coffee Support for professional training as well as our non-German speakers' German studies Generous team events    https://www.dectris.com/career  Application Form  back to jobmarket         Your manager  Angina Herrmann, Head of Marketing & Communications   Team Marketing & Communications The DECTRIS Marketing team's task is to translate often complicated scientific facts into engaging communication. We tell true stories about scientists to scientists online, in print, and face-to-face at international conferences. We make sure our corporate image delivers the right message to the world, and we support the DECTRIS company culture through internal communication.                 DECTRIS Ltd. · Taefernweg 1 · 5405 Baden-Daettwil www.dectris.com · Phone: +41 56 500 21 00 · jobs@dectris.com

Sie sind verantwortlich für die Aktualisierung, Weiterentwicklung und Pflege der Instandhaltungsvorschriften basierend auf dem Zustand und dem Betrieb der Fahrzeuge. Sie arbeiten aktiv im Projekt «Optimierung Flotteninstandhaltung» mit und erarbeiten hier die neuen Instandhaltungskonzepte unserer Schienenfahrzeuge. Sie erstellen Konzepte zur Nutzung der neuen Ferndiagnosesystemen auf unseren Fahrzeugflotten und etablieren diese mit unseren Partnern. Konzepte und Spezifikationen für technische Änderungen am Fahrzeug werden von Ihnen erstellt.     Das bringen Sie mit. Erfahrung mit Ferndiagnosesystemen sowie Data Analytics von Vorteil. Mehrjährige technische Berufserfahrung in der Bahnindustrie oder Transportindustrie sind von Vorteil (z.B. Inbetriebsetzung, Instandhaltung, Analysen/Entwicklung von komplexen Systemen, Anlagenbau, etc.) evtl. mit Kenntnissen in Zulassungsprozessen und -anforderungen für Rollmaterial. Fähigkeit zum vernetzten Denken und ausgeprägtes Interesse für Gesamtsysteme gepaart mit der Fähigkeit pragmatische Lösungen zu erarbeiten und umzusetzen. Genaues, präzises Arbeitsverhalten mit hohem Risiko- und Sicherheitsbewusstsein. Dass Sie mit uns die Schweiz bewegen wollen, ist für uns die grösste Motivation. Du bildest die Schnittstelle zu den Lieferanten, die Unterstützung bei Projekten und Serviceentwicklung runden deine Tätigkeit ab.  Weshalb dir das gelingt  Abschluss (EFZ) in Informatik, Elektronik oder in einem ähnlichen Bereich Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Betrieb von Serverumgebungen der Microsoft Produktpalette (AD, DNS, Lync/Skype for Business, Exchange, mit Vorteil O365 / Hybrid) Zertifizierungen wie MCSA / MCSE von Vorteil Ausgeprägte Kunden- und Businessorientierung Konzeptionelles sowie lösungsorientiertes Denken, Handeln und Arbeiten Regelmässiger Pikettdienst Offen für neue Technologien und Wege sowie Bereitschaft sich regelmäßig weiterzubilden Sehr gutes Deutsch und gutes Englisch, Französisch und Italienisch ist von Vorteil       Neugierig auf mehr?Als ICT System Specialist ... startest du so rasch wie möglich ... kannst du teilweise im Home-Office arbeiten ... ist keine Reisetätigkeit vorgesehen   Diese Stelle möchten wir ohne externe Personaldienstleister besetzen. Bei Krankheit oder Unfall gewähren wir dir eine grosszügige Lohnfortzahlung. Job title: Master Thesis in Product Development Glass Syringes (m/f/d) for our Business Unit Pharma
Content:
Master Thesis in Product Development Glass Syringes (m/f/d) for our Business Unit Pharma  International technology group • specialty glasses and glass-ceramics • more than 130 years experience • more than 15,500 employees in 34 countries • innovative ideas for the world of tomorrow What’s your next milestone? 
You can expect interesting tasks and challenging projects, as well as motivated and friendly teams in fields that influence our future. Do you want to be successful with us? Then, please send us your application: SCHOTT Schweiz AG, Human Resources, Alexandra Wirth 
 Because human health matters. We design solutions to ensure medicines are safe and easy to use for people around the world. More than 600 production lines in 13 countries worldwide produce more than 10 billion syringes, vials, ampoules, cartridges and special articles of tubing glass or polymer. We think customers, users and patients first. We think people! We are Business Unit Pharmaceutical Systems .     You want to be part of the most innovative pioneer of pharma packaging? You want to be part of an open-minded, flexible and inspiring industry team? You want to be responsible for the product group that is the growth engine of our business unit? You want to develop your potential to the next level?    Then, it’s time that you become part of our Business Unit Pharmaceutical Systems as a Master Thesis Student (m/f/d) for Product Development Glass Syringes . You will be located in St. Gallen, starting asap to support our Global Product Development. You will be part of a young and dynamic team with a strong mentality. 
 You conduct studies on our products to generate scientific data and deeper understanding regarding one of the following topics:  Impact of different component materials on the product functionalities Effectiveness of cleaning processes   You review the literature on the specific topic, compare measurements methods and select the most appropriate You define test methods and create test plans You work with production to produce the samples for your tests and with the lab to test the samples You collect and interpret the results together with the Product Engineers   Advanced studies in Life Science or Engineering (e.g. pharmaceutical engineering, biotechnology, mechanical engineering, materials engineering, chemical engineering etc.) Technical ability to define test methods and create solid test plans Ability to critically analyze and explain test results Ability to work independently with high level of commitment and responsibility Excellent analytical skills and care of the details Excellent organizational skills Excellent knowledge of MS Office Excel and Power Point Fluent command in German and English  
At SCHOTT, you will enjoy our journey towards growth in cross-functional teams. We offer you a career with a variety of interesting topics and a lot of freedom for creativity in a cooperative working environment. We need you and your innovative ideas to continue with our unsurpassed quality, safety and reliability. We are agile and inspiring, yet focused. We successfully execute on all levels.Display original ad

Intern- Statistical Mechatronic Machine Learning/AI Intern - Statistical Mechatronic Machine Learning/AI    Liechtenstein, Schaan  Reference No: 1759What's the role? Take the lead on a cutting-edge project in making smarter tools. Start date is flexible to the student's availability, duration for at least months. Who is Hilti? If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With some 28,000 people in more than 120 countries, which we’re looking to expand, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth, step up to new challenges and grow your career. What does the role involve? As intern in our department you’ll be part of the advanced mechatronics team. You’ll work closely with our experts to develop direct fastening tools in corporate research and technology. There is a top-notch team of experts available to support you every step of the way. Your key responsibilities will be to come up with creative software solutions, design them, build them and test them. Which innovative applications and services for our tools can improve the customer experience even further? It's your turn to contribute tothe development of our tools!   We have 400 of the world’s best engineers developing and testing tomorrow’s technical solutions in our innovation center in Liechtenstein. What do we offer? We’ll give you the tools you need to excel in your internship, including one-to-one coaching. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as you’ll manage your own project while being part of a friendly team. You’ll not just be another pair of hands but a fully integrated team member with lots of self-responsibility. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with strategic development discussions and career opportunities. We’ll support you even before you start with us through relocation and integration support. With the international interns community at Hilti you’ll never be bored. Further, the snow-draped mountains, crystal-clear lakes and marvelous landscapes in the Happy Valley invite for lots of outdoor activities. Why should you apply? We have an excellent mix of people, which we believe makes for a more vibrant, more innovative, more productive team. So, if you have no knowledge of construction, that’s fine with us. We’re more interested in your ability, commitment and drive to succeed. What you need is:  Currently pursuing a BS or MS in Statistics, Big Data or Engineering Degree MatLab or TensorFlow, Machine Learning required Option: CAD, PCB design, Embedded programming Energy, courage and sharp thinking A proactive approach and self-reliant personality    We take our time to get to know you. As part of your recruitment process, you’ll get to talk to your internship coach as well as your HR Manager who both can answer some of your burning questions.  Display original ad

Software Development Internship - Geneva - February 2020    Software Development Internship - Geneva - February 2020  Switzerland - Geneva  APPLY NOW  Expedia     Software Development Internship     Location: Geneva  Start date: From February 2020  Duration: 6 months    Eligibility Criteria:   Final year of a Computer Science/Computer Engineering degree Please ensure you apply with your CV in English      Application process     Online Application Form HackerRank test + Telephone Interview    Are you ready to join a team that works with the most innovative technologies in the travel industry? Do you love writing code that matters and that improves our customers journey in booking an unforgettable experience?   Our Software Engineer interns’ primary responsibility is to support our teams in optimising our travel platform. We have various opportunities focusing on front, back & full stack development.   Here’s what Louise has said about her placement year at Expedia:   “I truly believe I had one of the best placement experiences I could’ve ever had. Hotels.com really helped me grow and bring me out of my comfort zone. Being part of the Shopping team was amazing, I was able to start out as a backend Java engineer. When I wanted to see the full stack the team encouraged me to get involved in the front end side. I even got to learn a little bit about being a Scrum Master and ran a handful of our daily stand ups. Being able to contribute to features that are still live on the site is such a rewarding feeling. I had some of the best mentors, and they have inspired me in so many ways. They encouraged my questions, welcomed my ideas for the team and really helped me build my confidence in my technical ability.”    What you’ll do  • Design, develop, debug, and modify components of software applications and tools • Learn to contribute to requirement definition process • Drive technical implementation at the application/product level for small projects • Work in a team to design, spec, and schedule a component or feature • Provide quality implementation and testing of a component or feature with peer and manager support • Provide improvements to solutions for a given problem • Resolve problems and roadblocks as they occur with help from peers or managers. Follow through on details and drive issues to closure with help from peers or managers. • Support development of documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance • Collaborate with and learn from all members of technical staff    Who you areYou’ll fit this role if you have   Currently enrolled in a 4-year university graduating in 2022  • Pursuing a bachelor degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Mathematics • Programming experience in one or more of the following languages:  Java, C/C++ Python C#  • Knowledge of data structures, algorithms and OOP concepts • Strong verbal and written communication skills   Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so.    Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. We are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. Our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility program, Expedia Cares.   If you have a hunger to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and to work in the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you.   Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, HomeAway®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®.   #LI-MW1    Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age. APPLY NOW Display original ad

Technical Software Project Manager 80% bis 100%    Was du bewegstAls Teil des AVANTI-Teams begleitest du den gesamten Projektverlauf, von der Konzeption über die Entwicklung der Applikationen, bis zu deren Einsatz bei unseren Kunden vor Ort. Du bietest dabei wertvolle Unterstützung durch hervorragende Gesamtlösungen. Deine Fähigkeit, auf die spezifischen Kundenbedürfnisse einzugehen, ist das A und O. Du leitest spannende Informatikprojekte im Bereich der Blaulichtorganisationen. Dabei verantwortest du die Spezifikations-Erstellung (Kundenbedürfnisse, technische/funktionale Abläufe, GUI). Des Weiteren hilfst du bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer Applikationslandschaft mit. Meetings, Workshops und Präsentationen vor Ort beim Kunden sind für dich selbstverständlich. Die Koordination aller Aktivitäten eines Kunden siehst du als Kundenbetreuer, dabei sind dir die Erstellung von Offerten (Analyse, Termine, Kosten, Risiken, Verkaufspräsentationen) bekannt. Auch in der Planung, Koordination und Kontrolle der Software-Entwicklung bist du aktiv. Job title: PhD Position in Precision Medicine for Neurological Disorders 100%, Basel, temporary
Content: PhD Position in Precision Medicine for Neurological Disorders 100%, Basel, temporaryPhD Position in Precision Medicine for Neurological Disorders 100%, Basel, temporary  The Machine Learning and Computational Biology Laboratory at the Department of Biosystems Science and Engineering (D-BSSE) is seeking a PhD Student in the field of Machine Learning for Health to start on January 1st, 2020. The student will be joining a highly interdisciplinary research team and will be supervised by Dr. Catherine Jutzeler and Prof. Karsten Borgwardt. The Department of Biosystems Science and Engineering (D-BSSE) is one of ETH Zurich's youngest departments and the only one located in Basel outside of the Zurich campus. It unites biologists, engineers, computer scientists, and mathematicians to work towards a quantitative understanding and purposeful engineering of complex biological systems.  Job description  The PhD student will be funded by Dr. Catherine Jutzeler’s recently awarded Swiss National Science Foundation Ambizione Grant on precision medicine for neurological disorders. The focus of this project will be on traumatic brain and spinal cord injury, with the potential to expand to other neurological conditions. Both disorders, traumatic brain and spinal cord injury, are highly heterogenous in terms of clinical presentation, disease progression, and associated comorbidities. This heterogeneity makes reliable prediction of future outcomes and patient stratification for clinical trials extremely challenging. The aims of this project are to (1) identify biomarkers that allow a better characterization of the patients (e.g., identification of homogenous subgroups, phenotypes, responders and non-responders); and (2) expedite the search for disease-modifying treatments through drug repurposing. To implicitly account for the multifaceted nature of the disorders, state-of-the-art machine learning methods will be applied to analyze multidimensional medical data (clinical, imaging, genetic, behavioral, and physiological), derived from completed clinical trials, health records, and observational studies. Machine learning topics relevant to the project include mining and learning on time series and graphs, kernel methods, graph kernels, multiple testing correction in ultra-high-dimensional spaces, feature selection in structured spaces, deep learning, and causal inference.   Your profile  Applicants should be highly motivated and creative, hold a Master’s Degree in computer science, bioinformatics, computational biology, statistics, medicine, or related fields. Moreover, candidates must be able to fluently communicate in English (oral and written) and be willing to work in a highly interactive, interdisciplinary, and international environment at the interface of machine learning and biomedicine. Academic excellence, a professional work attitude, and a proactive and self-driven work ethic are expected. Advanced computer skills, including use of statistical software such as R, Python, or C++ are an asset. The position is fully funded for 4 years, and it will be located in the Machine Learning and Computational Biology Laboratory at the Department of Biosystems Science and Engineering at the ETH Campus in Basel. Ideally, the position should start on January 1, 2020.  ETH Zurich   ETH Zurich is one of the world’s leading universities specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new knowledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an environment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions for the global challenges of today and tomorrow. Working, teaching and research at ETH Zurich Display original ad

Job title: Account Manager (f/m/d) SAP Digital Business Services Romandie
Content: Account Manager (f/m/d) SAP Digital Business Services Romandie      Requisition ID: 223453 Work Area: Sales Expected Travel: 0 - 50% Career Status: Professional Employment Type: Regular Full Time    COMPANY DESCRIPTION SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures. SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.      Account Manager (f/m/d) SAP Digital Business Services Romandie       PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES  Services Account Manager (SAM) works closely with the SAP License organization, SAP Delivery counter-parts, customers and partners to ensure the overall success of the sale and implementation of SAP solutions and are expected to significantly contribute to the overall success of the customer relationship.The SAM will be responsible for selling SAP Services to a defined portfolio of strategic and medium size clients in Suisse Romande region.    EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS  In this role, you will generate demand for SAP's service offering, develop opportunity execution plans, identify key team members and resources needed to properly scope the projects to meet client needs and SAP business parameters, and manage the customer relationship from initial discussions to close of deal. You are principally the general manager of your aligned accounts and own the relationships for the SAP Consulting line of business. This role will align to both growth and existing SAP commercial accounts and as a result, a key portion of the role will be focused on opening dormant accounts. In order to develop a strong revenue backlog and individual annuity, territory planning, account development and lead generation are critical components to success. Incumbent will work closely with license, LOB and back office teams to deliver holistic, value-based business outcomes. Key responsibilities of the job are to:    Engage with client decision makers and own the relationships for the SAP Consulting line of business. Drive demand for SAP’s service offerings, develop and execute opportunity plans and create a strong revenue backlog and distinct annuity. Organize and orchestrate SAP teams and resources needed to properly scope the project(s) to meet client needs. Collaborate with virtual account teams on bid strategies, solution architecture and commercial models. Manage the sales process from initial identification through closure and “own” the sale. Play a key role alongside SAP service offerings by helping to create the value story; developing strategic win themes; providing coaching and other professional sales support for client facing presentations. Represent SAP by spending time in the field and at conferences, forums, etc. to extend the business network and support sales campaigns. Maintain accurate and timely client, pipeline, and forecast data in our systems and account receivables for his/her account portfolio.     WORK EXPERIENCE/ SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES   5+ years of experience with prior success in a substantially similar role, SAP consulting professional, or the equivalent of an existing experienced industry focused consulting sales professional. Proven sales track record, account development, territory building and quota performance. In-depth understanding of the marketplace for SAP consulting services, clients' business issues and range of competition. Ability to develop and secure relationships with buyers, decision makers, influencers and other referral sources.  Proven track records of executing volume business and capability to work on multiple accounts at the same time.   Experience in different industries is an advantage: retail, consumer products, discrete manufacturing, telco, etc.   Teamwork & Collaboration with local & virtual Sales Teams.   Strong communication and presentation skills in French and English (written and spoken) is a must – German is an asset.   Minimum a bachelor's degree or equivalent (Business / Engineering or Technology).        Are you interested to know more about SAP Digital Business Services?     Start your digital journey today: https://www.sap-digital-business-services.com/    Are you looking for a compelling career or an exciting adventure?   At SAP, you don’t have to choose. As the global leader for business software, SAP helps companies in more than 25 industries and has employees in 130+ countries—which means tons of opportunities for you to grow and expand your career. As the inventor and visionary that reimagines what’s possible in the digital economy, SAP is changing the game of business as we know it.        WHAT YOU GET FROM US  Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now .     SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.       Job Segment:Account Manager, ERP, Engineer, SAP, Consulting, Sales, Technology, Engineering Display original ad

Software Developer API 80% bis 100%    What you achieveThanks to your efforts, the team meets our service-level commitments. Working closely with business and technology experts, you provide technical analysis, design, development, testing and support. As part of an interdisciplinary DevOps team, you are fully involved in implementing company-wide processes to manage the software lifecycle. Based on this, you identify, assess, and implement solutions in coordination with internal and external stakeholders. When providing 2nd and 3rd level support for our API products, you ensure that incidents and problems are being addressed and solved immediately.  Why you succeed  Degree (UAS/technical college) in computer science, business informatics, or an equivalent degree Profound knowledge of Java Familiar with the Java Spring framework, the Apigee framework, Splunk, Jenkins, and Bamboo Experience in software architecture and development Hands-on experience with implementing state-of-the-art CI/CD solutions, continuous testing, and test automation Familiar with Agile methodologies (e.g. SAFe, Scrum) as well as the DevOps approach Open-minded, solution- and team-oriented personality Good English, German is a plus       Curious to know more?As Software Developer API ... you start as soon as possible ... you can partly work from the home office ... no travel activity is planned   We intend to fill this position without involvement of external recruiting or placement companies. Flexible working    Flexible working Our flexible, part-time or job sharing working models let you achieve a healthy work-life balance. And because travel broadens our horizons, you can either apply for unpaid leave or purchase up to two weeks of additional holiday per year.    Work and family    Work and family Helping you optimally combine your work and family life is very important to us. Swisscom provides for 18 weeks of maternity leave and 3 weeks of paternity leave. Our childcare programme assists you with matters related to taking care of your children, while the Work & Care programme lets you take care of sick family members.    Fringe benefits    Fringe benefits We offer you a generous monthly discount on certain Swisscom products. You also benefit from discounted tickets and travel cards on public transport. The healthy, low-cost meals that you can enjoy at our staff restaurants are an additional benefit. Job title: European Senior Sales Executive - Cryptocurrency & Quantitative Trading Solutions
Content: European Senior Sales Executive - Cryptocurrency & Quantitative Trading Solutions         We currently have the following job openings:  European Senior Sales Executive Zurich/Switzerland – Cryptocurrency & Quantitative Trading Solutions   Pre-Sales Engineer Zurich/Switzerland – Crypto Assets & Quantitative Trading   APAC Senior Sales Executive Singapore – Cryptocurrency & Quantitative Trading Solutions   Senior Java Developer Zurich/Switzerland – Crypto Assets & Quantitative Trading Systems   ReactJS Developer Zurich/Switzerland or Wroclaw/Poland – Quantitative Trading Systems  Company Overview Available on-premise or in the cloud, AlgoTrader is an institutional-grade algorithmic trading software solution for conducting quantitative research, trading strategy development, strategy back-testing and automated trading for both traditional securities and crypto assets. AlgoTrader provides everything a typical quantitative trading firm requires to run its research and trading operations. It is the very first and most advanced algorithmic trading software product to allow automated trading of Bitcoin and other crypto assets. AlgoTrader provides consulting services based on AlgoTrader. Typical clients are hedge funds, crypto currency funds, prop trading groups, banks and brokers. Our headquarter is in Zurich, Switzerland. We have a sales office in New York and Singapore and development teams in Wroclaw/Poland and Kiev/Ukraine. European Senior Sales Executive – Cryptocurrency & Quantitative Trading Solutions Job Overview: Building on our strong recent growth, we are now actively seeking an experienced Senior Sales Executive to join our team covering the European market. With a demonstrable and successful track record delivering mission-critical solutions to Buyside and Capital Markets firms, you will be responsible for actively developing, managing and closing new clients in addition to supporting our existing client portfolio. Experience in the trading and execution as well as cryptocurrency is highly regarded along with a successful selling record into Buyside firms like Hedge Funds. This is an extremely exciting time to be joining an ambitious high-growth Fintech with strong marklet demand with a well established solution and client base. Responsibilities  Responsibility for sales to new and existing clients Manage the entire sales process from business development, lead qualification, business analysis, client presentations through to negotiation and deal closing. Cooperate with internal teams like marketing, pre-sales and sales support to increase sales As a seasoned and successful new business sales professional, you will be expected to hit sales targets and be measured primarily on delivering new business.  Knowledge/Experience  5+ years of strategic B2B consultative solution sales experience Existing network within the Buyside (quant Hedge Funds, prop shops, market makers, etc.) Proven experience in selling to multiple levels within client organizations, up to and including C-level management Proven track record of meeting sales targets in excess of $1 million annual sales quota Extensive experience in building and maintaining account relationships Generation of sales strategies for different target groups Fluent with proactive sales approaches Must be able to proactively develop business as well qualify and manage in-bound leads Experience in working in a distributed global environment  Required Skills  Master’s degree or higher in Business or Engineering Excellent presentation and communication skills (written and oral) Have a strong new business hunter mentality Ability to manage multiple complex sales processes to successful closure Entrepreneurial, proactive, & innovative personality Strong analytical and structured mindset and very results-oriented Hands-on, can-do type of personality Fluent in English and German Ability to travel internationally, approx. 10 to 20%  Pre-Sales Engineer Zurich/Switzerland – Crypto Assets & Quantitative Trading Job Overview: We are looking for a Pre-Sales Engineer based in Zurich. As a Pre-Sales Engineer, you will be part of the AlgoTrader sales team and support the sales process and deal flow. You will collaborate closely with the sales, consulting services, product development and technical support teams to ensure that proposed deals include technical solutions that accurately address client needs. You will be reporting to the Head of Sales EMEA directly. Responsibilities  Support the sales team with project inquiries Collaborate on the design of quantitative trading strategies for our prospects Collaborate on project estimations Perform presentations of our solution AlgoTrader to our prospects Ensure technical support to sales staff and client trails Collaborate on the development of our product AlgoTrader Follow current industry trends and incorporate best practices into the solution  Knowledge/Experience   MUST HAVE: Experience in the trading domain, preferably with quantitative trading strategies based on Stocks, Forex, Futures, Options and/or Crypto Assets Algorithmic trading systems Agile development Working in a distributed global environment  Required Skills   MUST HAVE: Very good expertise in the Java 8 SE/EE Master’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Engineering or Computer Science Hands-on experience with Spring, Hibernate & FIX Protocol Good understanding of RDBMS Hands-on experience with Maven, Git, Jenkins & Nexus Strong communication, customer facing, presentation skills and fluent in English Ability to travel internationally, approx. 10 to 20%  APAC Senior Sales Executive – Cryptocurrency & Quantitative Trading Solutions Job Overview: Building on our strong recent growth, we are now actively seeking an experienced Financial Services Technology Senior Sales Executive to join our team covering the APAC market. The candidate must be located in Singapore at our APAC regional office. With a demonstrable and successful track record in delivering mission-critical solutions to Buyside and Capital Markets firms, you will be responsible for actively developing, managing and closing new clients in addition to supporting our existing client portfolio. You must be a confident and motivated self-starter and be comfortable in being the “face” of AlgoTrader in the APAC region. Strategic solution sales experience in electronic trading and execution as well as exposure to the growing Digital Asset economoy is highly critical along with a successful selling record of managing multiple complex sales engagagments into Buyside firms like Hedge Funds. This is an extremely exciting time to be joining an ambitious high-growth Fintech with strong marklet demand with a well established solution and client base. Responsibilities  Responsibility for sales to new and existing clients Developing and growing the APAC region for AlgoTrader Manage the entire sales process from business development, lead qualification, business analysis, client presentations through to negotiation and deal closing. Supporting clients through the implementation process and on-going Account Management duties. Cooperate with internal teams like marketing, pre-sales and sales support to increase sales through participating in the construction and delivery of successful go-to-market campaigns oriented towards the APAC region. As a seasoned and successful new business sales professional, you will be expected to hit sales targets and be measured primarily on delivering new business.  Knowledge/Experience  Minimum 10 years of strategic B2B consultative solution sales experience. Existing network within the Buyside (quant Hedge Funds, prop shops, market makers, etc.) Proven experience in selling Financial Services Technology Solutions to multiple levels within client organizations, up to and including C-Suite management. Proven track record of meeting new business sales targets in excess of US$1 million annual sales quota with a quarterly target focus. Must be able to proactively develop outbound prospects as well qualifying and managing inbound leads from our marketing and branding efforts. Extensive experience in building and maintaining strategic account and partnership relationships in Financial Services. Generation of go-to-market and sales execution strategies for different target groups. Be a team player and happy to work with the global team and processes in terms of reporting, opportunity management and forecasting. Experience in working in a distributed global environment  Required Skills  Master’s degree or higher in Business or Engineering Excellent presentation and communication skills (written and oral) Have a strong new business hunter mentality Ability to manage multiple complex sales processes to successful closure and closure rates Entrepreneurial, proactive, curious & innovative personality Strong analytical and structured mindset and very results-oriented Hands-on, can-do type of personality Fluent in English Ability to travel internationally, approx. 20 to 40%  Senior Java Developer Zurich/Switzerland – Crypto Assets & Quantitative Trading Systems Job Overview: We are looking for a Senior Java Developer based in our Zurich office. As a Senior Java Developer you will design and implement strategic features for our core product AlgoTrader and quantitative trading strategies for our clients. Responsibilities:  Design and implementation of future releases of AlgoTrader including key infrastructure components such as low latency order management, execution algorithms, smart order routing, event handling, big data management, messaging and business services. Analysis, Design, Implementation and Testing of quantitative trading strategies based on client specific requirements. Close collaboration with product management, development team, head of development and customers. Following current industry trends and incorporating best practices into the solution.  Knowledge/Experience:   MUST HAVE: Experience in the trading domain, preferably with quantitative trading strategies based on Stocks, Forex, Futures, Options and/or Crypto Assets Experience with algorithmic trading systems and low-latency trading. Master’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Engineering and/or Computer Science. At least 5 years hands-on professional experience in the Java enterprise environment. Experience with agile and test driven development. Experience in working in a distributed global environment.  Required Skills:   MUST HAVE: Very good expertise in the Java 8 SE/EE. Very good expertise in software patterns and architectural enterprise concepts. Very good expertise in building multi-threaded & distributed systems. Hands-on experience with Spring, Hibernate & FIX Protocol. Good understanding of RDBMS and optionally Big Data. Hands-on experience with Maven, Git, Jenkins & Nexus. Very strong communication skills and fluent in English.  ReactJS Developer – Quantitative Trading Systems Job Overview: You will be part of the AlgoTrader core development team. As a ReactJS Developer, you complement the existing cross functional team. As the driving person, you are closely working together with the team and the head of development to define and implement future releases of AlgoTrader. There is an immediate need to push the upcoming two release for summer and fall in 2019:  Expanding the Order Book frontend New fronted for Backtesting Smart Order Routing (SOR) frontend enhancements Request for Quote frontend Frontend for strategy development  Responsibilities: Design and implementation of future releases of the AlgoTrader Web UI (http://html5.algotrader.ch) Close collaboration with product management, development team, head of development and customers Knowledge/Experience:  React.JS deep expertise At least 5 years’ hands-on professional experience in frontend development Experience with agile and test driven development Experience in working in a distributed global environment Preferably worked in the trading world or exposure to the capital market  Required Skills:  Hands-on experience with HTML5, ReactJS Very good expertise in software patterns and architectural enterprise concepts Hands-on experience with Git Very strong communication skills and fluent in English  Please send your application including CV via Email to:    Display original ad

MANAGER ASIC DESIGN (F/M)     MANAGER ASIC DESIGN (F/M)            Company Information  TE Connectivity Ltd., is a $14 billion global technology and manufacturing leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. For more than 75 years, our connectivity and sensor solutions, proven in the harshest environments, have enabled advancements in transportation, industrial applications, medical technology, energy, data communications, and the home. With 80,000 employees, including more than 8,000 engineers, working alongside customers in nearly 140 countries, TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at www.te.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, WeChat and Twitter. TE is now one of the largest sensor companies in the world, with innovative sensor solutions that help customers transform concepts into smart, connected creations. TE’s unmatched portfolio of intelligent, efficient and high-performing sensor solutions are used for customers across several industries, from automotive, industrial and commercial transportation and aerospace and defense, to medical solutions and consumer applications.    Job Overview   Swiss manufacturing and development site is IATF 16949 certified; it employs 70 people and is wholly recognized as one of the worldwide leaders in digital pressure sensor systems. Only weighing a few grams, our products are designed to be implemented in diverse applications in the automotive, consumer and industrial markets.   To strengthen the product development engineering team, we are looking for an entry within the best delays:    Manager ASIC DESIGN (F/M)   Department: Research and Development    The successful candidate will be involved in leading the team that develop integrated circuits for volume production.       Responsibilities & Qualifications    Your career with us:  In your position, you will be responsible in the following development tasks:• Manage an ASIC design team in product development department • Lead the development of sensor signal conditioning ASICs for high volume production • Build relationships within the company, working with global remote teams • Active participation in sensor product design to satisfy industrial and automotive customer demands, • Assure quality and reliability targets for new integrated circuits,• Report progress on projects and technology to senior management• Compliance with company policies• Analyse customer problems in collaboration with quality department.    With your commitment, you should be able to successfully:• Build effective teams and motivate others• Deliver in time and in specifications new integrated circuits,• Managing and measuring work to meet critical KPIs• Maintain and develop a high-quality ASIC know-how,• Continue improvement of product & design tools,   You will interact also with your colleagues all over the world as the expert and helping-hand.You will be in contact with all internal departments in order to make your product a success on the market.     Do you recognize yourself here? • Master’s degree or higher (Electronics or Microelectrnics),• Proven knowledge in managing at least 5 people teams with 3-5 years of experience• 10+ year experience in the field of mixed signal design (ADCs, DACs, PLLs, clocks, precision buffers) • Advanced user of Mentor/Cadence platforms• Proven experience working with external design houses and ASIC suppliers • Practical familiarity on sensors, a good grasp on digital protocols (SPI, I2C, I3C, SENT, CAN, LIN…)• Proven experience on high voltage, overvoltage protection, IS26262 are a big plus• Reliable, focused on quality, capable of working independently and under pressure, able to handle several projects concurrently, keen on innovative solutions• Always looking to improve and try new ideas,• Organized, accurate and structured,• Energizing and result oriented,• Open minded and intercultural awareness,• Fluent in English, French speaking (or willing to learn), German is a plus.     Competencies   Motivating Others Managing and Measuring Work Building Effective Teams Values: Integrity, Accountability,Teamwork, Innovation SET : Strategy, Execution, Talent (for managers)    Our company offers you an exciting and challenging position, in a dynamic and high technology environment. This position will improve your experience with innovative technologies, management, services, and processes. Backed by a competitive salary and training opportunities, you will work in a professional community with many satisfied clients and committed team members from all over the world.                      Location: Bevaix, NE, CH, 2022        Travel: 10% to 25%       Requisition ID: 48080       Alternative Locations:           Job Segment:Engineer, Developer, Manager, Web Design, Engineering, Technology, Management, Creative, Automotive Display original ad

Manager Paid Social  At a Glance: Due to a propelling growth in our direct to consumer business, we are looking for a Paid Social Manager to shape the future of On’s acquisition initiatives through Social Media Platforms. You will work in a cross functional team together with digital channel owners working on campaigns covering the full customer funnel. You will lead and manage our global paid social campaigns across Facebook and Instagram. With budget responsibility you will decide which streams to invest in to grow brand awareness as well as online sales. You will monitor and optimize the campaigns and work directly with Facebook as a strategic sparring partner. An entrepreneurial drive and strong hands-on execution will be imperative to shape and grow the brand. The position is to be based in either Zurich or Berlin.  Your Team:  As you might expect from a running brand, the E-Commerce team at On is a fast-paced place to be. This team of interdisciplinary all-stars are used to rapid turnaround times and ambitious targets. From engineers to designers, data scientists and digital marketing specialists, this is the team responsible for creating winning digital products and campaigns that run the length of the purchase funnel. The shared goal? Efficient growth at high speed – what else?  Your Mission:   Accountable for online sales and traffic via Facebook and Instagram globally. Increase volume while driving high ROAS efficiency Scale a strong traffic engine even further by attracting new runners to On while effectively converting them to On runners Grow our key markets and differentiate in campaign execution and budget administration Develop and monitor campaign models across the full customer funnel to highlight ROAS and attribution. Enable further investment in high performing and refinement of less optimal campaigns and audiences Ensure brand consistency across all touch points and take an active part in shaping the brand by understanding the runner Apply a creative solution orientation to improve campaigns and suggest out-of-the-box initiatives to get there, working together with Brand Design team, Content team and other channel experts Bring new digital trends to On and be on top of latest changes/upgrades in digital marketing opportunities. Be a thought leader and spearhead new initiatives in collaboration with the team   Your Story:   +2 years' hands-on experience with paid social media marketing Operational and strategic understanding of other performance and branding channels Proven experience in accountability over revenue and budget A good track record of achieving ambitious goals. Results driven and vertical expertise delivering results by managing digital campaigns Analytics-driven and can justify investments by mastering ROAS calculations and cross-channel impact. Self-driven, entrepreneurial and excellent problem solver. Enjoys coming up with creative solutions in a fast paced agile environment Ability to influence and negotiate with internal and external stakeholders to achieve objectives. Up-to-date with new digital trends and upgrades. Core shaper of the digital brand perception Strong hands-on executor. Get things done Fluent in German and English   What we offer:  We offer a dynamic, challenging and sportive environment that has been ranked as the‘fastestgrowing sports company’ of its time. With offices across the globe, we are an international team who is hungry to innovate and build something incredible. We foster an active environment where each individual thrives for excellence and can achieve their full potential. This is where your work matters, you’re hands-on and your team members are amongst the very best in their respective disciplines and fields.  If you are driven to bring On to the next level, curious about the opportunity and want to be part of our growing team send us your application, and join the ONiverse! Content: Senior Application Analyst for SAP IBP (m/f/d)     Senior Application Analyst for SAP IBP (m/f/d)         Job Posting Title: Senior Application Analyst for IBP  Job Code: 30003823Segment: CORPORATE (10020197) Business Unit: GLOBAL TEIS (10000003) Building: Bensheim (Office) (511) Band/Level: 5 Hiring Manager: AXEL EITLE Recruiter: Hendrik Ziller Relocation: No Travel: 25% to 50% Employee Referral Amount: €4,000.00 Education Experience: Associate Degree (High School +2 years) Employment Experience: 5-7 years   Company Information  TE Connectivity Ltd., is a $14 billion global technology and manufacturing leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. For more than 75 years, our connectivity and sensor solutions, proven in the harshest environments, have enabled advancements in transportation, industrial applications, medical technology, energy, data communications, and the home. With 80,000 employees, including more than 8,000 engineers, working alongside customers in approximately 140 countries, TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at www.te.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, WeChat and Twitter.    Job Overview   SAP Supply Chain Management senior analyst, part of a global team, responsible for analyzing, implementing and/or managing others on global enhancements and projects, in accordance with the company’s pre-defined development and project management methodologies.   This role can be based either in our Bensheim, Darmstadt or Ottobrunn(Munich) office - or in any of our other locations across Europe!     Responsibilities    Determine Business Requirements  Meet with users, management and colleagues to analyze and understand business requirements with sufficient detail to determine the appropriate solution. Record the requirements in a functional requirements document. Include input and output requirements, process maps, screen layouts and business benefits as appropriate. Coordinate the activity of other SAP analysts to ensure complete requirements are defined, including team members who are located off-site (India), and working with TE partners.   Lead complex enhancement requests or projects in a cross-team collaboration.  Meet with business users to understand their request and agree on an implementation plan. Monitor and manage activities linked to the project timeline and budget. Capture issues and engage with the relevant people to eliminate issues. Interact with a Technical team to communicate requirements and design proposals.   Configure the SAP system when needed.  Translate business requirements into SAP configuration. Enter, test and migrate the required SAP configuration to production.   Test the SAP System and its bolt on systems when needed.  Provide integrated test scenarios to confirm a working solution for the business requirements. Test, or help others to test the system, documenting the results.   Provide Training  Create and modify training materials, presentations and White Papers. Deliver training to a project’s local implementation team and to others as required.        Qualifications    University degree in relevant field of study, such as Computer Science, Management Information Systems or Supply Chain Management. Minimum of 5 years of related work experience within an IT organization or a Supply Chain operation. English language, sufficient for clear verbal and written communication within a global company. Senior level analyst, experienced project manager. Required expertise in the functional area of SAP Supply Chain Planning:  Supply / Demand Management Production Planning Capacity Planning Manufacturing Execution Lean Manufacturing Principles   Highly desirable expertise:  SAP IBP (Integrated Business Planning Inventory Optimization, IBP Response S4 HANA Advanced Available to Promise APO PP/DS (Production Planning and Detailed Scheduling)   Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Excellent oral and written communication. Ability to multi-task and adhere to the established project timeframe. Ability to contribute to the design and architecture of the proposed solution. Travel could be required up to 50% with varying length and frequency.      Competencies   Values: Integrity, Accountability,Teamwork, Innovation                         Location: Schaffhausen, SH, CH, 8200        Travel: 25% to 50%       Requisition ID: 47604       Alternative Locations: Mannheim, Darmstadt, Munich, München, Poland, Czec          Job Segment:ERP, SAP, Information Systems, Developer, Computer Science, Technology Display original ad

Projektleiter Tunnelbau Schweiz    OrtRegensdorf oder Sargans - Schweiz ProfilProjektleiter,Ingenieur SprachenDeutsch, idealerweise auch Französisch         Amberg Engineering ist eine erfolgreiche international tätige Ingenieurunternehmung mit herausragender und langjähriger Erfahrung im Untertagbau und Spezialtiefbau. Mehr als 200 engagierte Mitarbeiter im In- und Ausland sorgen für eine qualitativ hochstehende Auftragsabwicklung. Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Regensdorf, Sargans suchen wir einen: Projektleiter Tunnelbau Schweiz  Ihre Aufgaben:  Sie engagieren sich aktiv in der Bearbeitung, Koordination und Leitung von interessanten Projekten und Ingenieuraufgaben im Tunnel und Untertagbau, insbesondere in der Planung und Projektierung von Infrastrukturanlagen, und übernehmen Verantwortung für die technische und administrative Führung der Aufträge. Das Arbeitsgebiet wird bereichert durch spannende Kontakte mit Vertretern der privaten und öffentlichen Bauherren und mit anderen Partnern.  Ihr Profil:  Sie sind Bauingenieur und verfügen über mehrjährige Erfahrung im Tunnelbau (TBM, SPV, etc.), bzw. Untertagbau. Ihr vertieftes Wissen konnten Sie von der Planung bis zur Realisierung von Tunnelbauwerken in Fels und Boden vorzugsweise im nationalen Umfeld kontinuierlich weiterentwickeln und erfolgreich anwenden. Kenntnisse von analytischen und numerischen Tools in der Geotechnik runden Ihr spannendes Profil ab. Sie arbeiten team- und zielorientiert, sind eine gewinnende Persönlichkeit und verfügen über gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und idealerweise auch in Französisch.  Ihr Arbeitsumfeld:  Wir bieten Ihnen eine anspruchsvolle und spannende Herausforderung in einem schweizerischen Unternehmen mit internationaler Ausrichtung, kurzen Entscheidungswegen und einer familiären und kollegialen Firmenkultur. Sie erhalten einen breiten Handlungsspielraum mit hoher Selbständigkeit. Sind Sie ein intelligenter Machertyp und wollen aktiv zum Erfolg beitragen? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre vollständigen elektronischen Bewerbungsunterlagen per E-Mail an [email protected] Amberg Engineering AG, Carmela Petriello, Human Resources Manager, Trockenloostrasse 21,8105 Regensdorf-Watt, Tel. +41 44 870 91 10www.amberg.ch     Interessiert? bewerben sie sich jetzt! Country Manager Systems Engineering / CTO    Why you'll love Cisco  We change the World, you will become passionate about your employer and the brand you represent. Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more meaningful than ever before in our lives. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas impact everything; here that means we take creative ideas from the drawing board to dynamic solutions that have real world impact. You'll be part a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and you'll take part in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be encouraged and inspired.       What You'll Do  You will provide technical direction and business guidance to the sales team. You will drive revenue through account planning, resource planning and allocation. You will actively develop and maintain a team of high-performing Systems Engineers (SE) and continually seek creative methods for improving team performance. You will help meet operational revenue goals by driving creative programs and leading day to day activities. You will lead and grow Systems Engineering team talent and expertise and learn how to build a territory plan by compiling SE feedback and adding knowledge of market demand. You will create a technical resource plan for territory and collaborate with Regional Managers to prioritize and target team opportunities; review quantitative information to identify and explain trends. You will understand mechanisms for establishing team capacity, improving team performance and align resources to deliver on commitments and get results  Lead team to technical account strategies that align to customer business requirements and goals; assign resources appropriately Assist in qualified partner identification where appropriate Monitor and approve requests for customer-focused pre-sales resources Track and report team metrics for a given opportunity Monitor and measure team progress against business plan and recommend changes as needed Interact with business units to provide support for local region Lead multi-functional projects within area of responsibility Facilitate communications and understanding of customer requirements between customers, corporate, and the field. Actively seek feedback on self; recognize own capabilities and take initiative to continually improve Advocate for continual improvement in customer experience to increase brand loyalty for Cisco Understand drivers of customer satisfaction, strive to improve customer experiences and maintain and monitor high levels of customer satisfaction in assigned territory.        Who You'll Work With  Systems Engineering team in Switzerland comprises of very talented and motivated engineers. We play different roles in the area of account pre-sales management, technology deep dive, partner advocacy and engineering leadership. We place emphasis on individual development and relevancy in the market place, and strong advocate of Cisco’s own certification programs. We work closely together to help our customer with their business problems. Our team possess diverse engineering expertise and we are constantly on a look out for new skill sets to add to our team capability. This role allows flexibility, customer engagement, groundbreaking technology and career mobility. Teaming with Sales Specialist and Account teams, you will jointly engage with the customer, finding ways to pursue your customer's concerns and challenges and will make customers more agile, improve your career and bring groundbreaking technology into the light. You are a Leader for technical specialist team that acts in an increasingly consultative fashion and is looked at as a guide, or trusted technical advisor by the account team and customers.       Who You Are  Ideally you will have 10+ years’ related experience in the associated technology industry and 5+ years’ management experience and leadership of technical pre-sales teams. You are comfortable with customer management practices together with an in-depth understanding and experience in management of all aspects of sales support processes. As such, excellent communication skills to assist at the Customer Management Interface level, including negotiation and presentation skills, are required.       Our minimum requirements for this role:   You have strong Pre-Sales track record within the technology industry. 5+ years management experience working with diverse teams and employees through mentoring, coaching and skill development. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Excellent leadership, coaching and mentoring skills. Ideally, the ability to understand and be conversant about company, its solutions, and product strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats. Comfortable evangelizing the value of Cisco products and solutions with passion and confidence. Cisco product experience or relevant experience in key competitor offerings in technology area of emphasis required.        Why Cisco  At Cisco, each person brings their different talents to work as a team and make a difference. Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better. We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart-cities to your everyday devices. We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. #LI-AM1    #LI-PRIORITY     Display original ad

Praktikum bei Amberg Engineering AG    OrtRegensdorf - Schweiz ProfilPraktikant,Ingenieur SprachenDeutsch         Amberg Engineering ist eine erfolgreiche international tätige Ingenieurunternehmung mit her-ausragender und langjähriger Erfahrung im Untertagbau und Spezialtiefbau. Mehr als 200 engagierte Mitarbeiter im In- und Ausland sorgen für eine qualitativ hochstehende Auftragsabwicklung. Gemäss Einsatzplanung für 2019/2020 stellen wir jeweils zwei Praktikanten parallel ein. Zusätzlich besteht die Möglichkeit eines längeren Praktikums auf einer Baustelle  Aktuell Offene Stellen:   Reguläres Praktikum: ab Sept. 2019 / 3 - 6 Monate, Standort Regensdorf (Schweiz), Einsatz in Projekten des Neubaus und der Bauwerkserhaltung, kurze Bauleitungseinsätze möglich Reguläres Praktikum: ab März 2019 / 3 – 6 Monate, Standort Sargans (Schweiz), Einsatz in Projekten des Neubaus und der Bauwerkserhaltung, kurze Bauleitungseinsätze möglich Bauleitungspraktikum: 6 - 12 Monate zwischen Mai 2019 – April 2021 (Details auf Anfrage)   An wen wir uns wenden: Bauingenieurstudenten ab dem 5./6. Semester mit Interesse an Untertagbau und/oder Geotechnik, Vertiefungsrichtungen sind weniger wichtig.  Fachrichtung / Vertiefungsrichtung: Keine Vorkenntnisse nötig, aber von Vorteil.  Aufgabengebiete: Mitwirkung in allen Teilbereichen des Ingenieurberufes im Untertagbau, z. B. Projektierung von technischen Lösungen, Begleitung der Planerstellung, statische / geotechnische Berechnungen und Nachweise, Kostenkalkulationen, Entwickeln von Bauabläufen, Verfassen von Technischen Berichten, Unterstützung bei der Projektadministration und so weiter.  Einsatzgebiete: Projektierung von Bauwerken im Tief- und Untertagbau (Tunnel, Schächte, Kavernen, Stützbauwerke, etc.) für Bahn- und Strassenverkehr, Infrastruktur, Wasserkraftanlagen und so weiter, Unterstützung der örtlichen Bauleitung auf der Baustelle.  Unterstützung bei der Wohnungssuche: Auf Anfrage bieten wir Hilfestellung, ansonsten Sache der Praktikanten. Für längere Bauleitungseinsätze kann allenfalls eine Unterkunft vor Ort zur Verfügung gestellt werden.  Arbeitsbewilligung: Bei einem Praktikum von drei Monaten via Meldeverfahren (Organisation durch Amberg Engineering AG). Bei einem Praktikum von mehr als drei Monaten ist dies Sache des Praktikanten, unterstützt durch die Amberg Engineering AG.  Entlöhnung: Auf Anfrage  Themen für Diplomarbeiten: Wir stellen keine Themen zur Verfügung. Abklärungen auf Anfrage von Studenten. Voraussetzung sind vertiefte Vorkenntnisse in Geotechnik und/oder Untertagbau (Ausbildung oder frühere Praktika).
